Preview:
Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Andreas Lambertz and Axel Bellinghausen compete for the spot on the left wing.Ken Ilsö and Andrey Voronin both have chances to start behind the striker.Dani Schahin could get another chance up front, although Stefan Reisinger and Nando Rafael are options for the starting line-up as well.Manager Meier has no new injury concerns.Schalke's team news states that Atsuto Uchida and Joel Matip compete for a spot in the back-four. Julian Draxler will most likely return to the starting line-up, but Ibrahim Afellay is an option for the spot on the left wing as well.Manager Stevens has no new injury concerns and could field an unchanged or very similar team to the last matchday.

Düsseldorf have had a great start to the season with three draws and two wins from five matches. They are unbeaten and have not conceded a goal so far.Schalke have enjoyed a solid start as well and they are one point ahead of Düsseldorf in the table. They have a lot of quality players, but it remains to be seen if some of them can finally improve their form.Expect this to be a close game from the outset. Both teams are strong defensively and will have to be patient.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Sven Bender, Moritz Leitner and the returning Ilkay Gündogan compete for the spot alongside Sebastian Kehl. Manager Klopp might give the more defence-minded Sven Bender the nod with his team having conceded six times in the last two matches.Kevin Großkreutz and Mario Götze could return to the starting line-up. Ivan Perisic and Marco Reus (against his former club) would drop to the bench.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Roel Brouwers will replace the suspended Martin Stranzl at centre-back.Alexander Ring and Patrick Herrmann compete for the spot on the right wing.Manager Favre could switch back to a 4-4-2 system with Mike Hanke starting alongside Luuk de Jong.

Dormtund have only won one point from their last two games and conceded six goals during that time. The players need to find their focus again and can't solely rely on their attacking quality.Gladbach have had a difficult start to the season as well. There is a lot of work to do for manager Favre and his team. After they had to reshape the squad in the summer, there is no clear system and balance yet.Expect this to be a competitive game with Dortmund being slight favourites at home. This is a massive chance for both clubs to regain confidence with a result against a strong opponent.

Hamburg's team news states that Petr Jiracek returns from suspension and is an option to start instead of Tolgay Arslan. Hamburg were in good form against Gladbach and after a win against Dortmund the week before, the team has regained a lot of confidence and is on their way up.Hannover reacted well to their loss at Hoffenheim last weekend, beating Nürnberg 4-1 in midweek. With the return of Szabolcs Huszti, they regained a lot of quality and have improved massively on the attack.Expect this to be an intense game. Leverkusen recovered well from their heavy loss at Dortmund three match days ago, and are back on track after four points from their last two matches. Creativity in midfield is still a problem.Fürth have had a difficult start to their first Bundesliga season with four points from five matches so far. They lack a real goalscorer up front and need to improve defensively as well to have a chance of staying up.Expect Leverkusen to dominate the game from the outset. They should be favourites at home.

Nuernberg's team news states that Marcos Antonio will most likely have to wait for a start at centre-back, after some good performances in pre-season, although Per Nilsson an Timm Klose did not look too solid lately.Timo Gebhart, Robert Mak and Mike Frantz all compete for the spot on the right wing with the former Stuttgart player possibly getting a chance against his old club.Tomas Pekhart and Sebastian Polter compete for the spot up front.Stuttgart's team news states that Manager Labbadia has to make a difficult decision at centre-back with Maza and Georg Niedermeier both not in their best form.Ibrahima Traoré and Shinji Okazaki compete for the spot on the left wing, with Arthur Boka most likely to get the nod ahead of Christian Molinaro at left-back.Cacau and Tamas Hajnal both have chances to start behind lone striker Vedad Ibisevic.Martin Harnik returns from suspension to start on the right wing.

Nürnberg made a good start to the campaign, but after two defeats in their last two games, they need to regain focus and confidence. After being promoted to the Bundesliga this summer, Frankfurt have won 13 points from five matches so far and are second in the table, only behind Bayern. Wolfsburg's team news states that Josué and Christian Träsch compete for a spot in central midfield.Vierinha will probably start on the left wing again, with Ivica Olic dropping to the bench.Otherwise, manager Köstner is unlikely to make any more changes.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that The injured Anderson could be replaced by Vadim Demidov at centre-back this time round, as Heiko Butscher is out with a cold as well.In midfield, manager Veh is like to keep the same players.Karim Matmour returns from suspension to replace Olivier Occean up front.

After three games without a win, Wolfsburg were lucky to beat Dortmund last weekend and the team should be full of confidence for the last game before the winter break.Frankfurt have recovered well from two heavy losses in a row, 4-1 win against Bremen last time out. With another good result here, the newly promoted team could keep a top four spot until January.Expect this to be a close game from the outset.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Captain and goalkeeper Tim Wiese, who has not been in good form for the last few months, won't be in the squad until January, allowing Koen Casteels to start once again.Interim manager Kramer will most likely start with a 4-3-3 again to have an extra midfielder in the middle.Eren Derdiyok should keep his spot up front, although Joselu and Sven Schipplock have chances to play as well.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Neven Subotic returns from injury to replace Felipe Santana at centre-back.Sebastian Kehl and Sven Bender are both injured, meaning the more attack-minded Ilkay Gündogan and Moritz Leitner will probably start in central midfield again.Ivan Perisic and Kevin Großkreutz are the first options from the bench.

Interim manager Kramer lost his first game last weekend and a match against Dortmund is a very difficult task as well. Hoffenheim are in a dangerous position, already six points behind Düsseldorf in 15th place.Dortmund were unlucky to lose against Wolfsburg last time out and they are already 14 points behind Bayern at the top. If they don't start to close the gap this weekend, a defence of their title seems very unlikely in the second half of the season.Expect Dortmund to dominate the game from the start. They are heavy favourites against a shaky Hoffenheim team.

New signing Raffael will probably start on the bench.Ciprian Marica will replace the injured Klaas-Jan Huntelaar up front.Hannover's team news states that Konstantin Rausch and Christian Pander compete for the spot at left-back.New signing Johan Djourou could replace Karim Haggui at centre-back.With Lars Stindl still injured, Jan Schlaudraff could get another chance on the right wing.Didier Ya Konan is at the AFCON and won't be available in January. Artur Sobiech and Mohammed Abdellaoue compete for his spot up front.

Bayern's team news states that Jerome Boateng and Daniel van Buyten compete for a spot at centre-back.Javi Martinez will most likely start ahead of Anatoliy Tymoshchuk.Mario Mandzukic and Mario Gomez compete for the spot up front.Bayern have announced that manager Heynckes will retire at the end of the season and Pep Guardiola will take over in the Bavarian capital in the summer.Greuther Fuerth's team news states that Fürth could return to a 4-2-3-1 system again, with Gerald Asamoah dropping to the bench.Lasse Sobiech will replace the suspended Mergim Mavraj at centre-back.Heinrich Schmidtgal is injured, meaning Rahman Baba could keep his spot in the team for now.With Edgar Prib out injured as well, Bernd Nehrig should get a chance in central midfield.New signing Nikola Djurdjic won't be able to make his debut this weekend, because of an illness.

Bayern have dominated the Bundesliga this season and they are nine points clear at the top of the table. The team needs to improve a lot to reach at least 16th place in order to avoid relegation.Bayern will most likely dominate the game in all departments. They are heavy favourites at home.

Leverkusen's team news states that At right-back, Daniel Carvajal returns from suspension to start instead of Sebastian Boenisch, who could switch to the left side.Stefan Reinartz was suspended as well and returns to his position in defensive midfield with Jens Hegeler dropping to the bench.Gonzalo Castro will most likely keep his spot on the right flank, with Sidney Sam having to wait for his chance to return.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Anderson is still out injured and will be replaced by winter signing Marco Russ.In midfield, manager Veh is likely to keep the same players.Karim Matmour and Olivier Occean compete for a spot up front.

Manager Streich has turned one of the favourites to go down into a very good football team.The two surprising teams of the season play each other this weekend. Expect a close and competitive game.

Gladbach have finally found stability, but they need to decide home games in their favour earlier on then they have been. Hamburg's team news states that With Michael Mancienne out injured for several weeks, Jeffrey Bruma will get his chance at centre-back.Tolgay Arslan and Per Skjelbred compete for a spot in central midfield.Maximilian Beister and Heung-Min Son both have a chance of starting alongside Artjoms Rudnevs. The South-Korean should be slightly ahead in manager Fink's thoughts.Werder Bremen's team news states that Clemens Fritz could drop to the bench if Theodor Gebre Selassie and Lukas Schmitz keep their places in the starting line-upMarko Arnautovic returns from suspension to start on the right wing.On the left wing, Niclas Füllkrug competes for the spot with Eljero Elia.Manager Schaaf will most likely field a 4-1-4-1 system, with Nils Petersen as a lone striker.

Stuttgart's team news states that New signing Felipe will probably start on the bench, with Serdar Tasci and Georg Niedermeier in solid form.William Kvist could return to the starting line-up this weekend to play in defensive midfield.Vedad Ibisevic returns from suspension to replace Shinji Okazaki up front. Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that New signing Martin Latka could start alongside Stelios Malezas, who returns from injury.Leon Balogun and Tobias Levels compete for the spot at right-back.Ken Ilsö could start in central attacking midfield, with Robbie Kruse switching to the left wing and Axel Bellinghausen dropping to the bench.Stuttgart's team news states that Gotoku Sakai returns from suspension and could replace Cristian Molinaro, who is in poor form at the moment, at left-back.William Kvist will keep his spot in defensive midfield, with Christian Gentner and Raphael Holzhäuser most likely starting in front of him.Martin Harnik is suspended for one game and could be replaced by Shinji Okazaki on the right wing.

Düsseldorf are still eight points above the relegation play-off spot, but they need to improve after two straight losses. Hamburg's team news states that With Michael Mancienne still injured, Jeffrey Bruma will get another chance at centre-back.Tolgay Arslan and Per Skjelbred compete for a spot in central midfield.Manager Fink could field an unchanged eleven after a derby win against Bremen last weekend.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Carlos Zambrano, Anderson and Marco Russ compete for two spots at centre-back.In midfield, manager Veh is likely to stick with the same players.New signing Srdjan Lakic could make his debut up front, with Karim Matmour dropping to the bench.

Hamburg have performed well in January, but the team needs to find consistency. Hoffenheim's team news states that Heurelho Gomes will make his debut in goal, with former captain and number one, Tim Wiese, not being in the squad after several poor performances.Jannik Vestergaard could start alongside Matthieu Delpierre at centre-back again, with new signing David Abraham made to wait for this debut.Danny Williams could replace the injured Sejad Salihovic in central midfield again.With Eren Derdiyok out of form an Joselu doubtful with a minor injury, Igor de Camargo could make his debut up front.Heurelho Gomes has arrived on loan but probably won't be involved here.Freiburg's team news states that Mensur Mujdza returns from injury, but Vegar Hedenstad should keep his spot at right-back for now.In defensive midfield, Cedric Makiadi has returned from the AFCON in time for the game, but it remains to be seen if he will replace Johannes Flum immediately.Jan Rosenthal and Karim Guédé compete for a spot up front.

Hoffenheim are in poor form; nine games without a win in the Bundesliga. They do not have more individual quality than Hoffenheim, but certainly a much better system.Expect Freiburg to press hard in order to set up quick counter attacks. Mainz's team news states that New signing Niki Zimling could start alongside Julian Baumgartlinger in central midfield.Nicolai Müller and Marcel Risse compete for the spot on the right wing.Elkin Soto and Marco Caligiuri both have a chance of starting on the left flank.Adám Szalai is suspended and will most likely be replaced by the returning Shawn Parker.Bayern's team news states that Jerome Boateng and Daniel van Buyten compete for a spot at centre-back, but the latter is likely to keep his place with the Champions League games against Arsenal in mind, for which Boateng is suspended.Javi Martinez and Luiz Gustavo compete for the spot alongside Bastian Schweinsteiger.With Xherdan Shaqiri injured, Arjen Robben is the first option on the bench to replace Thomas Müller or Toni Kroos.

Mainz are in impressive form and are fifth in the table. Dortmund have won their last four Bundesliga games in a row and after a victory at rivals Leverkusen last week, the team is full of confidence. Hertha have won back-to-back games again and currently sit in an amazing third spot. They are a well-organised unit and boast the league's best home record this season, having won all of their six matches at the Olympiastadion so far.Bremen left the relegation zone after a 2-1 win against Ingolstadt last weekend. They have the league's worst defence though and desperately have to improve their balance to avoid being put under pressure so often against better teams.Expect this to be an open game, with several chances at both ends of the pitch. Hertha have home advantage and are favourites here.

Ingolstadt's team news states that Tobias Levels challenges Florent Hadergjonaj for his spot at right-back.Anthony Jung could switch to a more defensive-minded role on the left, to replace the suspended Markus Suttner.Moritz Hartmann could switch to the left wing in this case, making way for striker Darío Lezcano to return up front.RBL's team news states that Stefan Ilsanker will start at centre-back again, with Marvin Compper and Kyriakos Papadapoulos both injured.At right-back, Lukas Klostermann and Bernado are still injured, and with Stefan Ilsanker having to fill in centrally, Benno Schmitz should get another chance to start unless he fails to recover from suspected concussion suffered against Schalke last time out. In the case in which he is not fit to play, captain Dominik Kaiser could have to deputise at right-back as a fifth choice here.

Ingolstadt are bottom of the table after suffering a crucial defeat in relegation battle at Werder Bremen last weekend. They have become more stable defensively under new manager Maik Walpurgis, but still struggle to get anything going in attack against well-organised teams.RB Leipzig are still top of the table and remain one of two undefeated teams in the league. They've won 10 of their opening 13 Bundesliga games in their first ever season in the German top-flight. They are currently on an eight-game winning streak and continue to play an aggressive pressing game despite having to deal with several injuries at the back.Expect Leipzig to try to put pressure on Ingolstadt from the outset.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Tony Jantschke and Jannik Vestergaard both have a chance of starting at centre-back.Julian Korb and Fabian Johnson compete for the spot on the right flank, with Ibrahima Traoré still out injured.Tobias Strobl is the first option, should manager André Schubert make any changes in central midfield.Mainz's team news states that Daniel Brosinski and Gaetan Bussmann compete for the spot at left-back.Jean-Philippe Gbamin is back from suspension, but could remain on the bench for now, after André Ramalho did well in his absence.Up front, youth player Aaron Seydel could get a chance to replace the suspended Jhon Córdoba, after he scored in his Bundesliga debut at Hertha a fortnight ago.

Gladbach are without a win in eight straight Bundesliga matches and struggle massively with their balance at the moment. They are without a home win in four games in a row, having been very strong at the Borussia-Park before.Mainz have lost three straight matches on the road and struggle with injuries and suspensions as well. They fielded a weakened team in the Europa League on Thurday night, as they were already eliminated from the competition, and can now focus on the Bundesliga again with the aim of picking up results.Expect this to be a hard-fought game from the outset, with Gladbach under pressure to finally get a win.

Schalke's team news states that Sascha Riether could replace the suspended Benedikt Höwedes at centre-back.Max Meyer and Yevhen Konoplyanka compete for the spot in central attacking midfield.All in all, manager Markus Weinzierl has no reason to make any further changes.Leverkusen's team news states that Wendell and Tin Jedvaj compete for a spot in the back-four.Julian Baumgartlinger should start in defensive midfield, with Kavin Kampl out injured.Stefan Kießling, Joel Pohjanpalo and Kai Havertz compete for a spot in the starting XI, with Admir Mehmedi and Kevin Volland still injured as well.

After seven Bundesliga games without defeat, Schalke lost at Leipzig last weekend and the team wants to get back on track again here. They won their Europa League group and managed to rest some of their key players on Thursday night, to have them available and fully fit here.Leverkusen have only won one of their last four league matches and are struggling to find their balance again this season. They have conceded nine goals in that period and will have to improve in midfield to get a result against a well-organised Schalke team.Expect this to be a competitive game from the outset.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Jeremy Toljan and the more attack-minded Steven Zuber compete for the spot on the left flank.Sebastian Rudy could return from injury to replace Eugen Polanski in defensive midfield.Mark Uth could come in as a third striker, should manager Julian Nagelsmann decide to switch to a 3-4-3 formation and drop one of his midfielders.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Matthias Ginter and Marc Bartra could start at centre-back here, with Sokratis still a doubt.Felix Passlack could fill in at right-back, with Lukasz Piszczek a minor doubt as well.In midfield, Mario Götze and Raphael Guerreiro are both expected to return from injury and possibly start ahead of Gonzalo Castro, who was not able to train with the team until Thursday.

Hoffenheim are the only unbeaten team left in the Bundesliga, but four of their eight draws have come in their last five matches. They play from a solid defensive base now and wait for chances on the break.Dortmund are only one point behind Hoffenheim and have a huge chance to make a step forward here. Injuries keep costing them consistency and the team has to be careful to not get caught on the counter-attack here.Expect Dortmund to dominate possession and Hoffenheim to try to hit them on the break.

Augsburg's team news states that Augsburg surprisingly sacked manager Dirk Schuster in midweek because they were not satisfied with the team's style of play and had different views on the club's future. Youth manager Manuel Baum has taken over on an interim basis.Jeffrey Gouweleeuw is back in full training and provides an option to replace Christoph Janker at centre-back.Gojko Kacar will most likely replace the suspended Dominik Kohr in central midfield.Other changes are possible under new manager Baum, but he has very few options in attacking positions due to several injuries.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Jannik Vestergaard, Julian Korb and Tony Jantschke compete for two spots in the starting XI, with manager André Schubert either fielding a 3-4-1-2 or a 4-4-2 here.Christoph Kramer has recovered from an infection and could replace Tobias Strobl in central midfield.Otherwise, Schubert does not have a lot of options to make any changes.

Augsburg currently sit four points above of the relegation play-off spot, but did not sack manager Dirk Schuster based on results. They hope to press earlier again under their new coach and want to become more versatile on the break, which could prove difficult at the moment because of several injuries up front and on the flanks.Gladbach won against Mainz last weekend, having ended an eight game streak without a Bundesliga win before. They are in the bottom half of the table as well and could take a huge step forward with another victory here.Expect Gladbach to try to control the game from the outset.

Mainz's team news states that Gaetan Bussmann and Daniel Brosinski compete for the spot at left-back.André Ramalho should replace the suspended Jean-Philippe Gbamin in defensive midfield.Up front, Jhon Córdoba returns from a one-match ban to lead the line.Hamburg's team news states that Emir Spahic is fully fit again and will replace the suspended Johan Djourou at centre-back, while Cléber is on his way to Brazil to finalise a transfer to Santos FC.With Lewis Holtby suspended, Michael Gregoritsch will most likely switch back to attacking midfield, making way for Bobby Wood to return to the starting XI up front.Otherwise, manager Markus Gisdol has no reason to make any changes.

Mainz have lost three straight Bundesliga matches and need to regain confidence at home. They will be glad to head into the winter break next week to rest after an intense first half of the season.Hamburg are unbeaten in four straight league matches and have won back-to-back games against direct opponents in relegation battle. The team has finally adapted to manager Markus Gisdol's high pressing and have climbed up to the relegation play-off spot.Expect Mainz to try to control the game and Hamburg to force them to play long balls with high and intense pressing from the off.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Jaroslav Drobny will continue to start in goal after overcoming a calf injury.Clemens Fritz and Zlatko Junuzovic compete for a spot in central midfield.Otherwise, manager Alexander Nouri has no reason to make any changes.FC Koln's team news states that Manager Peter Stöger could field a back-three again here, with several key players still out injured.Artjoms Rudnevs and Simon Zoller compete for a spot in the starting XI.Otherwise, Stöger has very few options to make further changes.

Bremen are full of confidence after an impressive away win at Hertha last weekend, with the hosts having won all of their previous home games at the Olympiastadion before. It was Werder's second straight win and the team has improved its situation in relegation battle after the returns of Max Kruse and Claudio Pizarro, who add a lot of quality and experience up front.Köln are struggling for consistency at the moment and will be glad to head into the winter break soon, with several key players not available at the moment. They are still well-organised and strong on the break though and picked up a point against a strong Dortmund side last weekend.Expect this to be a hard-fought game with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Ricardo Rodríguez is a doubt with a knee injury and could be replaced by Jannes Horn.Paul Seguin and Maximilian Arnold both return from suspension and are likely to start in central midfield.Luiz Gustavo and Julian Draxler could both be left out of the starting XI and possibly the match-day squad again, as they are looking to move on from Wolfsburg in the winter break.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Michael Hector could fill in at centre-back, with Makoto Hasebe possibly switching to the right to replace the suspended Timothy Chandler.Omar Mascarell is another option to replace Chandler on the right, with Hasebe switching to a position in central midfield in this case.Mijat Gacinovic, Ante Rebic and Branimir Hrgota all have a chance to replace Haris Seferovic in the starting XI.

Wolfsburg have only picked up a single point from their last four league matches and only sit above the relegation play-off spot on goal difference. Sporting director Klaus Allofs was sacked after a 5-0 defeat at Bayern last weekend and new manager Valerien Ismael, who was promoted from within the club, is already under pressure to pick up further points ahead of the winter break.Frankfurt are unbeaten in eight Bundesliga matches and hope to take their impressive run into 2017. They began to press higher up the pitch in their last few matches and could try to put pressure on an unsettled home team from the outset.Expect this to be an intense and hard-fought game.

Darmstadt's team news states that Interim manager Ramon Berndroth brought back several experienced players in his managerial debut last weekend.Florian Jungwirth is fully fit again and could replace Artem Fedetskyy at right-back.Otherwise, Berndroth could field an unchanged team, unless he opts to revert to a back five, which would mean another defender would come into the team.Bayern's team news states that Manager Carlo Ancelotti could use a 4-2-3-1 system instead of his usual 4-3-3 formation to enable Thomas Müller to start centrally in his favourite role.Mats Hummels and Jérôme Boateng are both fully fit again and could start here, with Javi Martinez possibly remaining on the bench.Douglas Costa is the first option, should Ancelotti decide to make a change on either wing.

Darmstadt are at the bottom of the table after six straight losses and lack quality to create chances at the moment. They have picked up all of their eight points at home so far and the comebacks of experinced players like Peter Niemeyer could help them in the relegation battle, but they almost face an impossible task to get a result from this match.Bayern have finally found their rhythm in attack in their last three league matches. They can afford to drop a midfielder for a further attacking player against minor opposition and should be able to win clearly against Darmstadt as well.Expect Bayern to dominate the game from the outset.

Leverkusen's team news states that Wendell and Tin Jedvaj compete for a spot in the back-four.Kevin Kampl could return from injury to replace Julian Baumgartlinger or Charles Aránguiz in central midfield.Stefan Kießling, Joel Pohjanpalo and Kai Havertz compete for another spot in the starting XI, with Admir Mehmedi and Kevin Volland still injured.Ingolstadt's team news states that Manager Maik Walpurgis switched to a back-three against Leipzig last weekend and is likely to stick with a 3-4-2-1 after their shock win.Markus Suttner returns from a one-match ban to start on the left wing, with Anthony Jung probably switching to a more attack-minded role.Otherwise, Walpurgis has no reason to make further changes.

Leverkusen finally won away to Schalke last weekend, but their performance was rather weak after the hosts went down to ten men in the fourth minute. They allowed a decimated home team to create several good chances on the break and will have to improve their balance to avoid this in the future.Ingolstadt are full of confidence after a 1-0 win against previously unbeaten Leipzig last weekend. They went up a spot from the bottom of the table and want to build on this result with another well-organised performance.Expect this to be an intense game with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Makoto Hasebe should switch back to the centre, with Timothy Chandler returning from suspension on the right wing.Michael Hector will therefore drop back to the bench again.Up front, Haris Seferovic and Alexander Meier could replace Ante Rebic and Branimir Hrgota.Mainz's team news states that Daniel Brosinski and Gaetan Bussmann compete for the spot at left-back.Jean-Philippe Gbamin returns from suspension and will most likely replace André Ramalho in defensive midfield.Levin Öztunali and Karim Onisiwo are the first options on the flanks, should manager Martin Schmidt decide to rotate there.

Frankfurt will want to get back on track against their rivals from Mainz to end their impressive first half of the season in positive fashion. They disappointingly lost at Wolfsburg at the weekend, but Timothy Chandler returning on the right and Alexander Meier's return up front should imprive their balance again.Mainz are full of confidence after a 3-1 win against Hamburg last weekend and could reduce the gap to Frankfurt to three points with a win here. They have improved in possession again and will look to outplay Frankfurt's midfield here.Expect this Rhein-Main-Derby to be a very intense game from the outset.

Hamburg's team news states that Johan Djourou returns from a one-match ban and could replace Emir Spahic or Gideon Jung at centre-back.With Lewis Holtby suspended for another game, Michael Gregoritsch will most likely switch back to attacking midfield again, with Bobby Wood filling in up front.Otherwise, manager Markus Gisdol most likely will not make any changes.Schalke's team news states that Thilo Kehrer and Johannes Geis should continue to start at centre-back, with Naldo suspended and Matija Nastasic still suffering from a thigh injury.Rahman Baba and Sead Kolasinac compete for a spot on the left wing.Up front, Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting is unlikely to recover from an infection in time and could be replaced by Donis Avdijaj or Fabian Reese again.

After four games without defeat, Hamburg lost 3-1 at Mainz last weekend and struggled with their high pressing in Lewis Holtby's absence. They are back in the relegation zone and desperately need a positive result against a struggling Schalke side here.Schalke have lots of injury problems at the back and up front and have therefore begun to struggle with their balance in recent games. They have only won one away game in the Bundesliga this season and hope for the winter break to arrive to recover from an intense first half of the campaign.Expect this to be an intense and hard-fought game from the outset.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that André Schubert could stick with a 4-4-2 formation here, with wing-backs Fabian Johnson and Ibrahima Traoré still out injured.Tobias Strobl will replace the injured Christoph Kramer in central midfield.Up front, Lars Stindl should return to the starting XI after suffering from the flu last weekend.Wolfsburg's team news states that Luiz Gustavo should get another chance at centre-back, despite still wanting to leave the club in January.The same applies to Julian Draxler, who wants to end his terrible Wolfsburg spell on a positive note.All in all, manager Valerien Ismael has no reason to make any changes.

Gladbach have only won one of their last 10 Bundesliga matches and are under huge pressure to end the year 2016 with a positive result. Manager André Schubert could be replaced in the winter break and he will be desperate his players can change the team's fortunes around and convince the board to keep him as manager. Wolfsburg have only won two of their last 14 league games as well and manager new Valerien Ismael is already under pressure, after sporting director Klaus Allofs was sacked last week. His team did well in a 1-0 win against Frankfurt last weekend though and players that will most likely leave the club in the winter break want to put in a strong final performance.Expect this to be an intense game between two struggling sides that have not lived up their potential this season.

Bayern's team news states that Manager Carlo Ancelotti could switch to a 4-2-3-1 formation again here to enable Thomas Müller to start in his favoured central role after his team struggled to break down Darmstadt following a return to his usual 4-3-3 system on the weekend.Javi Martínez should replace the injured Jérôme Boateng at centre-back again.Arjen Robben could return from injury to start on the right wing, while Franck Ribéry will most likely return on the left flank as well.RBL's team news states that Bernado could switch to left-back, with Marcel Halstenberg a major doubt to recover from a thigh injury in time.Benno Schmitz would fill in for Bernardo at right-back in that case.Naby Keita is doubtfiul to recover from a pulled hamstring and could be replaced by captain Dominik Kaiser.

Bayern are top of the table on goal difference only and want to make a statement against their main domestic rivals so far. They struggled to break down Darmstadt at the weekend though and could therefore switch back to a 4-2-3-1 formation here to allow an extra attacking player to come in on the flanks.Leipzig can make a huge statement here and should play aggressive and press high from the outset. Injuries at the back and the possible absence of midfield man Naby Keita could cost them important stability here though.Expect this to be a very intense game, with Bayern having to find solutions in possession and Leipzig to put them under pressure early to set up their quick counter-attacks.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Manager Pal Dardai will most likely stick to his 4-2-3-1 formation, despite several injuries at the back.Per Skjelbred and Vladimir Darida are expected to return to the starting XI in central midfield.On the flanks, Alexander Esswein and Valentin Stocker could get chances from the start as well, with Genki Haraguchi and Salomon Kalou possibly remaining on the bench.Darmstadt's team news states that Florian Jungwirth is fully fit again and could replace Artem Fedetskyy at right-back.Sven Schipplock and Antonio Colak compete for the spot up front.Otherwise, interim manager Ramon Berndroth has no reason to make any changes.

Hertha have lost back-to-back games for the first time this season and are struggling to find solutions in possession at the moment. Injuries at the back are costing them stability against the ball and manager Pal Dardai will be happy for the winter break to arrive this week.Darmstadt put in a strong performance in a 1-0 defeat to Bayern at the weekend but performed as a well-organised defensive unit. They will hope for Hertha to struggle with the ball here and look for their own chances on the break.Expect this to be a hard-fought game from the outset.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Jeremy Toljan and the more attack-minded Steven Zuber compete for the spot on the left flank.Eugen Polanski should replace the suspended Sebastian Rudy in defensive midfield.Mark Uth and Andrej Kramaric both have a chance of partnering Sandro Wagner up front.Werder Bremen's team news states that Robert Bauer and Theodor Gebre Selassie compete for the spot at right-back.Zlatko Junuzovic could replace Clemens Fritz in central midfield, with the latter currently suffering from a back injury.Otherwise, manager Alexander Nouri has no reason to make any changes.

Hoffenheim are the only team in the Bundesliga yet to lose so far, but nine draws from 15 matches also keep them well away from the top of the table. The team hopes to get a win against an improved, but suspect, Werder defence to conclude their impressive year under manager Julian Nagelsmann.Werder are four games without a loss and have left the relegation zone for now. Their defence has improved and they have plenty of quality up front after the returns of Claudio Pizarro and Max Kruse, but it remains to be seen if they are fit enough to play at that level twice a week yet.Expect Hoffenheim to try to put pressure on Werder from the outset.

Freiburg's team news states that Marc Torrejón could get a chance at centre-back, with Caglar Söyüncü a major doubt to recover from a muscle injury in time.Lukas Kübler and the more attack-minded Pascal Stenzel compete for the spot at right-back.Maximilian Philipp is fully fit again and could start on the right, possibly often changing positions with Janik Haberer over the course of the game.Bayern's team news states that Carlo Ancelotti could field a 4-2-3-1 system here with Thiago out injured, which would allow Thomas Müller to start in his favourite position again.Javi Martínez and Mats Hummels will start at centre-back with Jérôme Boateng still injured.Joshua Kimmich could get a chance in central midfield if Arturo Vidal does not recover from a rib injury in time.

Freiburg currently sit eighth after the winter break and have won five of their seven home games so far. Manager Christian Streich's team is well organised and has an attack-minded approach.Bayern defended their spot at the top of the Bundesliga table with a 3-0 win against Leipzig in December. They are looking for another win in the last game of the first half of the season here and hope to slowly improve their form ahead of the season's most important matches in the DFB-Pokal and Champions League knock-out stages.Expect Bayern to dominate the game from the outset.

Augsburg's team news states that Philipp Max and Konstantinos Stafylidis compete for the spot at left-back.Gojko Kacar or Dominik Kohr could get a chance in defensive midfield if Daniel Baier does not recover from a minor injury in time.Raúl Bobadilla is back in training, but is most likely not yet fit enough to start.Hoffenheim's team news states that Steven Zuber should replace the injured Pavel Kaderábek on the right wing.On the left wing, Jeremy Toljan is a major doubt as well and could be replaced by Philipp Ochs.Sebastian Rudy returns from suspension to replace Eugen Polanski in defensive midfield.

Augsburg currently sit in mid-table, but need to retain their form and stability to not get drawn into relegation battle in 2017. Former interim manager Manuel Baum has got the job on a permanent basis and hopes to continue to improve the team in pressing and possession, both areas where they struggled under his predecessor. Hoffenheim are the only unbeaten team in the Bundesliga after 16 matches and currently sit fifth. They have the quality to qualify for Europe and need key players Niklas Süle and Sebastian Rudy to remain focussed despite leaving the club for Bayern in summer.Expect this to be an intense game from the outset.

Darmstadt's team news states that Former Werder player Torsten Frings took over as the new Darmstadt manager over the winter break and wants his team to be more courageous in pressing and possession.Alexander Milosevic could get a chance at centre-back, with Peter Niemeyer a major doubt to recover from a muscle injury in time.Loan-signing Sidney Sam suffered from a flu during the week and could therefore be forced to postpone his Darmstadt debut for now.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Dieter Hecking took over as Wolfsburg manager over the winter break and it remains to be seen if he sticks to a back-three or switches to his favoured 4-2-3-1 system at Gladbach.January signing Timothée Kolodziejczak could make his Bundesliga debut at centre-back or left-back, with Nico Elvedi out injured.Christoph Kramer is fully fit again and should replace Tobias Strobl in central midfield.

Darmstadt sit at the bottom of the table after eight straight losses and new manager Torsten Frings faces an almost impossible task to keep the club in the Bundesliga. They currently sit five points behind the relegation play-off, with the teams above them improving under new managers.Gladbach sacked André Schubert after a poor first half the season and replaced him with Dieter Hecking, who was previously sacked at struggling Wolfsburg. The club sits only three points above the drop zone and desperately need to improve in possession in order to get results to climb up the table.Expect this to be a hard-fought match, with Gladbach being clear favourites to win, despite Darmstadt having picked up all of their eight points at home so far.

RBL's team news states that Willi Orban and Marvin Compper will start at centre-back here, with winter signing Dayot Upamecano most likely starting his Leipzig career on the bench.Stefan Ilsanker could get a chance in central midfield, if Naby Keita struggles to be fit ahead of this game.Marcel Sabitzer could switch to the left to replace the suspended Emil Forsberg, with Dominik Kaiser most likely filling in the right.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Michael Hector could get a chance at centre-back here, with Makoto Hasebe most likely switching to a position in central midfield to replace the injured Szabolcs Huszti.Mijat Gacinovic and Ante Rebic are expected to support Alexander Meier up front, with Marco Fabián still suffering from a hip injury.Manager Niko Kovac could also decide to field a second target man alongside Meier though, with Gacinovic or Rebic making way for Branimir Hrgota in this case.

Leipzig are full of confidence after an amazing first half to their first Bundesliga season. They want their high pressing and quick counter attacks to continue to work, but opponents are better used to their approach now and injuries and suspensions could cost Leipzig stability, with Naby Keita and Emil Forsberg hard to be replaced in their current set-up.Frankfurt have enjoyed a great first half of the season and sit in fourth after the winter break. They are well-organised and very solid defensively.Expect this to be a hard-fought game from the outset.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Ricardo Rodríguez could start at centre-back again, with Yannick Gerhardt filling in on the left.Luiz Gustavo will most likely stay at Wolfsburg this month and could get a chance in defensive midfield here.New signings Yunus Malli and Georges-Paul Ntep are expected to make their Wolfsburg debuts, while fellow winter arrivals Riechedly Bazoer and Victor Osimhen will most likely start on the bench.Hamburg's team news states that Christian Mathenia will keep his spot in goal for now with René Adler injured again.New signing Margim Mavraj will most likely partner Johan Djourou at centre-back as Kyriakos Papadopoulos is not yet fully integrated.Lewis Holtby returns from suspension and challenges Michael Gregoritsch and Bobby Wood for a spot in the starting XI.

Wolfsburg are in the relegation battle after a very poor first half of the season and made some major signings, while selling Julian Draxler, in the winter break to turn things around. Manager Valerien Ismael is under huge pressure to get results quickly and make use of the full potential of his quality squad.Hamburg currently sit in the relegation play-off spot after a very poor first half of the season. They have picked up all of their three wins this season in their last four matches and hope to take that form into the new year.Expect this to be a close and hard-fought game.

Darmstadt's team news states that Peter Niemeyer could return to the starting XI, with Alexander Milosevic dropping to the bench.At left-back, Fabian Holland is fully fit again and is expected to replace Leon Guwara.Loan-signing Sidney Sam could make his Darmstadt debut on the left wing, while fellow new arrival Terrence Boyd has a chance of replacing Antonio Colak up front.FC Koln's team news states that Manager Peter Stöger should stick to a 3-4-1-2 here, with central midfielder Matthias Lehmann expected to miss out again.Pawel Olkowski should get another chance on the right flank, with Marcel Risse still out injured.Leonardo Bittencourt is fully fit again and could replace Christian Clemens in attacking midfield.

Darmstadt picked up the ninth point of the season after drawing 0-0 against Gladbach in Torsten Frings' managerial debut last weekend. They are well-organised defensively, but need to improve on the break, with hope mainly lying on the shoulders of their new sgnings in this area.Köln were involved in a 0-0 draw in their last match as well, where they struggled to create chances against Mainz, despite dominating the game in the latter stages. The team needs to improve in the creative department again and have a chance of doing so with Leonardo Bittencourt returning from injury here.Expect this to be a hard-fought game from the outset.

Ingolstadt's team news states that Marcel Tisserand is still at the Africa Cup of Nations and will be replaced by Romain Brègerie once again.Darío Lezcano and Lukas Hinterseer compete for the spot up front.All in all, manager Maik Walpurgis most likely will not make any changes.Hamburg's team news states that New signings Margim Mavraj and Kyriakos Papadopoulos will start at centre-back again, with Johan Djourou out injured.Gotuko Sakai could switch to a position in central midfield to replace the suspended Albin Ekdal, with Dennis Diekmeier filling in at right-back.Michael Gregoritsch and Bobby Wood compete for the spot up front.

Ingolstadt sit one point behind Hamburg in the relegation zone after back-to-back losses. They are solid defensively, but need to improve their transitional play in order to get better opportunities on the break.Hamburg lost 1-0 at Wolfsburg last weekend, but defended well and were the more dominant team, even playing with ten men for almost an hour. They need to improve their discipline though and will face a more difficult task, creating chances against a defensive-minded Ingolstadt side.Expect this to be an intense game between two teams battling for their Bundesliga status.

Leverkusen's team news states that Jonathan Tah will replace the injured Aleksandar Dragovic at centre-back.Charles Aránguiz should return from a calf injury to replace Julian Baumgartlinger in central midfield.Lars Bender and Kevin Volland could both return to the match day squad after long-term injuries.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Timothée Kolodziejczak is suffering from the flu and could be forced to miss out here.Patrick Herrmann could return from injury, but it is probably too early for him to start already.Fabian Johnson is fully fit again and provides an option on the flanks.

Bayer Leverkusen got back on track after a 3-1 win against Hertha last weekend, but need to follow this up now in order to climb to the European places again. Players returning from injury improve manager Roger Schmidt's side in attack, but they need to continue to work on their balance.Gladbach need to improve in possession after a disappointing 0-0 draw at Darmstadt in manager Dieter Hecking's debut last time out. He has yet to find a consistent system and should opt for a back-four from now on.Expect this to be an intense game with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Koen Casteels will replace the injured Diego Benaglio in goal again.Luiz Gustavo should fill in at centre-back here, with Ricardo Rodríguez out as well.Christian Träsch and Jakub Blaszczykowski compete for the spot at right-back.Darmstadt's team news states that Daniel Heuer Fernandes will replace the injured Michael Esser in goal again.Sidney Sam could switch to a central position to replace the suspended Mario Vrancic, with Sandro Sirigu filling in the wing.Antonio Colak and Terrence Boyd both have a chance of starting up front.

Lukas Rupp or an additional striker could replace him.Pavel Kaderábek could replace Jeremy Toljan or Steven Zuber on the wings, should manager Julian Nagelsmann decide to rotate there.The same applies to Marco Terrazzino and Mark Uth up front, although Hoffenheim could well field an unchanged team again.

Expect this to be an intense game, with Hamburg possibly weakened through injuries and Hoffenheim having the quality to end the hosts' unbeaten run at home.
