Hertha Berlin's team news states that John Brooks should return from a muscle injury to start at centre-back.Marvin Plattenhardt is expected to be back from an infection as well and will most likely replace Jordan Torunarigha at left-back.Captain Vedad Ibisevic returns from a one-match ban and will replace Genki Harguchi up front.Augsburg's team news states that Christoph Janker should replace the suspended Martin Hinteregger at centre-back.Dominik Kohr challenges Jan Moravek for his spot in central midfield.Up front, Alfred Finnbogason is fully fit and could partner Raúl Bobadilla again, with Ji Dong-Won forced to settle for a spot on the bench.

Hertha lost their record as the Bundesliga's best home side after a loss against Hoffenheim last weekend. A further defeat at Gladbach in midweek puts manager Pal Dardai's team under pressure to improve in possession again to retain their top-6 spot.Augsburg have only picked up two points from their last five matches and dropped to the relegation play-off spot. They are able to create chances on the break against most opponents, but need to improve their balance in midfield again, with injuries and suspensions at the back further costing them stability.Expect Hertha to try to turn things around at home in a hard-fought game here.

Ingolstadt's team news states that With Florent Hadergjonaj serving a one-match ban and Tobias Levels suspended by the club for disciplinary reasons, Alfredo Morales could help out on the right wing here. Roger would keep his spot in central midfield in this case.Mathew Leckie is expected to replace Sonny Kittel in the starting XI after he was rested in midweek.Darmstadt's team news states that Sandro Sirigu returns from a one-match ban and is expected to replace Artem Fedetskyi at right-back.If Sidney Sam is forced to sit out here, Marcel Heller could switch to the right wing, with Leon Guwara possibly filling in on the left.Terrence Boyd, Mirko Colak and Sven Schipplock compete for the spot up front.

Ingolstadt have surprisingly won back-to-back games against direct rivals in relegation battle and are only four points behind the play-off spot now. They have shown great spirit in these games and have a huge opportunity at their hands against guests that have not picked up a single point on the road so far.Darmstadt are all but relegated and, besides not having won a single point away from home this season, have only scored four goals in their travels as well. They will try to make Ingolstadt work hard again here, but most likely do not have the quality and pressure anymore to get a result.Expect Ingolstadt to try to end a perfect week for them with another win against a team from the lower third of the table and move closer towards the play-off spot, after they seemed all but relegated in March already.

Augsburg's team news states that Manager Manuel Baum should stick with a 4-1-4-1 here after his team lacked balance with a back-three last time out.Martin Hinteregger returns from a one-match ban to replace Christoph Janker at centre-back.If Raúl Bobadilla does not recover from a calf injury in time, Halil Altintop or Georg Teigl could get a chance in midfield.FC Koln's team news states that Frederik Sörensen could start at right-back again, with Neven Subotic filling in in the centre.Leonardo Bittencourt is fully fit again and should start on the left wing.With Yuya Osako back from injury as well, Milos Jojic could drop to the bench here.

Augsburg have lost four of their last five Bundesliga matches and dropped to the relegation play-off spot as a result. The club's board backed manager Manuel Baum to turn things around, but his side lacks balance and determination at the moment.Köln want to recover from their disappointing derby defeat to Gladbach last weekend and reclaim sixth spot. With Leonardo Bittencourt and Yuya Osako returning, manager Peter Stöger's side should improve in possession again.Expect this to be a hard-fought game, with Köln being the more balanced side.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Manager Thomas Tuchel could switch to a back-three again, with Marc Bartra serving a one-match ban, while recovering from hand surgery.Felix Passlack could get a chance on the right wing, with Erik Durm still suffering from muscular problems.Marco Reus is expected to return to the match day squad here, but will most likely start on the bench.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Jesús Vallejo returns from a calf injury and will either replace Marco Russ or Andersson Ordóñez at centre-back.Danny Blum could replace Branimir Hrgota in the starting XI, if manager Niko Kovac decides to field a more counter-attacking side.Otherwise, Frankfurt are unlikely to make additional changes.

Dortmund have to recover from a very difficult week after suffering defeats at Bayern and against Monaco and their team bus being targeted by a bomb attack. Another home game should help them to deal with these in front of their supporters and get a positive result for their top-3 chase.Frankfurt are without a Bundesliga win in nine games and have dropped out of the European spots for now. They have found more stability recently, with three draws from their last four matches, but desperately need to improve on the attack again to still challenge for a top-6 finish.Expect this to be an intense game from the outset, with Dortmund being favourites to dominate this game at home.

Leverkusen's team news states that Tin Jedvaj could get another chance at centre-back, with Jonathan Tah unlikely to recover from his muscular problems in time.Roberto Hilbert, Wendell and Benjamin Henrichs compete for the two spots at full-back.Chicharito is still a major doubt as well and could be replaced by Kevin Volland again, with Kai Havertz filling in behind him.Bayern's team news states that Manuel Neuer has recovered from foot surgery and will start in goal here. Jerome Boateng has joined Mats Hummels on the sidelines but is expected to return for the second leg against Real Madrid next week. David Alaba will move into the heart of the back four as a result. Carlo Ancelotti will most likely rotate several positions ahead of the second leg of the Champions League quarter final second leg at Real next week.Players like Rafinha, Juan Bernat, Joshua Kimmich, Kingsley Coman and Douglas Costa are therefore expected to get chances from the off here, while Thomas Müller should replace the suspended Robert Lewandowski up front.

Leverkusen have only won one of their last seven Bundesliga games and keep struggling with their balance under new manager Tayfun Korkut. Currently six points off the top-6, Korkut's team also has to worry about getting drawn deeper into relegation battle if results do not improve.Bayern sit 10 points clear on top of the table after a 4-1 win against Dortmund last weekend. They have to overcome a 2-1 defeat to Real in the Champions League next week though and will have an eye on this important encounter already.Expect this to be an intense game, with Bayern's rotated XI still able to hurt an out-of-form Leverkusen side.

Mainz's team news states that Jonas Lössl is expected to return from a knee injury to replace Jannik Huth in goal.Fabian Frei should replace the suspended Jean-Philippe Gbamin in central midfield again.Yoshinori Muto and Jhon Córdoba compete for the spot up front.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Valentin Stocker is expected to replace the suspended Vladimir Darida in central attacking midfield.Genki Haraguchi provides another alternative in attacking positions.All in all, manager Pal Dardai is unlikely to make further changes though.

Mainz have dropped into the relegation battle after five Bundesliga defeats and sit above the relegation play-off spot on goal difference only. Manager Martin Schmidt has the backing of the board though and desperately needs his team to improve their balance again.Hertha have regained confidence after a 2-0 win against Augsburg last weekend and want to defend their top-6 spot now. They have lost seven successive matches on the road though and need to pick up results away from the Olympiastadion in the next few weeks.Expect this to be a hard-fought game from the outset.

RBL's team news states that Dayot Upamecano or Stefan Ilsanker will fill in at centre-back, with Willi Orban having to serve a one-match ban.Ilsanker also challenges Diego Demme his spot in central midfield.Bernardo and Lukas Schmitz compete for the spot at left-back.Freiburg's team news states that Manuel Gulde and Marc Torrejón provide further options at centre-back, should manager Christian Streich decide to switch to a back-three against a strong attacking side here.Amir Abrashi and Nicolas Höfler compete for a spot in defensive midfield.Mike Frantz could switch to the left wing to replace the injured Vincenzo Grifo.

Leipzig are back on track after three successive Bundesliga wins. With their injury concerns behind them for now, they will look to defend second spot behind Bayern and want to build upon their great home record.Freiburg are in strong form as well though, having only lost one of their last six league matches. They have climbed up to a European spot in this run, but have to compensate for the absence of winger Vincenzo Grifo over the next few weeks.Expect this to be a competitive game from the outset with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Manager Andries Jonker is expected to return to a 4-2-3-1 here, after the 4-3-3 against Schalke last weekend did not offer enough attacking output.Christian Träsch and Jakub Blaszczykowski compete for the spot at right-back.Yunus Malli, Daniel Didavi and Vierinha all have a chance of starting on the flanks.Ingolstadt's team news states that Roger is expected to replace the suspended Romain Brégerie at centre-back.Florent Hadergjonaj returns from a one-match ban to start on the right wing.Sonny Kittel, Pascal Groß and Mathew Leckie compete for two spots in attacking midfield.

Wolfsburg need to recover from a heavy 4-1 defeat at Schalke last weekend. They have been unable to distance themselves from the relegation zone under new manager Andries Jonker and only sit one point above the play-off spot after back-to-back losses.Ingolstadt on the other hand have made a very surprising return to form after they seemed to be all but relegated last month. Manager Maik Walpurgis' side has won three straight Bundesliga games against direct competitors in the relegation battle and could even catch Wolfsburg with a win here.Expect this to be a hard-fought and intense game from the outset with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Darmstadt's team news states that If Sidney Sam is forced to sit out here, Marcel Heller could switch to the right wing, with Leon Guwara possibly filling in on the left.Sven Schipplock could get a chance up front, with Mirko Colak having to serve a one-match ban.Otherwise, manager Torsten Frings is unlikely to make any changes.Schalke's team news states that It remains to be seen what team is fielded here after their 2-0 defeat away to Ajax in the first leg of their Europa League quarter final on Thursday. With the return leg next week and with it all to do, changes could be made here. Holger Badstuber should replace the suspended Matija Nastasic at centre-back, while Thilo Kehrer and Coke compete for the spot at right-back.Daniel Caligiuri is the first option to replace the injured Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting on the left wing.

Darmstadt are already preparing for a restart in the 2. Bundesliga next season. They picked up all of their 15 points at home though and should be motivated to extend that record against Schalke here.Schalke have won three of their last five Bundesliga matches with a more balanced approach and sit only four points behind the top-6 now. After a Europa League trip to Amsterdam on Thursday, which they lost 2-0, manager Markus Weinzierl will be forced to rotate here.Expect Darmstadt to try to fight hard for a result, despite being all but relegated, but Schalke's individual quality to come out on top in the end.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Santiago Garcia should get another chance on the left, but Robert Bauer could make a surprise early return this weekend. Maximilian Eggestein is expected to replace Thomas Delaney in central midfield again, with the latter suffering from a muscle injury.Serge Gnabry is expected to return from injury, but will most likely start on the bench.Hamburg's team news states that Christian Mathenia will fill in for the injured René Adler in goal again.Gideon Jung returns from injury to replace the suspended Kyriakos Papadopoulos at centre-back.Bobby Wood has been ruled out this weekend with a knee injury, which should mean Michael Gregoritsch starts up front. Otherwise, manager Markus Gisdol has no reason to make any changes.

Bremen are unbeaten in eight successive Bundesliga matches and all but out of the relegation battle. They have improved in possession after the winter break and could make another step forward with Serge Gnabry returning.Hamburg are full of confidence themselves after a 2-1 win against Hoffenheim last weekend, which extended their unbeaten run at home to nine matches. The team has only won two games on the road all season though and have to improve their intensity away from home.Expect this Nordderby to be a very intense and hard-fought game from the outset, with several opportunities at both ends of the pitch.

FC Koln's team news states that Neven Subotic challenges Frederik Sörensen for his spot at centre-back.Pawel Olkowski should return at right-back, with Lukas Klünter dropping to the bench.Marco Höger could replace the more attack-minded Milos Jojic in central midfield.Hoffenheim's team news states that Ermin Bicakcic is expected to replace the suspended Benjamin Hübner in the back-three.Jeremy Toljan and Pavel Kaderábek compete for the spot on the right flank.Nadien Amiri could return in attacking midfield, with Andrej Kramaric switching back to his natural position up front and Ádám Szalai possibly dropping to the bench.

Köln have lost three of their last four Bundesliga matches and are in danger of missing out on Europe. With other teams around them continuing to struggle as well, the race for a top-6 spot is wide open, but manager Peter Stöger's team has to improve in possession again.Hoffenheim have won four of their last five league games and want to retain third spot ahead of Dortmund. They have only won one of their last six games on the road though and have to be more versatile in their build-up against well-organised sides.Expect this to be a competitive game with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Bayern's team news states that Manuel Neuer will miss the rest of the season with a fractured left foot, meaning Sven Ureich will start in goal for the next few weeks.Manager Carlo Ancelotti will most likely rotate after his team played 120 minutes in their Champions League exit to Real Madrid on Tuesday.Jérôme Boateng and Javi Martinez are both huge doubts this weekend, while Robert Lewandowski is also carrying a knock. Mats Hummels isn't in the best shape either but has the best chance of all the centre-backs to play alongside David Alaba. Philipp Lahm, Xabi Alonso, Arjen Robben, Franck Ribéry and Lewandowski could therefore be rested for the DFB-Pokal semi-final against Dortmund next Wednesday.Mainz's team news states that Jonas Lössl has recovered from a knee injury, but Jannik Huth could nonetheless keep his spot in goal after solid performances in the Danish keeper's absence.Manager Martin Schmidt is expected to start with a back-five against Bayern and will most likely sacrifice one of his attacking players for an additional centre-back.Jean-Philippe Gbamin returns from suspension and challenges Fabian Frei for his spot in central midfield.

Bayern have only picked up a single point from their last two away games in the Bundesliga, but still have an eight-point advantage ahead of Leipzig at the top of the table. They are unbeaten at home this season and, despite rotating, want to regain confidence ahead of their cup semi-final next week.After five Bundesliga defeats, Mainz finally picked up three points in a 1-0 win against Hertha last weekend, which kept them above the relegation playoff spot. They have lost nine of their last 10 away games though and face a very difficult task here.Expect Bayern to dominate the game from the outset and Mainz to try to hit them on the break.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Jesús Vallejo could be out for the remainder of the season after suffering a thigh injury and this should lead to a change in formation: 4-2-3-1. Aymane Barkok could get a chance in central midfield if Omar Mascarell is forced to sit out with an ankle injury.Branimir Hrgota is expected to recover from a calf injury in time for kick-off.Augsburg's team news states that Philipp Max and Konstantinos Stafylidis compete for the spot at left-back.Halil Altintop and Moritz Leitner should start in central midfield, with Ja-Cheol Koo and Dominik Kohr both serving one-match bans here.If Raúl Bobadilla recovers from a calf injury in time, the Argentinian will replace Dong-Won Ji up front.

Frankfurt have not won in 10 Bundesliga matches after a strong first half of the season. They have dropped out of the European places and are in desperate need of a home win here to shorten the gap to the top-6 again.After six matches without a win, Augsburg beat Köln last weekend and kept pace with the other teams in the relegation battle. They currently occupy the relegation playoff spot and hope to get a result against an out-of-form Frankfurt side here.Expect this to be a close and intense game from the outset.

Hamburg's team news states that Kyriakos Papadopoulos returns from a one-match ban to start at centre-back.Gideon Jung will therefore switch back to his usual position in central midfield, with Walace expected to drop to the bench.Bobby Wood returns from a knee injury to repace Michael Gregoritsch up front.Darmstadt's team news states that Sidney Sam returns from injury and is expected to start on the right flank against his former club.Hamburg-loanee Sven Schipplock could get a chance up front against his parent club, with Felix Platte possibly dropping to the bench.Otherwise, manager Torsten Frings is unlikely to make any changes.

Hamburg have to regain confidence after a 2-1 defeat in the Nordderby in Bremen last weekend. After their rivals in the relegation battle picked up important points last time out, manager Markus Gisdol's side is under pressure to make up for their rather poor away form with another win at the Volksparkstadion, where his team has won seven of their last eight home games.Darmstadt surprisingly beat Schalke last weekend and, despite being all but mathematically relegated, have not lost their fighting spirit. They are still without a single point on the road this season though and have only scored six goals away from home so far.Expect Hamburg to try to put pressure on Darmstadt from the outset to get a much-needed result in the relegation battle.

Ingolstadt's team news states that With centre-backs Romain Brégerie and Marvin Matip and left-back Markus Suttner all suspended, manager Maik Walpurgis could be forced to switch to a back-four here, with Roger filling in in the centre and Anthony Jung getting a chance on the left.As a result of the system change, Sonny Kittel could come in as an extra attacking player to support Pascal Groß and Mathew Leckie in attacking midfield.Otherwise, Ingolstadt have no real options to make any changes.Werder Bremen's team news states that Robert Bauer is fully fit again and should replace Santiago Garcia on the left wing.With Zlatko Junuzovic having to serve a one-match ban, manager Alexander Nouri could decided to play Max Kruse in a slightly deeper role here.The returning Serge Gnabry or Florian Kainz would fill in up front in this case.

After they shortened the gap to the relegation playoff spot to one point with three straight wins, Ingolstadt lost 3-0 at Wolfsburg last weekend and now sit four points off 16th again. With three starting defenders suspended against a strong attacking team, manager Maik Walpurgis' side faces another very difficult challenge here.Werder are full of confidence after a strong performance in their 2-1 Nordderby win against Hamburg last weekend. They are unbeaten in nine Bundesliga matches and are out of the relegation battle and sit only two points behind the European places.Expect this to be a hard-fought and intense game from the outset, with Werder having the quality to come out on top in the end.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Patrick Herrmann, Jonas Hofmann and Ibrahima Traoré compete for two spots on the flanks.With Raffael and Thorgan Hazard both unlikely to recover from injury in time, André Hahn or Josip Drmic could get a chance up front.Otherwise, manager Dieter Hecking probably will not make any changes.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Matthias Ginter and Sven Bender compete for a spot at centre-back, while Marc Bartra is still recovering from arm surgery.Marcel Schmelzer and Raphael Guerreiro both have a chance of starting at left-back.It remains to be seen if all players recover enough from their Champions League trip to Monaco on Wednesday.

Gladbach have climbed up the table after a solid run under new manager Dieter Hecking and sit only two points off sixth spot. They need to improve their balance against potent attacking teams though and could miss two important strikers here, while they look to take advantage of a possibly fatigued away side.Dortmund have to recover from a disappointing defeat at Monaco, which put an end to their Champions League campaign in midweek. They have only won one of their last six away games in the Bundesliga and might have to rotate here to keep players fresh for their DFB-Pokal semi-final against Bayern next week.Expect this to be an intense game, with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Schalke's team news states that Captain Benedikt Höwedes should return to replace the suspended Thilo Kehrer at centre-back.Leon Goretzka isn't expected to feature after being hospitalised in Schalke match against Ajax on Thursday. Johannes Geis will deputise in his absence. Coke, who is ineligible in Europe, should be fresh to start at right-back here.Further changes are possible here, depending on Schalke's Europa League match against Ajax on Thursday night.RBL's team news states that Willi Orban returns from suspension and will most likely replace Dayot Upamecano at centre-back.Stefan Ilsanker challenges Diego Demme for his spot in central midfield.Manager Ralph Hasenhüttl has the luxury of having almost his full squad available here, offering him several options at the back and in attack.

Schalke have to recover from a shocking 2-1 defeat at Darmstadt last weekend but will be fatigued after being taken to extra time in the Europa League against Ajax. They have only won one of their last four Bundesliga matches and are in serious danger of missing out on European competition next season, but have not suffered defeat at home in their last five league outings.Leipzig, on the other hand, are full of confidence after four Bundesliga wins, having scored 12 goals in this run. They have no fresh injury or suspension concerns and seem to have rediscovered their strong attacking form from the first half of the season.Expect this to be an intense game from the outset, with Leipzig trying to put pressure on a possibly fatigued Schalke side.

Leverkusen's team news states that Jonathan Tah could return from a long-term injury to replace Aleksandar Dragovic at centre-back.Kai Havertz is expected to miss this match having not trained regularly this week as he is taking his A levels.Stefan Kießling and Chicharito both have a chance of starting up front.Schalke's team news states that Manager Markus Weinzierl will most likely switch back to a 4-2-3-1 here, with second striker Klaas-Jan Huntelaar expected to drop back to the bench.Matija Nastasic could retrun from a muscle injury to replace Holger Badstuber at centre-back.Leon Goretzka should return from a concussion as well to start in central midfield.

Leverkusen have been drawn into the relegation battle following a 2-1 defeat at Freiburg last weekend. They have only won one of their last nine Bundesliga matches and new manager Tayfun Korkut has not been able to turn things around, with the European places now further away than the relegation play-off spot.Schalke have struggled this season and sit only two points ahead of Leverkusen in the table. A four-point gap is currently separating them from seventh spot, which could be enough to qualify for the Europa League if Dortmund win the DFB-Pokal final.Expect this to be an intense game from the outset, with both teams in desperate need of a result.

Darmstadt's team news states that Wilson Kamavuaka should get another chance in defensive midfield, with Jérôme Gondorf starting in a more attack-minded role again. Felix Platte and Sven Schipplock compete for a spot up front.All in all, manager Torsten Frings has no reason to make any unforced changes though.Freiburg's team news states that Aleksandar Ignjovski and Lukas Kübler compete for the spot at right-back.Julian Schuster recovered from a knee injury and provides an option in defensive midfield.With Maximilian Philipp back from a muscle injury as well, manager Christian Streich has a further high-quality option in attacking positions.

Darmstadt could be mathematically relegated after this match, but the team wants to keep up their confidence after back-to-back wins and go down with their heads held high. Their 2-1 win at Hamburg secured them their first points on the road this season, while the side has won three of their last five home games.Freiburg currently occupy sixth spot after three wins from their last four Bundesliga matches. Manager Christian Streich's team is dreaming of qualifying for Europe, but needs to improve defensively again in the remaining matches.Expect this to be a close and hard-fought game from the outset.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Matthias Ginter and Sven Bender compete for a spot at centre-back, while Marc Bartra is still recovering from arm surgery.Marcel Schmelzer and Raphael Guerreiro both have a chance of starting at left-back.It remains to be seen if all players recover quickly enough from the DFB-Pokal semi-final in Munich on Wednesday.FC Koln's team news states that Neven Subotic and Frederik Sörensen compete for a spot at centre-back.Pawel Olkowski and Lukas Klünter both have a chance of starting at right-back.Konstantin Rausch is suffering from muscular problems and could be replaced by Marco Höger in the starting XI, with Milos Jojic expected to switch to the flank in this case.

Dortmund are full of confidence after two successive Bundesliga wins and eliminating Bayern in the DFB-Pokal semi-final in midweek. They have scored three goals in each of these encounters and have overtaken Hoffenheim to reclaim third spot last weekend, which would grant them qualification for the Champions League group stages at the end of the season.Köln are looking to qualify for the Europa League themselves, but currently sit three points off the top-six having only picked up a single point from their last three matches. Against a strong team like Dortmund, they must improve their balance again to get a much-needed result on the road.Expect Dortmund to try to put pressure on Köln from the outset and Köln to wait for opportunities on the break against possibly fatigued hosts.

Mainz's team news states that Jannik Huth has won the starting spot in goal, with Jonas Lössl now forced to settle for a place on the bench.Robin Quaison or Karim Onisiwo are expected to feature on the right wing here, with Levin Öztunali doubtful to recover a minor injury in time.If Jhon Córdoba does not recover from muscular problems himself, Yoshinori Muto should start up front again.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Nico Schulz could replace the injured Oscar Wendt at left-back.Patrick Herrmann, Ibrahima Traoré and Jonas Hofmann compete for two spots on the flanks.With Raffael, Thorgan Hazard and Josip Drmic all injured, André Hahn should get another chance up front.

After five straight losses, Mainz have picked up four points from back-to-back games to improve their position in the relegation battle. A 2-2 draw in Munich last weekend will give them a lot of confidence in front of another big task.Gladbach have to recover from back-to-back Bundesliga defeats and being eliminated in the DFB-Pokal semi-finals by Frankfurt on Tuesday. They have conceded eight goals in their last two league matches and desperately have to improve their balance to qualify for the Europa League.Expect this to be a close and competitive game with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

RBL's team news states that Bernardo and Lukas Schmitz compete for the spot at right-back.Stefan Ilsanker challenges Diego Demme for his spot in central midfield.Otherwise, manager Ralph Hasenhüttl is unlikely to make any changes, despite having almost his full squad available, offering him several options at the back and in attack.Ingolstadt's team news states that Centre-backs Romain Brégerie and Marvin Matip return from suspensions to start in a back-three.Left-back Markus Suttner is back from a one-match ban as well and ready to return on the flank.Roger could get a chance in defensive midfield, with Alfredo Morales possibly switching to a more-advanced role to replace the suspended Pascal Groß.

After four straight wins, Leipzig were left disappointed with their 1-1 draw against a fatigued Schalke team last weekend. They still have a six-point advantage on Dortmund though and want to secure second spot with another home win.Ingolstadt desperately need a result after back-to-back losses in the relegation battle. The club now sit four points behind the relegation play-off spot and is again in a dangerous position after a good, but short, run of form.Expect Leipzig to try to put pressure on Ingolstadt from the outset, as manager Ralph Hasenhüttl looks to avenge the 1-0 defeat he suffered against his former club in the first half of the season.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Niklas Moisander is expected to return from a bout of the flu in time for kick-off.With Zlatko Junuzovic back from a one-match ban and Thomas Delaney possibly returning from injury, manager Alexander Nouri has several options in central midfield again.Serge Gnabry and Florian Kainz compete for a spot behind striker Max Kruse.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Jordan Torunarigha could replace the injured John Brooks at centre-back.Maximilian Mittelstädt will most likely get a chance at left-back, with Marvin Plattenhardt sidelined as well.Vladimir Darida recovered from a knee injury and should be ready to start in central attacking midfield.

Werder have turned around their season in tremendous fashion and have good a chance of qualifying for the Europa League after being stuck in the relegation battle for long spells. They are unbeaten in ten Bundesliga matches, from which they have won eight, and are in great attacking form at the moment.Hertha currently sit four points ahead of Bremen and hope to qualify for Europe as well, despite a poor second half of their campaign so far. They have lost eight successive Bundesliga matches on the road and injuries to their back-four may cost them stability again here.Expect this to be an intense game with several chances at both ends of the pitch, but an in-form Werder side are favourites to take advantage of Hertha's current issues at the back.

Augsburg's team news states that Martin Hinteregger is expected to recover from an ankle injury in time for kick-off.Dominik Kohr returns from suspension to start in central midfield.Alfred Finnbogason is back from a one-match ban and expected to start up front, while Raúl Bobadilla is still a major doubt due to a calf injury.Hamburg's team news states that Third-choice keeper Tom Mickel will most likely start in goal here, with René Adler out injured and Christian Mathenia unlikely to recover from a knee injury in time.Walace provides a further option in central midfield should manager Markus Gisdol decide to drop Dennis Diekmeier and move Gotoku Sakai to right-back.Natural left-back Matthias Ostrzolek is the favourite to replace the suspended Filip Kostic on the flank, while Michael Gregoritsch and Luca Waldschmidt would provide more attack-minded options in this spot.

Augsburg have lost four of their last five Bundesliga matches and currently occupy the relegation play-off spot. They are under huge pressure to get a result here, with three very difficult matches against Gladbach, Dortmund and Hoffenheim ahead of them to finish the season.Hamburg are under pressure as well after they surprisingly lost to Darmstadt last weekend. They sit only one point above Augsburg and have the worst goal difference in the relegation battle.Expect this to be a close and hard-fought game from the outset.

Bayern's team news states that Jérôme Boateng and David Alaba should start at centre-back, with Mats Hummels suffering from muscular problems this week.Thiago did not train as intensively as others in the last few days because of the birth of his son and could be rested as well here.Carlo Ancelotti has also confirmed that Kingsley Coman and Javi Martinez will be rested here, while Renato Sanches and Joshua Kimmich are expected to start.Darmstadt's team news states that Wilson Kamavuaka should get another chance in defensive midfield, with Jérôme Gondorf starting in a more attack-minded role again. Felix Platte and Sven Schipplock compete for a spot up front.All in all, manager Torsten Frings has no reason to make any unforced changes though.

Bayern won the Bundesliga for a fifth successive time last weekend and want to thank their loyal home fans with another result here. They could therefore field a strong team again as they are out of the Champions League and DFB-Pokal, and help Robert Lewandowski to become the Bundesliga's top-scorer at the end of the season.Darmstadt have surprisingly won three straight league matches, but are all but relegated nonetheless. Hannover's team news states that Miiko Albornoz and Matthias Ostrzolek compete for the spot at left-back.Pirmin Schwegler is expected to return in central midfield after being rested in the cup on Wednesday.Niklas Füllkrug challenges Jonathas for a spot up front.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Sokratis returns from suspension to start at centre-back.Marc Batra could help out at right-back again, as Jeremy Toljan has struggled defensively so far.Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang is suffering from muscular problems and could be replaced by Alexander Isak or Christian Pulisic if he does not recover in time for kick-off.

Werder are deep in a relegation battle and are still without a win in the Bundesliga this season. After a strong start to the season, Augsburg have only won one of their last seven Bundesliga games. Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Marcel Sobottka or Alfredo Morales should replace the suspended Adam Bodzek in central midfield.Benito Raman could return to the starting XI to replace Markus Suttner on the wing.Rouwen Hennings offers a further option up front.Hannover's team news states that Samuel Sahin-Radlinger will get a chance in goal in the final game of the season, with Michael Esser remaining on the bench.Walace could get a chance in central midfield, if Marvin Bakalorz does not recover from muscular problems in time.Linton Maina could recover from a minor injury to start on the left flank.

Düsseldorf are stuck in mid-table obscurity after a solid season. The newly-promoted side will hope to finish their campaign with another home win.Hannover are relegated and need to rebuild in the 2. Bundesliga next season. They have only picked up five points in 16 games on the road so far.Expect this to be an open game, with not much at stake for both sides.

Freiburg's team news states that Philipp Lienhart offers an option for rotation at centre-back.Janik Haberer returns from a one-match ban to start in midfield.Lucas Höler and Florian Niederlechner provide further options up front.Nuernberg's team news states that Georg Margreitter could replace the injured Ewerton at centre-back again.Kevin Goden challenges Robert Bauer for the spot at right-back.Yuya Kubo offers a further option on the flanks.

Freiburg have only picked up a single point from their last six Bundesliga matches and have nothing to play for anymore. They will want to finish the season with a home win.Nürnberg have been relegated after a difficult season with a thin squad. They have only picked up three points in 16 matches on the road.Expect this to be an open game with several chances at both ends of the pitch.

Mainz's team news states that Stefan Bell and Niko Bungert offer further options at centre-back.Daniel Brosinski should return from injury to challenge Giulio Donati for the spot at right-back.Karim Onisiwo offers a further option up front, with Robin Quaison out injured.Hoffenheim's team news states that Stefan Posch returns from a one-match ban to offer a further alternative at centre-back, if manager Julian Nagelsmann decides to switch to a back-three.Joshua Brenet could get another chance on the left, if Nico Schulz does not recover from a knee injury in time.Leonardo Bittencourt could replace the injured Nadiem Amiri in central midfield.

Mainz are full of confidence after a 2-0 win at rivals Frankfurt last time out. They need at least a draw here and hope for other teams to drop points to at last finish in the Europa League places now.Expect this to be an open game with several chances at both ends of the pitch, which Hoffenheim have the quality to win.

Marco Reus returns from a two-match ban to start in attacking midfield.

Gladbach regained their confidence with a 4-0 win at Nürnberg last weekend. They head into the final game of the season in fourth but have a very tough task to keep hold of it, with Borussia Dortmund still with an outside chance of winning the league.Borussia Dortmund have to beat Gladbach and hope Bayern Munich lose at home to Frankfurt to win the league on the final day of the season. There is a lot at stake for both teams, so expect an intense game.

Schalke's team news states that Salif Sané returns from injury to start in the back-three. His return will push Weston McKennie back into midfield.Breel Embolo and Ahmed Kutucu compete for a spot up front.Stuttgart's team news states that Timo Baumgartl and Holger Badstuber provide further options at centre-back, if interim manager Nico Willig decides to rest Ozan Kabak.Daniel Didavi challenges Chadrac Akolo for the spot in central attacking midfield.Anastasios Donis offers a further alternative up front.

Schalke are unbeaten in their last three Bundesliga matches to avoid relegation. Having finished second last season, this campaign has been a disaster. The only positive is that David Wagner has agreed to take over for next season. Stuttgart's future in the Bundesliga will be decided by the relegation play-off, as they are five points adrift of Schalke going into the final game of the regular season. They may even rest some players to have them fresh for play-offs.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Milos Veljkovic and Sebastian Langkamp compete for a spot at centre-back.Davy Klaassen returns from a one-match ban to start in central midfield.Johannes Eggestein could get another chance up front, if Max Kruse does not recover from a thigh injury in time.RBL's team news states that Manager Ralf Rangnick could also switch to a back-three, with Nordi Mukiele starting as a third centre-back.Amadou Haidara, Tyler Adams and Konrad Laimer offer further options in central midfield.It remains to be seen if manager Ralf Rangnick rotates more ahead of the DFB-Pokal final against Bayern next weekend.

Bremen must win this game and hope for both Hoffenheim and Wolfsburg to drop points to still claim a Europa League spot. They can focus on the cup final against the Bavarians now, but will look to gain further confidence with a positive display here.Expect this to be an intense game with several chance at both ends of the pitch.

Wolfsburg have to get back on track after a 3-0 defeat at Stuttgart last weekend. They could secure a Europa League spot with a win here.Augsburg have only picked up one point from their last three matches, but are safe from relegation. Injuries keep costing them stability.Expect Wolfsburg to try to put pressure on the visitors from the outset.

Djibril Sow can slot into midfield.Mijat Gacinovic and Jonathan de Guzman are back in training and could return to the squad for the trip to the capital.Andre Silva will keep his spot after his debut goal against Borussia Dortmund with Gonçalo Paciência likely to start as Bas Dost is not yet ready for a full 90 minutes.

Union Berlin were good enough to beat Borussia Dortmund at home, while Eintracht could only draw 2-2 with the same opposition so the form suggests the Union should not be underestimated under the Friday evening floodlights in the German capital.It promises to be a close game, but Eintracht should be good enough to secure their first away point of the season, maybe even three...

Augsburg's team news states that Marco Richter is doubtful after picking up an injury in Freiburg and coach Martin Schmidt has admitted that he won't risk rushing him back too soon. André Hahn stands by.Carlos Gruezo has heavy bruising to his ankle and is unlikely to be rushed back as well.Captain Daniel Baier has missed the last two games with a calf injury, but could return to the side.Leverkusen's team news states that Leon Bailey tore a muscle in last week's Champions League defeat and will be sorely missed.Finland striker Joel Pohjanpalo has finally recovered from injury and could take a place on the bench.Aleksandar Dragovic could come into the defence with the Champions League trip to Turin in mind.Kerem Demirbay could return in midfield after shaking off a back injury.

Augsburg away is not the sort of place you want to be going, especially before a crunch Champions League away game against Cristiano Ronaldo and co in Turin.However, Augsburg have never beaten Leverkusen in the Bundesliga in 16 attempts, losing 10 times, so it would be a huge shock if FCA ended their poor run this weekend.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Steven Zuber needs an operation on his right foot, while record signing Diadie Samassékou is still feeling the effects of a thigh injury suffered while on international duty with Mali.Phillip Ochs is fit to return to the squad, but will have to make do with a spot on the bench.Sebastian Rudy will keep his spot in midfield having scored on his 200th Hoffenheim appearance.Croatia striker Andrej Kramaric is back in training after a knee injury but "is not yet ready for the squad" according to coach Alfred Schreuder.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Defender Tony Jantschke had to go off injured in the derby win against Duesseldorf, but should be available for the weekend.American midfielder Fabian Johnson continues to struggle with a back injury, while Ibrahima Traoré is also ruled out with an ankle problem.German international Lars Stindl continues to work his way back to full fitness, while coach Marco Rose has to find a spot for two-goal Derby hero Marcus Thuram up front.

Buoyed by a last-gasp win in the Rhine derby against Fortuna Duesseldorf, Gladbach can eke out at least a point at Hoffenheim, who have only won once all season.

Mainz have lost four out of five while unbeaten Wolfsburg are regressing slightly having drawn three in a row.Unable to tip an away win with any confidence, the "Wolves" may have to make do with yet another draw in Mainz.

Bayern Munich will surely have too much quality for the bottom of the table hosts. Benito Raman is still struggling with a niggling ankle problem, while ex-Spurs midfielder Nabil Bentaleb is ruled out until the winter break with a knee injury.

Schalke have risen to a lofty fifth place after three straight wins, but this is a different test of their credentials than beating the likes of Paderborn, Mainz or Hertha Berlin who have mustered only two wins between them all season.Back the league leaders Leipzig to win reasonably comfortably.

Given Werder Bremen's horrific injury situation, this looks like a routine home win for Borussia Dortmund, gaining a semblance of revenge for a painful German Cup defeat on home soil last season.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Jean Zimmer could replace Matthias Zimmermann in defence, Oliver Fink is fit but may start on the bench, with Ghanian talent Nana Ampomah getting the nod instead.Dawid Kownacki has signed a permanent deal after Fortuna triggered the option to buy the Polish striker for around €7m from Serie A side Sampdoria.Kasim Adams will surely keep his spot at the heart of defence after his goal last Sunday.Freiburg's team news states that Manuel Gulde and Marco Terrazzino can both return to the squad following injury, but will not challenge for a starting spot as wily  Freiburg coach Christian Streich looks to have stumbled upon a settled line up.However, the feel-good factor of skipper Mike Frantz's contract extension has been dampened by news of his adductor injury.

Duesseldorf have not won in four games and squandered a lead late on in Moenchengladbach to further damage morale.Freiburg are riding high in fourth having won both away games easily, but last won three away games in a row back in 2011/12.There's little to choose between the two sides and a draw is the favoured outcome.

Having won their first game last weekend, Hertha can follow up with at least a draw at struggling Cologne, who have lost four from five.

Bayern's team news states that Lucas Hernández went off feeling his knee last week in Paderborn, while David Alaba had to go off against Spurs with sore ribs meaning he had difficulty breathing. There's sure to be a bit of comedown for Bayern after their magical 7-2 Champions League win at Spurs. But Hoffenheim have never won in Munich in their Bundesliga history in 18 attempts and do not look like ending that miserable run any time soon.A routine home win is expected as the record German champions head serenely to an eighth successive Bundesliga title.

Freiburg's team news states that Freiburg coach Christian Streich looks to have stumbled upon a settled line up.Skipper Mike Frantz has extended his contract but was immediately struck down by an abductor injury.Manuel Gulde and Marco Terrazzino are fit to return to the squad, but will not challenge for a starting spot, while German U21 international Gian-Luca Waldschmidt also has to patiently wait for his chance.Mark Flekken is back in training and could make the bench here.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Mats Hummels was sorely missed in the 2-2 home draw against Werder Bremen, but the defensive rock should return provided he comes through the Champions League trip unscathed.Striker Paco Alcácer did not travel in midweek and is doubtful with an Achilles problem so Mario Götze or Julian Brandt may play in a more advanced role.Marwin Hitz is closing in on a first-team return and could make the bench this weekend.

Having sloppily dropped points against Eintracht Frankfurt and Werder Bremen, you cannot back a Borussia Dortmund away win with too much confidence at third-placed Freiburg.Providing defensive rock Mats Hummels is fit though, Dortmund could edge to victory.However, all things considered, a draw may be more likely against in-form Freiburg with so little recovery time following their midweek Champions League exertions in Prague.

Leverkusen's team news states that Lars Bender picked up a thigh injury in the warm-up against Juventus and is ruled out. Aleksandar Dragovic could replace the other Bender brother Sven in defence.Leon Bailey tore a muscle in the opening Champions League defeat and has his sights set on a return in a few weeks.Finland striker Joel Pohjanpalo has finally recovered from injury and could make a long-awaited comeback from the bench.Kerem Demirbay could return in midfield after shaking off a back injury.RBL's team news states that Ibrahima Konaté went off midway through the first half of the Champions League defeat and is ruled out for two to three weeks with a hip injury.Emil Forsberg and Diego Demme may come back into the side after being benched in midweek, while Patrik Schick could make the squad after returning to full training.Tyler Adams, Hannes Wolf and Kevin Kampl are all long-term absentees.

There's little to choose between the two sides with both looking for a reaction after woeful Champions League performances in midweekLeverkusen enjoy 24 hours more rest, but this game promises to be a mouthwatering prospect with potentially plenty of goals at both ends. An exciting score draw is the favoured outcome.

Paderborn's team news states that Expect coach Steffen Baumgart to retain the bulk of the side that pushed Bayern Munich all the way last week.Luca Kilian made his debut in the narrow 3-2 defeat and can expect to continue at the back. Sebastian Schonlau is training again in earnest following a long-standing foot injury and is also pushing for a spot in defence.Mainz's team news states that Mainz coach Sandro Schwarz became the first Bundesliga coach to be sent off last weekend. Schwarz will have to watch the game from the stands and is not allowed any contact with his side for three hours before and after the game.Florian Müller started the season as first choice goalkeeper and is fit again after injury but stand-in Robin Zentner has won the battle for the NR1 shirt.Skipper Danny Latza is fit to return but Ronaël Pierre-Gabriel is struggling with tonsillitis and Aarón Martín is ruled out with a muscle tear. Ridle Baku may have to move back into defence to cover.Jean-Philippe Mateta and Dong-Won Ji are both long-term absentees following knee operations.

The bottom two clash and both have to be eyeing three points if they are to seriously entertain thoughts of avoiding relegation, even at this early stage of the season.Back Paderborn to get off the mark with a victory, piling even more pressure onto Mainz coach Sandro Schwarz.

Schalke's team news states that Expect David Wagner to keep faith with the bulk of the side that have won four games on the trot to rocket up the table.Schalke captain and goalkeeper Alexander Nübel is struggling with an adductor muscle problem, meaning he could not train on Thursday evening. German U21 international Markus Schubert is ready to deputise for his Bundesliga debut.Salif Sané has to retain his spot ahead of Matija Nastasic in central defence after coming up trumps with another goal in Leipzig.The same applies to Welsh wunderkind Rabbi Matondo who scored on his first start in the same game.Benito Raman will not be rushed back due to a niggling ankle problem, while ex-Spurs midfielder Nabil Bentaleb is ruled out until the winter break with a knee injury.FC Koln's team news states that Kingsley Ehizibue returns from suspension, but Jorge Meré replaces him on the naughty step following his red card against Hertha Berlin.Dominick Drexler had go off early in the 4-0 hammering against Hertha and is ruled out with a muscle injury.Jhon Córdoba has failed to score in 22 games for Cologne in the top-flight now so must be in danger of losing his starting spot. Simon Terodde has looked lively as a substitute and could be given a chance from the start.Belgian Birger Verstraete is ruled out following a knee operation.

Back David Wagner's men to make it five wins on the trot with a hard-fought win over relegation worriers Cologne.
