Florian Neuhaus or Patrick Herrmann can slot into midfield.Alassane Pléa had to come off with a foot injury in the Europa League game and has to be doubtful. Raffael came on for Plea on Thursday and is an option from the start.Ramy Bensebaini might step in for Oskar Wendt at left-back.German international Lars Stindl is nearing a return to the squad after the international break.American midfielder Fabian Johnson continues to struggle with a back injury, while Ibrahima Traoré is also ruled out with an ankle problem.Augsburg's team news states that Sergio Córdova and Noah Joel Sarenren Bazee are both fit to return to the squad.Captain Daniel Baier has missed the last three games with a calf injury, but will probably be thrown straight back in.Carlos Gruezo still has some bruising to his ankle and will not be rushed back, along with Marco Richter who is struggling with a thigh injury.

Augsburg have had over a week to focus on this game, while Gladbach only returned to Germany from Turkey following Europa League action in the early hours of Friday.Back Augsburg to snatch at least a draw against tired and flagging Gladbach, who have not been playing well at home of late.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Lukas Nmecha ended up in hospital after the Europa League game and is definitely ruled out with concussion.Admir Mehmedi sat out the trip to France due to an abductor injury but could return. Felix Klaus stands by.USMNT defender John Brooks continues to be ruled out by injury, while Marcel Tisserand, Jérôme Roussillon and Josip Brekalo are all doubtful according to coach Oliver Glasner.Jeffrey Bruma is on standby again in defence. The Dutch defender had to have stitches after the Europa League game on Thursday, but is good to go said Glasner.Union Berlin's team news states that Akaki Gogia has played his last football of the year after tearing an ACL in the defeat to Frankfurt.Sebastian Polter remains on the naughty step after his foolish red card against Bayer Leverkusen.Left-back Christopher Lenz has shaken off a hip injury, while striker Siuleiman Abdullahis returns to the squad after a knee issue.However, midfielder Grischa Prömel misses out again after a more serious knee problem.

This looks like a comfortable home win, but Union Berlin will be hungry for a point against the "Wolves" who were involved away in France in a tough Europa League game on Thursday against St. Etienne. Once they've got the Europa League cobwebs out of the system, Wolfsburg should have too much power in the final third for the Union, who face a season long relegation battle.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that German international goalkeeper Kevin Trapp has busted his left shoulder and is ruled out until the New Year. Denmark international Frederik Rönnow is a more than capable understudy as shown with a clean sheet in Europa League action.Almamy Touré appears to have dislodged experienced skipper David Abraham for the moment in defence, who's been struggling with back problems.Makoto Hasebe missed the Europa League game with concussion but returned to training on Friday. Evan Ndicka stands by as he did with aplomb on Thursday with the winning goal. Once Bas Dost gets on a roll in the Bundesliga he's a hard man to stop so the Dutchman will probably start this one.Sebastian Rode can play with a special cast on his left hand.Werder Bremen's team news states that Werder's injury situation is slowly but surely starting to improve.Ömer Toprak was due to make his comeback from injury this weekend but suffered a calf injury in training on Saturday and is ruled out. Philipp Bargfrede is back after six months out with a knee injury and could deputise, while Milos Veljkovic and Sebastian Langkamp are also back in training and represent other options. Ludwig Augustinsson, Kevin Möhwald and Fin Bartels are all ruled out for the long-term following knee operations.

Eintracht Frankfurt only returned from Europa League action in Portugal in the early hours of Friday, while Werder Bremen can only improve now that their horrific injury list is abating. Bremen were good enough to get a draw in Dortmund so the visitors can certainly repeat the feat here against a potentially drained Frankfurt side, also suffering with a few key injuries themselves.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that German international Kevin Trapp has busted his left shoulder and is ruled out until the New Year. Denmark international Frederik Rönnow will continue in goal.Dutch striker Bas Dost has returned to training after picking up a muscle injury before the international break. Portuguese pairing Gonçalo Paciência and André Silva form a useful duo up front. Japan midfielder Daichi Kamada will not return to Frankfurt training until Thursday from international duty and would seem unlikely to start.Experienced skipper David Abraham has returned to training after spells of back pain but Almamy Touré will likely keep his spot in defence.Leverkusen's team news states that Leon Bailey has recovered from a muscle tear and should be available.Charles Aránguiz had to be carried off on a stretcher in Leverkusen's last game against Leipzig with a thigh injury and has been ruled out for several weeks.Dutch defender Daley Sinkgraven also suffered a thigh injury in that game and will be out for even longer than the Chile international.Striker Joel Pohjanpalo crowned his comeback after 573 days out through injury with a goal for Finland and could be an option from the bench.Jonathan Tah picked up a flu bug and had to leave the Germany squad but is likely to be fit for Friday.  Captain Lars Bender has recovered from a thigh injury and could replace Charles Aránguiz in midfield.

Expect a tremendous buzz under the Friday evening floodlights in Frankfurt at the best atmosphere in German football.Two attacking high-tempo pressing teams may well play out an exciting score draw.

Augsburg's team news states that Captain Daniel Baier has missed the last four games with a nagging calf injury, but could be thrown straight back into the fray.Marco Richter has returned to training after shaking off a thigh injury, but André Hahn is struggling with a knee problem.Jeffrey Gouweleeuw made his comeback from injury with an hour shift in a friendly during the international break. Gouweleeuw is a definite option to strengthen a porous defence.Carlos Gruezo still has some bruising to his ankle and will not be rushed back, but Sergio Córdova and Noah Joel Sarenren Bazee are both fit to return to the squad.Bayern's team news states that Serge Gnabry could not play in Estonia after picking up a muscle injury on international duty with Germany. The quadruple-scorer against Spurs is unlikely to be risked.After missing the last two games with knee pain, Lucas Hernández was deemed unfit by the club doctor but travelled for international duty with France anyway. Bayern's record signing then played a full 90 minutes against Turkey. Given his medical history, something does not quite add up but at €80million the World Cup winner is too expensive a commodity to be taking chances with.Leon Goretzka returned to training this week after recovering from a thigh operation, but will need to build up his fitness. David Alaba did not play for Austria because of a rib injury but has returned to training. Both are unlikely to be rushed back.Doubting Thomas Müller has languished on the bench for the last five games and as the only Bavarian in the first-team squad, he simply has to start in the derby.

It was very much a case of after the Lord Mayor's show for Bayern before the international break - following up a majestic 7-2 Champions League win at Spurs with an embarrassing home defeat to Hoffenheim. Expect the champions to show a reaction in the Bavarian derby with a comfortable win.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Friedhelm Funkel's side continue to enjoy little fortune with injuries, even with an elongated international break.Influential USMNT international Alfredo Morales had shaken off his muscle injury but has been struck down by flu and will not play this weekend.Skipper Oliver Fink picked up a thigh injury in training and has been ruled out, along with Aymen Barkok and Markus Suttner. Marcel Sobottka could slot into defensive midfield.But at least record signing Dawid Kownacki returned to training this week after a muscle tear, along with Jean Zimmer who has shaken off a thigh injury. Both should return to a depleted squad.Mainz's team news states that Mainz coach Sandro Schwarz will be back prowling his technical area after becoming the first Bundesliga coach to be sent off and serving a one match touchline ban.Aarón Martín, Aaron Seydel and Ronaël Pierre-Gabriel all returned to training during the international break. Seydel is not quite up to speed just yet, but skipper Danny Latza is fit to return.Jean-Philippe Mateta, Stefan Bell, and Dong-Won Ji are all ruled out long term, but there is hope that striker Mateta will play again before winter hibernation.

This is a proverbial relegation six-pointer with both sides desperate for the win. This season, Mainz have two wins and five defeats under their belt but have not drawn in 13 away games in all.Meanwhile Fortuna have just a single point from their last six games, squandering winning positions in their last five. Therefore, all told, perhaps a nervy draw is the best bet here.

RBL's team news states that Ethan Ampadu suffered concussion playing for Wales and has been ruled out. Not that the Welsh international would have played anyway for RBL.Striker Patrik Schick played for the Czech Republic while not 100% fit, and promptly suffered an ankle injury recurrence much to Julian Nagelsmann's annoyance.Defender Ibrahima Konaté will be out for a couple more weeks with a hip injury, but Kevin Kampl could return to the squad after a seven week absence.Timo Werner picked up a bad cold and could not play for Germany against Argentina but should be fine for the weekend.Tyler Adams and Hannes Wolf are both long-term absentees.Wolfsburg's team news states that Admir Mehmedi had to be subbed off after 28 minutes of Switzerland's victory over Ireland on Tuesday with a thigh injury and could have played his last football of the year.John Brooks and Paulo Otávio both made their returns in a friendly during the international break. Brooks could return to the squad but Otávio will still need to be patient.Lukas Nmecha has recovered from a concussion and will make the squad.

Leipzig provide the toughest test so far to second placed Wolfsburg's unbeaten credentials. Julian Nagelsmann's side look favourites to get the job done at home on the back of a Timo Werner goal. The striker is long overdue a goal, he hasn't scored in four games leading up to the international break.

Union Berlin's team news states that Akaki Gogia has played his last football of the year after tearing an ACL in the defeat to Frankfurt.Sebastian Polter is available again after suspension.Left-back Christopher Lenz has shaken off a hip injury, while striker Siuleiman Abdullahis returns to the squad after a knee issue.However, midfielder Grischa Prömel misses out again with a more serious knee problem.Freiburg's team news states that Right-back Lukas Kübler needs a knee operation and has probably played his last football of the year.Gian-Luca Waldschmidt and Robin Koch can now call themselves international footballers, adding €10 million to their price tags, after making their Germany debuts in the friendly last week against Argentina. Skipper Mike Frantz and Mark Flekken have both returned to training and could make the bench.

Prepare for the first meeting of the two sides in the top flight.Both were expected to be relegation fodder this season, but Freiburg sit in the lofty heights of fourth, level on points with mighty Bayern Munich, while Union Berlin have just one win all season (against Borussia Dortmund). On home soil, Union can avoid defeat at the very least.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Whisper it quietly, but Werder's injury situation is slowly but surely starting to improve.Ömer Toprak could finally slot into defence for a long-awaited comeback. Philipp Bargfrede is back after six months out with a knee injury, while Milot Rashica has impressed since his return from injury, bagging a goal against Borussia Dortmund.Central defenders Milos Veljkovic and Sebastian Langkamp are back training in earnest and could make the squad. However, Ludwig Augustinsson, Kevin Möhwald and Fin Bartels are all ruled out for the long-term following knee operations.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Expect Ante Covic to retain faith with the bulk of the side that have helped Hertha away from the relegation spots.The unfortunate Niklas Stark was denied a Germany debut against Argentina first because of a stomach bug and then clumsily hurting his leg on a hotel chair. After needing stitches in the wound, Stark is in a race against time to be fit for the "Northern" derby.Per Skjelbred required dental surgery but returned to training on Wednesday and should be fit.Netherlands winger Javairo Dilrosun returned early from U21 duty but also should take his place in the starting XI.

After three straight wins, Hertha Berlin went into the international break buoyant. That momentum could be dampened by a draw in Bremen, a result the visitors from the capital can live with though in the long run.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Germany left-back Nico Schulz returned to training during the international break and a return to the squad is in sight.Raphael Guerreiro, who has extended his contract until 2023, will probably keep his spot at left-back for now. Striker Paco Alcácer remains doubtful with an Achilles problem so Mario Götze or Julian Brandt may play in a more advanced role.Vice-captain Lukasz Piszczek suffered a muscle injury against Freiburg and has been ruled out for a couple of weeks.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose has a growing injury list to contend with as they look to defend top spot. Defenders Matthias Ginter and Stefan Lainer both had to go off in the 5-1 win against Augsburg prior to the international break. Ginter will be out for around a month with a shoulder injury, while Lainer is in a race against time to overcome an ankle problem.German international Lars Stindl has not played since April but should make his long-awaited comeback to the squad for the battle of the Borussias. Jonas Hofmann is also back in training after a knee injury and could make the bench.American midfielder Fabian Johnson continues to struggle with a back injury, while Ibrahima Traoré is also ruled out with an ankle problem.

Gladbach travel to Dortmund as league leaders but boast a less than impressive record in front of the Yellow Wall in recent years. While Dortmund struggle to keep clean sheets, Paco Alcácer's absence could be even more crucial, but Lucien Favre's charges will be keen to avoid their fourth 2-2 draw in a row in the Bundesliga.

FC Koln's team news states that Noah Katterbach made an impressive debut in the draw at Schalke and could keep his spot at left-back. German international defender Jonas Hector is fit again and may move into midfield.Belgian Birger Verstraete could return from a knee injury, while Dominick Drexler has recovered from a muscle injury. According to coach Achim Beierlorzer, both "of course are options" for the weekend provided they come through training. Defender Lasse Sobiech is ruled out for a couple of weeks with a thigh injury, while Jorge Meré remains on the naughty step following his red card against Hertha Berlin.Striker Jhon Córdoba has failed to score in 23 games for Cologne in the top-flight now so must be in danger of losing his starting spot. Simon Terodde has looked lively as a substitute and is set to start.Paderborn's team news states that Former Brighton defender Uwe Hünemeier is ruled out after picking up a training ground injury. Sebastian Schonlau will probably slot in alongside ex-Borussia Dortmund youngster Luca Kilian in defence.Paderborn have been shipping goals for fun this season so former Bayern reserve keeper Leopold Zingerle will keep goal instead of Jannik Huth.

Both sides will be desperate for the three points but Cologne have never beaten Paderborn in six attempts in the top two tiers of German football.It could be lucky seven. No more Woe de Cologne and, whisper it quietly, we may perhaps finally see a goal for Jhon Córdoba.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Germany international Sebastian Rudy will keep his spot in midfield against the club where he failed to make an impact.Ishak Belfodil has to undergo a knee operation and has been ruled out for several weeks, but Croatia World Cup striker Andrej Kramaric will return to the squad after recovering from a knee injury.Sargis Adamyan should keep his spot up front after his magnificent two-goal salvo shocked the champions Bayern in their own backyard.Florian Grillitsch suffered a knee injury against Bayern and remains doubtful.Steven Zuber is definitely out following an operation on his right foot, while record signing Diadie Samassékou is still struggling to shake off a thigh injury suffered while on international duty with Mali.Dennis Geiger picked up a muscle injury while with Germany's U21 side while Pavel Kaderábek fell ill on international duty with Czech Republic. Both should be okay for Sunday though.Schalke's team news states that Expect David Wagner to keep faith with the bulk of the side that have rocketed up the table.Benito Raman is fit to return after shaking off an ankle injury, but will struggle to dislodge Weston McKennie, who scored the fastest hat-trick in USMNT history against Cuba.Raman may come in however for Welsh wunderkind Rabbi Matondo, who scored on his first start recently.Ex-Spurs midfielder Nabil Bentaleb is ruled out until the winter break with a knee injury.

Schalke were cruelly denied a fifth straight win by a last-gasp Cologne equaliser last time out, while Hoffenheim provided the mother of all shocks by winning at Bayern Munich, where they had never won before. Both side's momentum could be slow out of the blocks after the international break and a share of the spoils might be the sensible call.

Mainz's team news states that Edimilson Fernandes sits out a one game suspension after his red card in the defeat in Duesseldorf.Skipper Danny Latza is doubtful after taking a knock to his knee. Ridle Baku seems likely to step into midfield.Aaron Seydel is back training, but still needs to build up his fitness.Jean-Philippe Mateta, Stefan Bell, and Dong-Won Ji are all ruled out long term, but there is renewed hope that striker Mateta will play again before the traditional winter break.FC Koln's team news states that Coach Achim Beierlorzer is unlikely to tinker too much with the side that won 3-0 last weekend.Noah Katterbach has made an impressive start to his Bundesliga career at left-back, which allows German international defender Jonas Hector a more attacking role in midfield.Jorge Meré is available again after a three-game suspension, while Christian Clemens is also chomping at the bit for a return from injury.Belgian Birger Verstraete is back training again after a knee injury, while Dominick Drexler has recovered from a muscle injury and both should return to the squad. Striker Jhon Córdoba has failed to score in 24 games for Cologne in the top-flight now and has lost his spot to Simon Terodde up front.

This is a genuine relegation six-pointer even at this stage of the season and there's not much between the sides. A draw is the most logical result here under the autumnal Friday evening floodlights.

Bayern's team news states that Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear against Augsburg and has probably played his last game this season.To proverbially add insult to injury, after playing for France when deemed unfit by Bayern's doctor, Lucas Hernández has now partially ruptured an ankle tendon on Tuesday and faces another operation.Javi Martinez had to go off in the Champions League win in Greece with a dead leg, but should make the squad.Leon Goretzka has recovered from a thigh operation and is another option.Union Berlin's team news states that Neven Subotic and Sheraldo Becker both missed last week's win over Freiburg through injury, but should make the trip to Munich.Akaki Gogia has played his last football of the year after tearing an ACL in the defeat to Frankfurt and striker Siuleiman Abdullahis is still struggling to shake off a nagging knee issue.Midfielder Grischa Prömel misses out again with a more serious knee problem.

Dropping points against Augsburg at the death and losing to Hoffenheim at home constitutes a crisis in Bayern terms.If Bayern lose to Union Berlin, coach Niko Kovac would likely face the sack.A comfortable home win for the record German champions and, therefore, a stay of execution is likely.

Freiburg's team news states that Alexander Schwolow had to go off with a thigh muscle injury in the defeat against Union Berlin and will be out for three weeks. Niclas Thiede came on in goal in the capital and did absolutely nothing wrong on his Bundesliga debut.However, number two keeper Mark Flekken missed the trip to the capital with flu and is the more experienced of the two options to step in between the sticks.Skipper Mike Frantz might return in midfield for Amir Abrashi.Right-back Lukas Kübler has undergone a knee operation and has probably played his last football of the year.RBL's team news states that Expect a spot of rotation from Nagelsmann after Champions League exertions in an attempt to keep his troops fresh for the long winter ahead. Kevin Kampl, Emil Forsberg and Ademola Lookman are all exciting options to have up your coaching sleeve.Ethan Ampadu is still ruled out after suffering concussion while playing for Wales.Striker Patrik Schick played for the Czech Republic while not 100% fit, and promptly suffered an ankle injury recurrence much to Julian Nagelsmann's annoyance.Defender Ibrahima Konaté is struggling with a hip injury, along with German international Marcel Halstenberg.Tyler Adams and Hannes Wolf are both long-term absentees.

Leipzig have not won in three Bundesliga games and only have a couple of days rest after Champions League action. Freiburg on the other hand will be fully focused and raring to go. However, Leipzig can return to winning ways against a Freiburg side missing their first-choice keeper.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that During the international break, the unfortunate Niklas Stark was twice denied a Germany debut first because of a stomach bug and then clumsily hurting his leg on a hotel chair. After needing stitches in the wound, Stark missed last week's draw in Bremen, but should be fit to return to the defence.Netherlands U21 winger Javairo Dilrosun is battling Dodi Lukébakio for a starting spot in what is a settled Hertha line up.Ex-Nuernberg midfielder Eduard Löwen is nearing a return.Hoffenheim's team news states that Croatia World Cup striker Andrej Kramaric marked his return to the side after a knee injury immediately with a goal and seems set to keep his spot.Ishak Belfodil underwent a knee operation and has been ruled out for several weeks.Florian Grillitsch and record signing Diadie Samassékoure both remain doubtful, but Steven Zuber is definitely out following an operation on his right foot.

Hoffenheim have won their last two games and had the quality to beat Bayern away from home so are not to be underestimated.Both teams have identical records this season with three wins and three defeats from eight games. Therefore, a third share of the spoils is a logical punt.

Schalke's team news states that Suat Serdar and Weston McKennie are both struggling with minor muscle injuries. Alessandro Schöpf and Daniel Caligiuri are on standby.Benito Raman is also bursting for a chance to impress after shaking off an ankle problem. Ex-Spurs midfielder Nabil Bentaleb is ruled out until the winter break with a knee injury.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Jason Sancho returns from an internal suspension handed out for arriving late back from England duty.Marco Reus was not well enough to travel to Milan to play in the Champions League, but the skipper should be fit for the derby.Former captain Marcel Schmelzer is ruled out with a hip injury, but Lukasz Piszczek could return to the defence, along with Germany left-back Nico Schulz.Striker Paco Alcácer missed out again with an Achilles problem in midweek so Mario Götze or Julian Brandt may play in a more advanced role.

Schalke will have had all week to focus on their biggest game of the year, while Dortmund seemed to have one eye on the Ruhr derby too, putting in a particularly limp performance in Milan. In a volatile atmosphere in Gelsenkirchen, back Schalke to edge to victory and pile the pressure on Lucien Favre.

Leverkusen's team news states that Brazilian defender Wendell suffered an injury in Frankfurt and is struggling to be available. The versatile Bender brothers, Lars and Sven, could help out in defence provided Sven overcomes an ankle knock from Madrid.Leon Bailey has aggravated a muscle tear and will not be back for another month yet.Charles Aránguiz is ruled out for several weeks with a thigh injury.Dutch defender Daley Sinkgraven has also suffered a thigh injury and will be out for even longer than the Chile international.Werder Bremen's team news states that Whisper it quietly, but Werder's injury situation is slowly but surely starting to improve.Yuya Osako and Ömer Toprak both returned to training this week, with the Turkish defender the more likely to start against another of his former clubs.Niklas Moisander is still working on a long-awaited comeback, however Ludwig Augustinsson, Kevin Möhwald and Fin Bartels are all ruled out for the long-term following knee operations.

Bremen have drawn three in a row, but will have their work cut out to achieve that at inconsistent Leverkusen who can grab a win on home soil.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Coach Oliver Glasner will have to see how his unbeaten side rock up after the rigours of Europa League action. Rotation could be the order of the day for an injury-hit squad.Felix Klaus did not travel to Belgium because of illness, but is available according to Glasner.Maximilian Arnold took a knock to his knee on Thursday evening and was not able to train on his return to Germany. Kevin Mbabu is also struggling with an injury from Thursday.John Brooks is chomping at the bit for a return to the defence.Augsburg's team news states that Former West Ham talent Reece Oxford had to be subbed against Bayern with a thigh injury and is in a race to be fit for Sunday.Captain Daniel Baier has missed the last five games with a nagging calf injury, but could be thrown straight back into the fray.Marco Richter will keep his spot after his goal against Bayern, while the experienced André Hahn has shaken off a knee problem. Sergio Córdova also impressed in his cameo against Bayern.Jeffrey Gouweleeuw have recovered from a long standing injury and is a definite option to strengthen a porous defence.Carlos Gruezo is still struggling with an ankle injury.

Augsburg lost 8-1 in Wolfsburg towards the end of last season, their heaviest ever Bundesliga defeat, which does not bode well, given that the FCA defence has not improved at all this campaign. Back the Wolves to extend their unbeaten run despite the rigours of a Thursday European match in Belgium in a spell of four matches in nine days.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Ex-Brighton striker Jürgen Locadia scored on his first Bundesliga start and will surely keep is spot alongside Andrej Kramaric. The Croatian striker also scored in a fresh partnership up front.Ishak Belfodil has undergone a knee operation and may struggle to play again this year.Sebastian Rudy had to come off at the break in midweek, owing to back pain and he is a doubt here.Record signing Diadie Samassékoure remains doubtful, but Steven Zuber is definitely out following an operation on his right foot.Paderborn's team news states that Coach Steffen Baumgart will surely stick with the bulk of the side, injury and suspension permitting, that grabbed a first win of the season and a long-overdue clean sheet last weekend.Former Bayern reserve keeper Leopold Zingerle should return in goal after sitting out the midweek cup game in place of Jannik Huth.Abdelhamid Sabiri scored on his Bundesliga debut last weekend and will surely keep his spot.Klaus Gjasula is suspended after picking up five yellows already this season.Sebastian Vasiliadis is struggling to shake off a toe injury and Sven Michel hurt his shin last weekend, both missed the cup game in midweek.

Hoffenheim, bouyed by four wins in a row in all comps, will be strong favourites for this one against a Paderborn side who finally got off the mark in the Bundesliga last weekend.It's hard to see Paderborn keeping a clean sheet so a comfortable home win is the logical consequence.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that While André Silva looks to be struggling for the weekend, Bas Dost notched twice in the cup and will thrive on the challenge of playing Bayern.Martin Hinteregger and Timothy Chandler both had to go off injured in midweek, with the Austrian defender more likely to start on Saturday.Versatile midfielder Sebastian Rode will be keen to impress against his former side.German international Kevin Trapp has busted his left shoulder and is ruled out until the New Year. Denmark international Frederik Rönnow will continue in goal.Filip Kostic is suffering with some knee pain but will not want to miss this one.Experienced skipper David Abraham will replace Almamy Touré in defence. The French defender will be out for a couple more weeks with a thigh injury.Bayern's team news states that Expect David Alaba to slot in at left-back instead of Alphonso Davies who scored an own goal in midweek. Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear against Augsburg and has probably played his last game of the season.Javi Martinez is back in training and could make the squad, claims head coach Niko Kovac.Leon Goretzka made his first start in midweek after recovering from a thigh operation and is another option.Thomas Müller appears to have fallen out of favour with Niko Kovac, with Philippe Coutinho the flavour of the day.

This promises to be a really charged atmosphere as under-pressure Niko Kovac takes his Bayern side back to his former employer. Kovac is a couple of poor results away from the sack. Eintracht Frankfurt are a high quality outfit compared to relegation fodder Union Berlin or BL2 stragglers Bochum against whom Bayern have laboured to victory recently. Back Bayern to raise their game in the volatile atmosphere and edge to victory, with Robert Lewandowski *probably finding the net for the 10th game in succession and extending his Bundesliga scoring record.

Leverkusen's team news states that Aleksandar Dragovic could step in for Lars Bender who suffered an thigh injury in the midweek cup game. Bender's Brother Sven is also likely to play in defence as Brazilian defender Wendell is still struggling to be available. Kai Havertz is fit again after illness.Leon Bailey has aggravated a muscle tear and will not be back for a few weeks yet. Charles Aránguiz is ruled out for several weeks with a thigh injury.Dutch defender Daley Sinkgraven has also suffered a thigh injury and will be out for even longer than the Chile international.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose has an ever growing injury list to contend with as they look to defend top spot. Christoph Kramer has the flu and is doubtful.Breel Embolo suffered a muscle injury last weekend against Eintracht Frankfurt. The Swiss forward missed the cup game in Dortmund and is ruled out.Tony Jantschke also missed out in midweek too, but could make the game.Matthias Ginter could return to the heart of the defence, having made the bench in midweek, along with fit-again Tobias Strobl and Ibrahima Traoré.Ramy Bensebaini had to go off after 30 minutes against BVB with no official diagnosis as yet. Alassane Pléa and Raffael are also missing. In more positive news, German international Lars Stindl is back along with Jonas Hofmann to bolster attacking midfield.

Leverkusen can beat anybody on their day and this could be one of them on home soil for Peter Bosz's inconsistent side against the injury-hit league leaders.

RBL's team news states that Kevin Kampl has recovered from a bout of flu.Skipper Willi Orban suffered a knee injury in the cup rout in Wolfsburg and will be out for a couple of weeks. Stefan Ilsanker could slot into defence.Emil Forsberg, Ademola Lookman and Patrik Schick are all exciting options to have up your coaching sleeve from the bench.Ethan Ampadu is a squad option after shaking off concussion suffered while playing for Wales.Defender Ibrahima Konaté is still struggling with a hip injury, while Tyler Adams and Hannes Wolf are both long-term absentees.Mainz's team news states that Expect coach Sandro Schwarz to stick with the guts of the side that provided woe for Cologne last Friday evening.However, Moussa Niakhaté is suspended after picking up five yellows already this season. Alexander Hack will slot into defence.Edimilson Fernandes is available from a one-game suspension after his red card in the defeat in Duesseldorf.Aaron Seydel is back training, but still needs to build up his fitness.Jean-Philippe Mateta, Stefan Bell and Dong-Won Ji are all ruled out long-term, but there is renewed hope that striker Mateta will play again before the traditional winter break.

Mainz have only beaten bottom of the table Paderborn on the road this season and their travel sickness is unlikely to improve in Leipzig. Back Julian Nagelsmann's men, winless in four in the league, to bounce back to winning ways with a goal or two from Timo Werner.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Werder's injury situation is slowly but surely starting to improve.Yuya Osako and Ömer Toprak are both options to start after recovering from injury.Christian Groß is battling Milos Veljkovic for a spot alongside the fit-again Toprak in defence.Niklas Moisander could return to the squad on a long-awaited comeback, however Ludwig Augustinsson, Kevin Möhwald and Fin Bartels are all ruled out for the long-term following knee operations.Freiburg's team news states that Gian-Luca Waldschmidt had to go off injured against Leipzig. Scans revealed the freshly-capped German international hadn't suffered a break, but the experienced Nils Petersen will likely step in against his former club.Lino Tempelmann endured a Bundesliga debut to forget, taken off after only 34 minutes with no apparent injury.Nicolas Höfler suffered a concussion against Leipzig and missed the cup game in midweek along with Amir Abrashi.Mark Flekken might continue in goal for Alexander Schwolow who is nearing a return from a thigh injury.Skipper Mike Frantz had to go off injured in the cup defeat and has to be doubtful. Right-back Lukas Kübler has undergone a knee operation and has probably played his last football of the year.

Freiburg continue to defy expectations in third place, but could come unstuck in Bremen, with the hosts hoping they will markedly improve now their lengthy injury list is abating.

Union Berlin's team news states that Akaki Gogia has played his last football of the year after tearing an ACL.Striker Siuleiman Abdullahis is still struggling to shake off a nagging knee issue. Midfielder Grischa Prömel remains on the sidelines with a more serious knee problem. The game will also come too early for Michael Parensen, who suffered a rib injury in the cup win against Freiburg.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Vladimír Darida sits this out through suspension after his red card last weekend. Ondrej Duda could slot into midfield.Former Celtic defender Dedryck Boyata had to go off with a muscle injury last weekend. Karim Rekik can step in alongside Niklas Stark who returned for the cup victory in midweek.Summer signing Dodi Lukébakio is in fine form and could play an attacking role, giving support to veteran striker Vedad Ibisevic. Ex-Nuernberg midfielder Eduard Löwen is nearing a return.

A mouthwatering historic first ever Bundesliga top-flight Berliner derby with Union enjoying a valuable extra day's rest after midweek cup games, when Hertha were taken all the way to penalties by struggling Bundesliga2 side Dynamo Dresden. Union have picked up both of their wins this season at home and can grab another against capital city rivals Hertha.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Friedhelm Funkel's injury list is slowly but surely starting to improve.Influential USMNT international Alfredo Morales has first shaken off flu then a muscle injury and is close to a starting berth.Skipper Oliver Fink could also return to the side following a thigh injury, but Aymen Barkok and Kevin Stöger still need more time.Kenan Karaman has pneumonia and difficulty breathing so is ruled out indefinitely.FC Koln's team news states that Coach Achim Beierlorzer is feeling increased heat after an embarrassing cup defeat to fourth-tier Saarbruecken in midweek.But Noah Katterbach has made an impressive start to his Bundesliga career at left-back, which allows German international defender Jonas Hector more freedom further up the pitch.Belgian Birger Verstraete came through a test playing for the U21s in midweek after a knee injury, while Dominick Drexler has recovered from a muscle injury. Both should return to the squad at the very least.Christian Clemens is also chomping at the bit for a return after recovering from injury. Striker Jhon Córdoba has failed to score in 24 games for Cologne in the top-flight now and has lost his spot to Simon Terodde up front.

A derby where passions are sure to run high on the Rhein, with both sides desperate for the points and with identical records.With little between the two sides, a derby draw does look the deal.

Augsburg's team news states that Expect coach Martin Schmidt to stick with the bulk of the side that scrapped to a precious point, and a rare clean sheet, at unbeaten Wolfsburg last Sunday.Former West Ham talent Reece Oxford has shaken off a thigh injury.Captain Daniel Baier is back after missing five games with a nagging calf injury.Jeffrey Gouweleeuw has recovered from a long standing injury and is a definite option to strengthen the defence, but Carlos Gruezo is still struggling with an ankle injury.Schalke's team news states that David Wagner's side have not scored in two league games, so Mark Uth may come in up front for Guido Burgstaller.Benjamin Stambouli has fractured a bone in his foot and may not play again this year. Either Matija Nastasic or Ozan Kabak will step into the Frenchman's boots.Suat Serdar and Weston McKennie have both recovered from minor muscle injuries, while Benito Raman is also bursting for a chance to impress after shaking off an ankle problem. Ex-Spurs midfielder Nabil Bentaleb is ruled out until the winter break with a knee injury.

Both sides played out turgid goalless draws last weekend, but Augsburg will be tough to beat at home if their defence keeps up that kind of form.Also Augsburg have had all week to concentrate on this game, while Schalke were pushed all the way in the cup at Arminia Bielefeld on Tuesday. Augsburg have the ammo to shock Schalke with Alfred Finnbogason in good form.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Vladimír Darida returns from suspension and is vying with Ondrej Duda for a spot in midfield.Former Celtic defender Dedryck Boyata is battling with Karim Rekik for a spot alongside Niklas Stark in central defence.Summer signing Dodi Lukébakio is in fine form and could play an attacking role, giving support to veteran striker Vedad Ibisevic. Ex-Nuernberg midfielder Eduard Löwen is an option after recovering from injury.RBL's team news states that Marcel Halstenberg has suffered a "minor thigh muscle tear" in the Champions League win in Russia and will be out for around two weeks, the club announced.A possible replacement Marcelo Saracchi has the flu and must be doubtful. Konrad Laimer could move to left-back.Skipper Willi Orban is struggling to shake off a knee injury, while fellow central defender Ibrahima Konaté will not return until after the international break with a hip injury. Stefan Ilsanker could slot into defence.Patrik Schick is still struggling with an ankle injury, while Tyler Adams and Hannes Wolf are both long-term absentees.

Despite a few defensive injury worries, Leipzig have returned to form with a bang. Back Julian Nagelsmann's side to go to the capital and win with plenty to spare on the back of a Timo Werner goal or two.

Paderborn's team news states that Hooked off at the break, Mohamed Dräger had a game to forget in Hoffenheim and could be replaced by Laurent Jans.Cauly Oliveira Souza suffered the same fate and will probably lose his spot to Gjasula, who returns from suspension to bolster midfield.Sebastian Vasiliadis is struggling to shake off a toe injury, but should be fit to take his place in midfield.Babacar Gueye is suspended after getting sent off in a reserve team game.Rifet Kapic has the flu and is ruled out.Augsburg's team news states that Jeffrey Gouweleeuw has recovered from a long standing injury and is a definite option to strengthen a porous defence.Carlos Gruezo is still struggling with an ankle injury.Former West Ham talent Reece Oxford has shaken off a thigh injury.Captain Daniel Baier capped his return after five games out with a nagging calf injury with a goal against Schalke.

Paderborn are rooted to the bottom of the table, but won their last home game.SCP will view this as a winnable game and can go above Augsburg with the three points.Both backlines are extremely porous, but there is not much between the two sides and it will come down to what defence makes the fewer mistakes.

Schalke's team news states that Salif Sané limped off early in the win at Augsburg with a knee injury and has probably played his last football of the year.Another key defender in Benjamin Stambouli has fractured a bone in his foot and also may not play again this year.Matija Nastasic is suffering with an Achilles injury and remains doubtful.Weston McKennie and Ozan Kabak are likely to form a new central defensive partnership.Mark Uth will likely continue in attack ahead of Guido Burgstaller.Ex-Spurs midfielder Nabil Bentaleb will not be back until after the winter break with a knee injury.Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Coach Friedhelm Funkel will likely stick with the bulk of the side that saw off Koeln in the Rhein derby.Kenan Karaman had pneumonia and difficulty breathing so is ruled out indefinitely.Markus Suttner could return to the squad after overcoming a muscle injury.Influential USMNT international Alfredo Morales is back to his best in midfield.Skipper Oliver Fink will bolster the side after recovering from a thigh injury, but Aymen Barkok and Kevin Stöger still need more time.

Schalke 04 were humiliated in March losing 4-0 to near neighbours Fortuna Duesseldorf at home.Back the Royal Blues to gain a semblance of revenge with a narrow win.

Bayern's team news states that Coach Niko Kovac paid the price for a poor run of form with the sack. Caretaker Hansi Flick takes over.Robert Lewandowski reportedly needs a minor groin operation, but will probably delay surgery to take part in the Klassiker.Jérôme Boateng is suspended for two games following his early dismissal in Frankurt last weekend.David Alaba could partner Javi Martinez in central defence, with Alphonso Davies slotting in at left-back. Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear against Augsburg and has probably played his last game of the season.Thomas Müller could get a rare start in the "Klassiker" as Philippe Coutinho has been well below par in recent weeks.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Roman Bürki could return to league action after recovering from the flu. England's Jadon Sancho limped off late in the thrilling comeback win over Inter Milan with a "thigh muscle tear" and like skipper Reus, will be assessed nearer the game.Achraf Hakimi could play in a more advanced role as he has done with aplomb of late. Julian Brandt is also in good form and could slot in for the injury-prone Reus.Paco Alcácer made the bench in midweek after recovering from an Achilles injury and could make a long-awaited return to the starting line up.

Neither of these defences inspire confidence, but Bayern definitely have the better goalkeeper with captain Manuel Neuer returning to his 2014 World Cup winning form.If Lewandowski is fit to play against his former club, back Bayern to win on the back of another inevitable Lewy goal.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose has a lengthy injury list to contend with as Gladbach look to defend top spot. Versatile defender Tony Jantschke went off injured before the half hour mark in the Europa League win against Roma on Thursday and is struggling to be available.Matthias Ginter could return to the heart of the defence, along with fit-again Tobias Strobl and Ibrahima Traoré who will strengthen the squad.Breel Embolo has suffered a muscle injury and is ruled out until after the international break.But at least Raffael, Alassane Pléa and Fabian Johnson could all return to the squad after recovering from injury, while Christoph Kramer has recovered from the flu.Werder Bremen's team news states that Werder's injury situation is slowly but surely starting to improve.First-choices Yuya Osako and Ömer Toprak are both options to start after recovering from injury.41-year-old Claudio Pizarro could return to the squad after recovering from issues with his knee and back.Christian Groß will probably make way for Milos Veljkovic for a spot alongside the fit-again Toprak in defence.However Ludwig Augustinsson, Kevin Möhwald and Fin Bartels are all ruled out for the long-term following knee operations, while the long-awaited comeback of Niklas Moisander seems to be on ice after the Swede missed training in midweek.

Werder Bremen have drawn five in a row in the Bundesliga, while the last three meetings between the two sides in all comps have all ended in stalemate.A share of the spoils seems reasonable.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Rotation will probably be the order of the day for coach Oliver Glasner after Europa League action on Thursday evening.USMNT international John Brooks is battling the inconsistent Jeffrey Bruma for a spot in defence.Joao Victor could replace Felix Klaus in attack.Leverkusen's team news states that Leon Bailey is suspended after his foolish red card last weekend.Sven Bender could step into defence for brother Lars Bender who is struggling with an thigh injury. Charles Aránguiz has recovered from a thigh injury, but Dutch defender Daley Sinkgraven has also suffered a thigh injury and is still ruled out.

Wolfsburg have slipped to three defeats in succession in all competitions after losing their early-season flow and, above all, are shipping too many goals.Buoyed by an impressive win in the Champions League against Atletico Madrid, back Leverkusen to come away with the three points.

Freiburg's team news states that Coach Christian Streich said striker Gian-Luca Waldschmidt has responded to treatment and "is looking good for Sunday."However, the experienced Nils Petersen will likely keep his spot up front.Alexander Schwolow is nearing a return from a thigh injury and could replace Mark Flekken in goal. But no risks will be taken with the international break looming.Janik Haberer is suspended after his red card last weekend in Bremen. Denmark international Frederik Rönnow will continue in goal.Experienced skipper David Abraham will continue in defence for Almamy Touré in defence. The French defender is expected to return soon after the international break.

Both sides are strong in coming back from losing positions so with that in mind, a share of the spoils seems the most logical result.

A rare Saturday afternoon outing for these sides both of whom are currently involved in Europa League action on Thursdays this season.Frankfurt thrashed Bayern 5-1 at home in their last home game and can follow up that drubbing of the champions with another win in front of their vociferous fans.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Coach Friedhelm Funkel will likely stick with the bulk of the side that grabbed a 3-3 draw at Schalke.Rouwen Hennings will aim to follow up his marvellous hat-trick against Schalke with another impressive performance against the record German champions.Zack Steffen did not meet with USMNT for international duty because of a knee problem but "will play in goal" against the record German champions, confirmed Funkel on Thursday.Former Bayern defender Diego Contento picked up an ankle injury in a friendly during the international break. Freiburg continue to defy expectations in fourth with hotly-touted Leverkusen three points behind in eighth. Back the two sides to be level on points after matchday 12.

Union Berlin is a very tricky place to win at as Borussia Dortmund have already experienced to their cost.But if you have title ambitions, the surprise league leaders have to grind out wins in these type of games. Climb on the "Foals" to romp to an away win.

Werder Bremen have a strong recent record against the Royal Blues and can edge to a narrow victory on home soil.

After pulling the plug on coach Achim Beierlorzer, Cologne are in crisis and missing a bunch of defenders. Despite lacking a full sense of defensive security themselves, Leipzig boast a wealth of attacking talent and should run out comfortable winners on home soil.

Just a solitary point separates the two sides in the table and with this in mind a share of the spoils looks the most likely outcome.

Despite being rudely interrupted by the international break after five wins in a row, you'd have to fancy Hoffenheim to beat lowly Mainz who are shipping far too many goals and have a new coach, Achim Beierlorzer, formerly of Cologne, in situ.

A genuine relegation six-pointer, a game neither side will want to lose against rivals at the wrong end of the table. Augsburg have won their last two games and also have not lost to Cologne in nine games in all competitions. A draw is the play here in a nervy affair.

Dortmund came from 3-0 down at the break to snatch a point against lowly Paderborn last week, but that's not the sort of form that wins you any silverware.Hertha Berlin have lost four in a row and sacked Ante Covic. A win for Jürgen Klinsmann on his debut will probably spell the end for under-fire coach Lucien Favre at BVB.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Ihlas Bebou has recovered from a knee problem.Andrej Kramaric has been sparingly used in recent weeks, but could start at home with former Brighton striker Jürgen Locadia who has started his Bundesliga career well.Ishak Belfodil has undergone a knee operation and may struggle to play again this year.Record signing Diadie Samassékoure is close to a return to the squad, but Steven Zuber is definitely out following an operation on his right foot.Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Former Bayern defender Diego Contento could return to the squad after recovering an ankle injury.Aymen Barkok has recovered from a shoulder injury and is set to come into the squad, along with Kenan Karaman who has shaken off pneumonia.Kevin Stöger has suffered an ACL tear and will not play again this year.

After five wins in a row, Hoffenheim slipped to a shock 5-1 home defeat to lowly Mainz. Back Hoffenheim to bounce back to winning ways against a distinctly average Duesseldorf side.

Bayern's caretaker Hansi Flick has won both Bundesliga games in charge 4-0 so far and another similarly impressive win is on the cards against inconsistent Leverkusen, who are perhaps good for a goal but tend to threaten to deceive.

Currently on a eight game slump without tasting victory, Werder Bremen are on the worst run of form in the whole Bundesliga.In the North Derby, Bremen can battle to a draw against a Wolfsburg side, still a bit leggy from European efforts.

After shocking Arsenal in London in the Europa League, Eintracht Frankfurt have a shorter trip across the Main to face local rivals Mainz.This is sure to be a feisty affair with every ball hotly contested on a rare Monday Bundesliga match-up. A share of the spoils would be a decent start in Achim Beierlorzer first home game in charge.

Having played on Monday in Mainz, Eintracht Frankfurt have a quick turnaround hosting Hertha Berlin.Friday evenings in Frankfurt are always a special atmosphere as Jürgen Klinsmann prepares for his first away game at the Hertha helm.Energised by the vociferous support, back Eintracht for the three points at their home fortress.

Mainz are looking for a hat-trick of wins under new coach Achim Beierlorzer but Augsburg, who are also in decent form themselves, may nick this one at home.
