Dropping points against lowly Duesseldorf would spell the end for Lucien Favre in charge of Borussia Dortmund.Dortmund trailed 3-0 at half time to bottom-of-the-table Paderborn in their last home game, so nothing is beyond the realms of possibility.That said, BVB possess the only unbeaten home record in the league, so should get the job done against a very willing but limited visiting side.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will be relieved to see his injury situation improving as Gladbach look to defend top spot again. Rose confirmed that German international Mathias Ginter is "fit again" and should line up with Nico Elvedi in defence.Versatile defender Tony Jantschke has shaken off a muscle injury.However, Andreas Poulsen misses out with an ankle ligament tear.Bayern's team news states that Caretaker Hansi Flick will lead the side until the winter break at the very least after taking over from sacked Niko Kovac.Jérôme Boateng is available again after a two-match suspension following his dismissal in Frankfurt.David Alaba should pair up again in central defence with Javi Martinez, with Canadian talent Alphonso Davies slotting in at left-back. Thomas Müller has been reinvigorated since Flick took charge, so Philippe Coutinho may have to make do with a spell warming the bench.Robert Lewandowski needs a minor groin operation, but is set to delay surgery until shortly before the winter break, which, on current form, is bad news for the rest of the Bundesliga.Teenage striker Jann-Fiete Arp remains on the treatment table with an arm injury.Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear against Augsburg and has probably played his last club game of the season.

Beware pale imitations, this is the genuine "Klassiker" reviving memories from the seventies when these pair of German giants were far and away the two leading Bundesliga heavyweights. Gladbach can move seven points clear of Bayern with a victory.But after suffering their first defeat under Hansi Flick last weekend, back Bayern to bounce back with a gritty away win in Gladbach to reignite their title hopes.

RBL's team news states that Yvon Mvogo enjoyed his Bundesliga start of the season last weekend, but dependable first-choice Péter Gulácsi is set to return in goal.Dayot Upamecano is suffering with knee pain and will be assessed nearer the game.Emil Forsberg should be fit to return from a thigh injury, while Konrad Laimer is expected to shake off a heavy cold.Skipper Willi Orban has been unable to shake off a knee injury and will not play again this year, likewise Kevin Kampl who had a knee operation last week. Marcel Halstenberg and Yussuf Poulsen have both returned to training. Patrik Schick could continue up front.Nordi Mukiele has recovered from a muscle injury and could return to the squad.Fellow central defender Ibrahima Konaté is still on his way back from a hip injury. Stefan Ilsanker or Lukas Klostermann may slot into defence.Tyler Adams and Hannes Wolf are both nearing a return to the squad following long-term issues.Hoffenheim's team news states that Germany international Sebastian Rudy is ruled out through suspension after picking up his fifth yellow last weekend. Record signing Diadie Samassékoure, Lukas Rupp or Dennis Geiger could fill in.Ihlas Bebou is struggling with a knee problem, while Kevin Vogt is also not training at full pelt because of a calf problem. Both will be assessed nearer the game, along with Benjamin Hübner, who missed last week's game because of a virus.Steven Zuber is nearing a return to the squad, but Ishak Belfodil has undergone a knee operation and will struggle to play again this year.

Back RB Leipzig for the win in an entertaining affair as Julian Nagelsmann greets his former club in east Germany.

Union Berlin's team news states that Expect coach Urs Fischer to keep faith with the bulk of the side that has risen away from the relegation spots.Anthony Ujah could start against his former employer.Keven Schlotterbeck is ruled out with a knee injury.Akaki Gogia has played his last football of the year after tearing an ACL.Striker Siuleiman Abdullahis and Joshua Mees have both returned to training and could be squad options.Midfielder Grischa Prömel remains on the sidelines with a knee problem.FC Koln's team news states that Achim Beierlorzer, now immediately working his magic at Mainz, paid the price for a poor run of results with the axe. Markus Gisdol, who has saved Hoffenheim and Hamburg from relegation in the past, took over as coach and picked up his first point last weekend.Rafael Czichos is suspended after his first half dismissal last weekend, while German international Jonas Hector is also on the naughty step after picking up five yellows.Promising left-back Noah Katterbach has made a quick recovery from a muscle tear and could replace Hector.Spanish defender Jorge Meré is fit again after a thigh injury.Anthony Modeste, who Gisdol knows from his Hoffenheim days, may lose his spot after a series of ineffective displays.Belgian Birger Verstraete will probably slot into midfield after recovering from a knee injury.Vincent Koziello is back training after an ankle injury.

Both teams were promoted last season, but are enjoying differing fortunes.Union are not to be underestimated in front of their fervent fans, having beaten BVB and Gladbach this season, with four wins from seven at home.Back Cologne can sneak a share of the spoils in the capital.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Sebastian Rudy is available again after suspension, but Stefan Posch replaces the Germany international on the naughty step after picking up his fifth yellow card of the season last weekend. Ihlas Bebou is struggling with a knee problem, while Kevin Vogt is also unable to train at full intensity because of a nagging calf problem. Both will be assessed nearer the game, along with Benjamin Hübner. Ermin Bicakcic will likely line up in defence.Steven Zuber is nearing a return to the squad, but Ishak Belfodil has undergone a knee operation and has his sights on a return in the new year.Augsburg's team news states that Expect coach Martin Schmidt to keep faith with the bulk of the side that have embarked on a four-game unbeaten run in the league, lifting FCA away from the relegation spots. André Hahn is available after suspension, but Ruben Vargas replaces him on the naughty step after picking up five yellows and a ban.Former Arsenal defender Stephan Lichtsteiner is struggling with a hip injury, while Rani Khedira has been battling neck pain, but is expected to be fit.Michael Gregoritsch is available again after apologising for derogatory comments about the club.Striker Alfred Finnbogason will not play again this year after picking up a shoulder injury on international duty with Iceland.Carlos Gruezo is still struggling with an ankle injury, while Raphael Framberger suffered a muscle injury and is also ruled out.

After five straight wins before the international break, Hoffenheim's run was abruptly halted, remarkably losing 5-1 at home to 10-man Mainz.Hoffenheim are in a slight slump and the visitors, who have not lost in four, can aim to scrap to another point here.

Bayern's team news states that Caretaker Hansi Flick will lead the side until the winter break at the very least after taking over from sacked Niko Kovac.The unfortunate knee injury to Kingsley Coman overshadowed the comfortable midweek win over Spurs in the Champions League. The France winger will return after the winter break.Philippe Coutinho could come in for Coman after impressing against Spurs.Robert Lewandowski was rested in midweek, but will be fully reinvigorated for the visit of Bremen.Javi Martinez is suspended after his dismissal last weekend in the Klassiker defeat against league leaders Gladbach.€10m summer signing Michaël Cuisance has picked up an ankle injury and is ruled out.David Alaba was also rested in midweek, but should return to pair up with Boateng in central defence, with Canadian talent Alphonso Davies slotting in at left-back. Corentin Tolisso had to be subbed with a thigh injury against Gladbach and is doubtful.Teenage striker Jann-Fiete Arp remains on the treatment table with an arm injury.Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear against Augsburg and has probably played his last club game of the season.Werder Bremen's team news states that Just as Werder's injury situation was starting to improve, USMNT talent Joshua Sargent suffered a muscle injury in training and has been ruled out.Niklas Moisander made his long-awaited comeback last weekend and the Finland international is expected to line up again in defence.Leonardo Bittencourt has been struggling with a stomach virus and will be assessed nearer the game.Ömer Toprak will not play again this year after suffering a calf injury.Ludwig Augustinsson is fit again and could return at left-back.

Beleaguered Bremen lost at home to struggling Paderborn last weekend as the four-time Bundesliga champions continue to plummet down the table.After back-to-back 2-1 losses, Bayern have suffered four league defeats already this season and languish in seventh spot, recalling similarly poor seasons under Louis van Gaal, Felix Magath and Jürgen Klinsmann.However, Bayern have won a Bundesliga record 17 games in a row against Bremen, so it's hard to see past a comfortable win for the reigning champions as they look to close the gap at the top before the winter break.

FC Koln's team news states that Achim Beierlorzer, now working his magic in Mainz, paid the price for a poor run of results with the axe. Markus Gisdol, who has saved Hoffenheim and Hamburg from relegation in the past, took over as coach, but has only picked up a solitary point in three games.Rafael Czichos and Jonas Hector are both available again after serving suspensions.Promising youngster Noah Katterbach has made a quick recovery from a muscle tear and could play at left-back, allowing German international Hector to move into midfield.Spanish defender Jorge Meré is fit again after a thigh injury.Anthony Modeste, who Gisdol knows from his Hoffenheim days, may lose his starting spot after a series of ineffective displays.Leverkusen's team news states that Jonathan Tah sits out for the last time following his late dismissal against Bayern Munich. Aleksandar Dragovic is likely to fill the void again in central defence.Neither Kevin Volland nor Leon Bailey started against Juventus in midweek but should return for this one.Mitchell Weiser and Joel Pohjanpalo are both struggling with ankle injuries.

Bottom of the table Cologne host near neighbours Leverkusen for the Rhein derby.It's the sort of of game Leverkusen have slipped up on many occasions in the past, and especially after Champions League distractions in midweek, it's unlikely to be a stroll for Leverkusen.Back a share of the spoils with local honours even.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that After a poor run of results, Hertha pulled the plug on Ante Covic and appointed former USMNT coach Jürgen Klinsmann until the end of the season.Rune Jarstein is available again after serving a two-game ban and Klinsmann has confirmed that the Norway international will replace former Bayern number one Thomas Kraft in goal.Per Skjelbred could return in midfield with Davie Selkie likely to continue up front with Dodi Lukébakio in support. Mathew Leckie has returned to training earlier than expected following a knee injury, but still has work to do to make the starting line-up.Freiburg's team news states that Vincenzo Grifo is available again after serving a three-match ban. Grifo could come in for any of the front trio.First-choice goalkeeper Alexander Schwolow missed training in midweek, so understudy Mark Flekken will likely continue in goal.Philipp Lienhart and French winger Yoric Ravet are both ruled out with muscle injuries.Jérôme Gondorf has recovered from a bout of flu.Germany striker Gian-Luca Waldschmidt has returned to training but is unlikely to be risked again this year. Right-back Lukas Kübler has undergone a knee operation and will not play again this year either. Amir Abrashi should return to the squad after recovering from a muscle injury, while Lino Tempelmann has a knee injury.

After throwing away a two-goal lead last weekend, Hertha Berlin are still searching for a first win under new coach Jürgen Klinsmann.Surprise side Freiburg find themselves above mighty Bayern Munich in the table and with morale low in the capital, they are exactly the type of opponents you do not want to face, who will bite and scrape for every loose ball.After losing three in a row at home, back a narrow Hertha win to get Klinsi off the mark.

Mainz's team news states that After two straight wins, new coach Achim Beierlorzer suffered his first defeat in charge last weekend.Midfielder Ridle Baku is available again after suspension.Edimilson Fernandes has impressed of late in a three-man defence along with Moussa Niakhaté and Jeremiah St. Juste.Ádám Szalai could come in for Karim Onisiwo who has a back injury.Skipper Danny Latza will not play again this year after suffering a back injury.Jean-Philippe Mateta, Stefan Bell and Dong-Won Ji are all still ruled out, but there is renewed hope that prolific striker Mateta will return to the squad before the winter break. Aaron Seydel is back in training, but still needs to build up his fitness.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Mats Hummels is available again after suspension.But Axel Witsel fell awkwardly at his home and has been ruled out until after the winter break.Dan-Axel Zagadou could step into a reshuffled defence, with Julian Weigl replacing Witsel in midfield.Paco Alcácer has returned to full training, but is unlikely to start.Marcel Schmelzer has a calf injury and will not play again until next year.Thomas Delaney is out until the New Year with an ankle problem.

Both of these sides were coached by Liverpool miracle worker Jürgen Klopp.Unpredictable Mainz have yet to draw at all this season and possess the worst defensive record in the league.Buoyed by reaching the knockout stages of the Champions League, Borussia Dortmund can get the job done in Mainz.

Paderborn's team news states that Head coach Steffen Baumgart will likely stick with the bulk of the side that beat Bremen to finally lift off the bottom of the table.Baumgart has confirmed that every single member of Paderborn's 29-man squad is currently fit.Marlon Ritter could return to the squad after recovering from a groin strain.Ghana international Christopher Antwi-Adjei is challenging for a starting spot. Striker Streli Mamba scored twice against Borussia Dortmund, indicative of his impressive recent form.Union Berlin's team news states that Urs Fischer will likely keep faith with the bulk of the side that has risen away from the relegation spots.Anthony Ujah could start alongside top scorer Sebastian Andersson.Keven Schlotterbeck is ruled out with a knee injury.Akaki Gogia has played his last football of the year after tearing an ACL.Striker Siuleiman Abdullahis and Joshua Mees are both integrated in training and could be squad options.Midfielder Grischa Prömel remains on the sidelines with a knee problem.

Two promoted sides meet who have enjoyed differing fortunes so far this season.Union have scored the fewest goals on their travels along with bottom side Cologne and cannot be backed with any confidence.Buoyed by a last-gasp win at Bremen, pick Paderborn to follow up with a win against the visitors from the capital.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Kaan Ayhan returns from suspension but Alfredo Morales replaces him on the naughty step after picking up his fifth yellow of the season last weekend. Marcel Sobottka broke his nose against Hoffenheim but could play with a special mask and fill in for USMNT international Morales.Markus Suttner is ruled out with a muscle injury.Aymen Barkok has recovered from a shoulder injury and is set to come into the squad, but Kenan Karaman is still battling a bout of pneumonia.Kevin Stöger has suffered an ACL tear and will not play again this year.RBL's team news states that Dayot Upamecano is suffering with knee pain and will be assessed nearer the game.Skipper Willi Orban has been unable to shake off a knee injury and will not play again this year, likewise Kevin Kampl who had a knee operation.Hannes Wolf made his long-awaited return from injury last weekend as a substitute.Marcel Halstenberg and Yussuf Poulsen are both fit, but Patrik Schick could continue up front after being rested in the Champions League.Nordi Mukiele has recovered from a muscle injury and could return to the squad.Fellow central defender Ibrahima Konaté is still on his way back from a hip injury. Stefan Ilsanker or Lukas Klostermann may slot into defence.Tyler Adams is nearing a return to the squad following a long-term issue.

Duesseldorf are in the doldrums under 66-year-old veteran Friedhelm Funkel, the oldest coach in the Bundesliga.RB Leipzig comfortably qualified for the Champions League knockout stages and now have top of the table in the Bundesliga in their sights.Another other than a comfortable away win would be a shock on current form.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Marcel Tisserand is suspended after picking up five yellows. Josuha Guilavogui could move into defence, allowing summer signing Xaver Schlager to start in midfield.Daniel Ginczek and Admir Mehmedi are also fit and serious options to break into the starting line up.Yunus Malli has shaken off a back injury and could return to the squad.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will have to see how his side need freshening up after a dramatic Europa League exit on Thursday.Rose will hope his injury situation continues to improve as Gladbach look to build on a massive last-gasp win against Bayern. But Rose will have to replace key midfielder Denis Zakaria after he picked up his fifth yellow of the season last weekend. Christoph Kramer could step in.Versatile defender Tony Jantschke has shaken off a muscle injury, but Andreas Poulsen misses out with an ankle ligament tear.

Wolfsburg have been toothless in recent weeks and only struggling Fortuna and Cologne have scored fewer goals at home than the Wolves.Gladbach have only scored nine themselves on their travels, but have managed to garner four wins, aided by the best away defensive record in the league.Both sides are involved in Europa League action on Thursday and a goal either way could nick this. Go for the home side to snatch victory.

Schalke's team news states that Ex-Manchester City defender Matija Nastasic is struggling with a muscle injury.Mark Uth is ruled out until next year with an adductor injury. Guido Burgstaller is fit, but has been ineffective in front of goal this season.Salif Sané has suffered a knee injury and has played his last football of the year.Another key defender in Benjamin Stambouli has fractured a bone in his foot and is also unlikely to play again this year.Alessandro Schöpf is ruled out after suffering a muscle tear.Nabil Bentaleb has recovered from a knee injury. But the ex-Spurs midfielder is being ostracised and will keep himself fit with the U23 side before being sold in the winter break.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Coach Adi Hutter may freshen things up after Europa League action on Thursday.Key Dutch striker Bas Dost had returned to training and could make a cameo appearance.Experienced skipper David Abraham is suspended for seven weeks after his bodycheck on Freiburg coach Christian Streich. The Argentinian is eligible in Europe, but will not play again this year in the Bundesliga. Almamy Touré and Evan Ndicka could step into defence.First-choice goalkeeper Kevin Trapp has busted his left shoulder and is ruled out until the New Year. Denmark international Frederik Rönnow is a brilliant understudy.Dominik Kohr sits out for the final time after his red card in the derby against Mainz.

Eintracht Frankfurt are not in the best of form with injuries and suspensions to key players.Eintracht have lost five out of six on their travels, the worst away record in the league, and are not coping with the rigours of the tough Thursday-Sunday Europa League dance.Back Schalke to snatch victory on home soil.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Just as Werder's injury situation was starting to improve, a new influx has arrived just before the winter break. Theodor Gebre Selassie went off after the Bayern equaliser with a muscle injury and is ruled out until next year.USMNT talent Joshua Sargent suffered a muscle injury in training and has been ruled out as has Sebastian Langkamp who has a bad back.Niklas Moisander made his long-awaited comeback last weekend, but missed the Bayern game with a calf problem. But the Finland international is expected to line up again in defence against Mainz.Ömer Toprak is ruled out until the New Year after suffering a calf injury.Mainz's team news states that After two straight wins to start, new coach Achim Beierlorzer is back to reality with two consecutive losses. Jeremiah St. Juste picked up his fifth yellow at the weekend and is suspended. Alexander Hack could come into defence.Jean-Philippe Mateta made his long-awaited comeback as a substitute at the weekend and will probably enjoy another cameo.Ádám Szalai could come in for Karim Onisiwo who has a back injury.Skipper Danny Latza will not play again this year after suffering a back injury.Stefan Bell and Dong-Won Ji are still ruled out long term.Aaron Seydel is back in training, but still needs to build up his fitness.

Werder Bremen would not have expected to gain any points from their trip to Bayern at the weekend, but would fancy their chances against lowly Mainz.Bremen do have some attacking potential and were leading Bayern until shortly before the break, before the floodgates opened and they were hit for six.Mainz have let in an average of three goals per away game and have not drawn on their travels so far this season.Bremen cannot be backed with any confidence with the second worst home league record and just a single win in front of their fans.A draw perhaps is the most likely outcome, but back Bremen to bounce back from a heavy defeat against Bayern against a Mainz side with their own problems in defence.

Augsburg's team news states that Expect coach Martin Schmidt to keep faith with the bulk of the side that have embarked on a five-game unbeaten run in the league, lifting FCA well away from the relegation spots. Ruben Vargas is available after suspension.André Hahn replaces him on the naughty step after picking up five yellows and a ban.Former Arsenal defender Stephan Lichtsteiner is struggling with a hip injury, while Rani Khedira has been battling neck pain, but is expected to be fit.Michael Gregoritsch is available again after apologising for derogatory comments about the club.Striker Alfred Finnbogason will not play again this year after picking up a shoulder injury on international duty with Iceland.Carlos Gruezo is still struggling with an ankle injury, while Raphael Framberger suffered a muscle injury and is also ruled out.Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Alfredo Morales is available after suspension, but Adam Bodzek replaces the USMNT international on the naughty step after picking up his fifth yellow at the weekend.Hopes are high that Rouven Hennings will shake off a nasty bout of flu that ruled him out at the weekend.Marcel Sobottka broke his nose against Hoffenheim, but could play with a special mask.Markus Suttner is ruled out with a muscle injury.Aymen Barkok has recovered from a shoulder injury, but Kenan Karaman is still battling a bout of pneumonia.Kevin Stöger has suffered an ACL tear and is ruled out until the new year.

A genuine relegation six-pointer only a few weeks ago, but Augsburg have really turned things around of late.FCA are on an impressive run with four wins in five and have to be fancied to win this at home against struggling Duesseldorf, who will need a lot of fortune to win this.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Marcel Schmelzer is ruled out with a calf problem.Thomas Delaney suffered an ankle injury and will return after the winter break.Axel Witsel needed a facial operation after falling in his home. Back-up keeper Marwin Hitz has a thigh problem.RBL's team news states that Ibrahima Konaté is nearing a return to the squad after almost recovering from a muscle injury.Skipper Willi Orban has had a knee operation and will return in the new year.Kevin Kampl is ruled out after a foot operation.

Leipzig have won six in a row to top the table, while Dortmund have won three in a row just as their season threatened to unravel.Leipzig's Julian Nagelsmann snubbed a BVB approach to take over as coach, smoothing the way for Lucien Favre's eventual appointment.With two attacking teams meeting in great form, expect an entertaining game with goals at both ends.

Leverkusen's team news states that Jonathan Tah is available after suspension, but is replaced on the naughty step by Aleksandar Dragovic and Leon Bailey, both of whom were shown the red card in the derby woe in Cologne.Tah will likely come straight back into central defence, while Lucas Alario is a good option up front.Mitchell Weiser and Joel Pohjanpalo are both struggling with ankle injuries.Hertha Berlin's team news states that After a poor run of results, Hertha pulled the plug on Ante Covic and appointed former USMNT coach Jürgen Klinsmann until the end of the season.Norway international Rune Jarstein kept a clean sheet on his return from a two-game ban having replaced former Bayern number one Thomas Kraft in goal.Davie Selkie likely to continue up front with Dodi Lukébakio in support. Australian international Mathew Leckie has returned to training earlier than expected following a knee injury, but still has work to do to make the starting line-up.

Jürgen Klinsmann picked up his first win in charge at the weekend.Leverkusen self-destructed in the derby against Cologne, losing two men and local bragging rights to what was the bottom team in the league.Buoyed by getting off the mark for their new coach, back Hertha Berlin to follow up with a point at unpredictable Leverkusen.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Coach Adi Hutter may have to freshen things up after a run of poor results.Mijat Gacinovic was laid low by a kung-fu kick by the Schalke goalkeeper on Sunday and has to be doubtful.Bas Dost was originally ruled out until after the winter break with a groin strain. But there was inexplicable improvement in his groin injury and the Dutch striker played the the full defeat to Schalke. He is unlikely to start this game so soon after Sunday.Experienced skipper David Abraham is suspended for his bodycheck on Freiburg coach Christian Streich. The Argentinian will not play again this year in the Bundesliga. Almamy Touré and Evan Ndicka could step into defence.First-choice goalkeeper Kevin Trapp has busted his left shoulder and is ruled out until the New Year. Denmark international Frederik Rönnow is a brilliant understudy but is now out for six weeks with a thigh injury. Felix Wiedwald will deputise. Dominik Kohr is available again suspension and is an option in midfield.FC Koln's team news states that Expect Markus Gisdol to stick with the guts of the side that edged past nine-man Leverkusen in the derby.But Gisdol will have to do without Kingsley Ehizibue, who picked up his fifth yellow and is suspended. Benno Schmitz could slot in at the back.17-year-old Jan Thielmann made an impressive debut in the derby against Leverkusen, becoming the first Bundesliga player ever born in 2002. Thielmann should keep his spot, particularly as his replacement Marcel Risse had to come off late with a thigh injury.Promising youngster Noah Katterbach could play at left-back, allowing German international Jonas Hector to move into midfield.Anthony Modeste, who Gisdol knows from his Hoffenheim days, may lose his starting spot after a series of ineffective displays.

Cologne rose from the bottom of the table with a spirited 2-0 derby win and can push Eintracht Frankfurt all the way.Eintracht are in urgent need of a win to steady the ship before winter hibernation and can scrap to victory in front of their vociferous home fans.

Freiburg's team news states that Understudy Mark Flekken will likely continue in goal as first-choice goalkeeper Alexander Schwolow has had a setback in training.Vincenzo Grifo is available again after serving a three-match ban. Grifo could come in for any of the front trio.Woo-Yeong Jeong is away on international duty with the South Korea U22 side.Germany striker Gian-Luca Waldschmidt has returned to training, but is unlikely to be risked again this year.Philipp Lienhart and French winger Yoric Ravet are both ruled out with muscle injuries.Right-back Lukas Kübler has undergone a knee operation and Lino Tempelmann is also ruled out with a knee problem.Bayern's team news states that Caretaker Hansi Flick will lead the side until the winter break at the very least after taking over from sacked Niko Kovac.Kingsley Coman is out until after the winter break after injuring his knee against Spurs in the Champions League.Philippe Coutinho is set to keep his spot after impressing of late.Javi Martinez is available again after suspension. €10m summer signing Michaël Cuisance has picked up an ankle injury and is ruled out.Teenage striker Jann-Fiete Arp remains on the treatment table with an arm injury.Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear and has probably played his last club game of the season.

After showing woeful profligacy, Bayern lost twice recently to Gladbach and Leverkusen, and cannot afford to drop any more points before the winter break.The record German champions can get the job done comfortably against Freiburg, especially if Robert Lewandowski returns to his prolific best.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will have to see how his side need freshening up after two dramatic last-gasp defeats threaten momentum. Stefan Lainer has a knee injury and is a doubt, but key midfielder Denis Zakaria is available again suspension and is set to replace Christoph Kramer.Versatile defender Tony Jantschke has shaken off a muscle injury, but Andreas Poulsen misses out with an ankle ligament tear.Paderborn's team news states that Head coach Steffen Baumgart will likely stick with the bulk of the side that are on a two-game unbeaten run.Marlon Ritter is struggling with a groin strain.New Ghana international Christopher Antwi-Adjei is challenging for a starting spot. Striker Streli Mamba scored twice recently against Borussia Dortmund, indicative of his impressive form up front.

Bottom side Paderborn were leading 3-0 at Borussia Dortmund at half time so have to be respected.Gladbach have suffered back-to-back last-gasp defeats, one of which meant a premature Europa League exit and the other costing them top billing on the Bundesliga table.Back Gladbach to bounce back to winning ways against plucky Paderborn.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Marcel Tisserand is available again after suspension.Yunus Malli has shaken off a back injury and could return to the squad.Admir Mehmedi is struggling with a thigh injury.Summer signing Xaver Schlager is back with a bang in midfield after a lengthy injury absence.Schalke's team news states that Ex-Manchester City defender Matija Nastasic is struggling with a muscle injury.Weston McKennie hurt his shoulder on Sunday and will not play for several months.Alexander Nübel was sent off on Sunday and is suspended. Youngster Markus Schubert will probably play in goal.Mark Uth is ruled out until next year with an adductor injury. Guido Burgstaller is fit, but has been ineffective in front of goal this season.Benjamin Stambouli and Salif Sané are both ruled until the New Year.Alessandro Schöpf is ruled out after suffering a muscle tear.Nabil Bentaleb has recovered from a knee injury. But the ex-Spurs midfielder is ostracised and will keep himself fit with the U23s before being offloaded in the winter break.

There's precious little to choose between the two sides on paper, but Schalke have a host of defensive injuries and their top keeper is suspended.Bouyed by a last-gasp win over then league leaders Gladbach, Wolfsburg can edge to victory.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Stefan Posch could keep his spot in defence after impressing in the shutout win in Berlin.Skipper Kevin Vogt is currently unable to train at full intensity because of a nagging calf problem.Steven Zuber is nearing a return to the squad, but Ishak Belfodil has undergone a knee operation and is unlikely to play again this season according to coach Alfred Schreuder.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Jadon Sancho hobbled off in midweek with bad cramp and must be a doubt. Paco Alcácer is fit and could start here as Marco Reus misses out.German international Nico Schulz is an option against his former club.But Axel Witsel fell awkwardly at his home and has been ruled out until after the winter break.Dan-Axel Zagadou could step into a reshuffled defence, with Julian Weigl replacing Witsel in midfield.Marcel Schmelzer has a calf injury and will not play again until next year.Thomas Delaney is out until the New Year with an ankle problem.

Hoffenheim play on a second successive Friday in both side's final outing before the winter cessation.Both teams will go all out for victory, but having lost their last two at home - 5-1 to Mainz and 4-2 to Augsburg - it would be a surprise if Hoffenheim can turn around that downward trend.Depressed after disappointingly twice frittering away a lead against league leaders Leipzig in midweek, it's going to be a tough game for BVB especially if in-form Jadon Sancho is ruled out.

Bayern's team news states that Caretaker Hansi Flick will lead the side until the winter break at the very least after taking over from sacked Niko Kovac.Kingsley Coman is out until after the winter break after injuring his knee against Spurs in the Champions League.David Alaba picked up a knock in midweek, but played on through the pain barrier.Thiago is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow in midweek, while Leon Goretzka and Corentin Tolisso are both struggling with muscle injuries.Philippe Coutinho is set to keep his spot after impressing of late.€10m summer signing Michaël Cuisance has picked up an ankle injury and is ruled out.Teenage striker Jann-Fiete Arp remains on the treatment table with an arm injury.Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear and has probably played his last club game of the season.Wolfsburg's team news states that Marcel Tisserand is available again after suspension and could return to defence.Yunus Malli has shaken off a back injury and could return to the squad.Admir Mehmedi is struggling with a thigh injury.Summer signing Xaver Schlager is back with a bang in midfield after a lengthy injury absence.

Wolfsburg have improved of late, but will be hunted down by Bayern who will be buoyed by their last-gasp victory in midweek as the champions edge closer to the top of the pack before the winter break.

FC Koln's team news states that Expect Markus Gisdol to stick with the guts of the side that staged a miraculous comeback to win 4-2 at Frankfurt in midweek.But Kingsley Ehizibue is available after suspension and could replace Benno Schmitz at the back.Florian Kainz impressed in the comeback win in Frankfurt and is set to keep his spot.Promising youngster Noah Katterbach could play at left-back, allowing German international Jonas Hector to move into midfield.Anthony Modeste, who Gisdol knows from his Hoffenheim days, may lose his starting spot after a series of ineffective displays.Werder Bremen's team news states that Just as Werder's injury situation was starting to improve, a new influx has arrived just before the winter break. Theodor Gebre Selassie has suffered a muscle injury at the weekend and is ruled out until next year.USMNT talent Joshua Sargent suffered a muscle injury in training and has been ruled out, as has Sebastian Langkamp who has a bad back.To add insult to injury, Leonardo Bittencourt is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow in midweek.Niklas Moisander made his long-awaited comeback last weekend, and should be okay to line up in defence.Ömer Toprak is ruled out until the New Year after suffering a calf injury.

A genuine relegation six-pointer.On current form, you would have to side with the home side, buoyed by their second-half comeback against Frankfurt and especially considering Werder have shipped 11 goals in their last two games.

Mainz's team news states that Expect new coach Achim Beierlorzer to keep faith with the side that cruised past Werder Bremen in midweek.But Jeremiah St. Juste is available again after suspension and could dislodge Alexander Hack in defence.Jean-Philippe Mateta made his long-awaited comeback as a substitute in the last two games and will probably enjoy another cameo.Ádám Szalai could come in for Karim Onisiwo who has a back injury.Skipper Danny Latza will not play again until after the winter break because of a back injury.Stefan Bell and Dong-Won Ji are still ruled out long-term.Aaron Seydel is back in training, but still needs to build up his fitness.Leverkusen's team news states that Lars Bender could shake off a muscle injury and play in defence.Julian Baumgartlinger and Karim Bellarabi missed the turgid midweek defeat because of illness, but should be fit for the weekend. Aleksandar Dragovic is available after suspension, but Leon Bailey remains on the naughty step, serving a three-game ban for the childish red card in the derby woe in Cologne. Bailey will be available again in the second game after the winter break.Mitchell Weiser and Joel Pohjanpalo are both struggling with ankle injuries.

Leverkusen remain highly unpredictable, beating the very best in Bayern one week, then losing the last two lamely to strugglers Cologne and Hertha Berlin.After losing 8-0 to Leipzig and sacking their coach, Mainz have beaten Bremen 5-0 and Hoffenheim 5-1 in recent weeks and are on the up.But give Leverkusen a final chance to bounce back from a couple of bad defeats.

RBL's team news states that Julian Nagelsmann's side twice came back to retrieve a point at BVB.Patrik Schick may come in up front to freshen things up in attack.Ibrahima Konaté is nearing a return to the squad after almost recovering from a muscle injury.Skipper Willi Orban has had a knee operation and will return in the new year.Kevin Kampl is ruled out after a foot operation.Augsburg's team news states that Expect coach Martin Schmidt to keep faith with the bulk of the side that have embarked on an impressive six-game unbeaten run in the league, lifting FCA well away from relegation trouble.Ruben Vargas is available after suspension, but Rani Khedira replaces him on the naughty step after picking up a fifth yellow in midweek.Felix Uduokhai could play at the back, allowing Tin Jedvaj to take Khedira's place in midfield.Michael Gregoritsch is available again after apologising for derogatory comments about the club.Striker Alfred Finnbogason will not play again until after the winter break after picking up a shoulder injury on international duty with Iceland.Carlos Gruezo is still struggling with an ankle injury, while Raphael Framberger suffered a muscle injury and is also ruled out.Former Arsenal defender Stephan Lichtsteiner is struggling with a hip injury.

Augsburg have amassed 16 from a possible 18 points and are definitely not to be underestimated.But Leipzig will be buoyed by an impressive comeback to snatch a point at BVB and can retain their lead at the top of the table with a reasonably comfortable home win.

Schalke's team news states that Ex-Manchester City defender Matija Nastasic is struggling with a muscle injury.Weston McKennie hurt his shoulder and will not play for several months.Alexander Nübel was sent off against Eintracht Frankfurt on Sunday for a kung-fu kick and is suspended for four games. Youngster Markus Schubert will continue in goal.Mark Uth is ruled out until next year with an adductor injury. Guido Burgstaller is fit, but has been ineffective in front of goal this season.Benjamin Stambouli and Salif Sané are both ruled until the New Year.Alessandro Schöpf is ruled out after suffering a muscle tear.Nabil Bentaleb has recovered from a knee injury. But the ex-Spurs midfielder is ostracised and will keep himself fit with the U23s before being offloaded in the winter break.Freiburg's team news states that Understudy Mark Flekken will likely continue in goal as first-choice goalkeeper Alexander Schwolow has had a setback in training.Jonathan Schmid missed the midweek Bayern game because of a calf injury, while Roland Sallai was ill. Mike Frantz stands by in midfield.Woo-Yeong Jeong is away on international duty with the South Korea U22 side.Germany striker Gian-Luca Waldschmidt has returned to training, but is unlikely to be risked again this year.Philipp Lienhart and French winger Yoric Ravet are both ruled out with muscle injuries.Right-back Lukas Kübler has undergone a knee operation and Lino Tempelmann is also ruled out with a knee problem.

Despite a host of defensive injuries, back the Royal Blues to complete a narrow home win against a Freiburg side who seem to be stumbling their way into winter hibernation.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that After a poor run of results, Hertha pulled the plug on Ante Covic and appointed former USMNT coach Jürgen Klinsmann until the end of the season.Expect Klinsi to keep faith with the bulk of the side that has reeled off two straight 1-0 wins.But Marko Grujic is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow in midweek.Norway international Rune Jarstein has kept two clean sheets after returning from a two-game ban having replaced former Bayern number one Thomas Kraft in goal.Davie Selkie likely to continue up front with Dodi Lukébakio in support. Australian international Mathew Leckie has returned to training earlier than expected following a knee injury, but still has work to do to make the starting line-up.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will have to see how his side need freshening up after momentum has slowed in recent games.Stefan Lainer missed the Paderborn game with a knee injury, the first game he has missed all season. He remains doubtful.Versatile defender Tony Jantschke has shaken off a muscle injury, but Andreas Poulsen misses out with an ankle ligament tear.But key midfielder Denis Zakaria is available again suspension and is set to replace Christoph Kramer.

Since beating Bayern, just like Leverkusen, Gladbach have found a way to lose a couple of games that they were winning with ease earlier in the season.Back Hertha Berlin to get the better of the deposed league leaders, who threaten to sleepwalk their way into the winter break.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Matthias Zimmermann broke a bone in his hand in midweek and is having a special cast fitted.Adam Bodzek is available after suspension and could replace Marcel Sobottka who has been playing with a special mask after breaking his nose. Markus Suttner is ruled out with a muscle injury.Aymen Barkok has recovered from a shoulder injury, but Kenan Karaman is still battling a bout of pneumonia.Kevin Stöger has suffered an ACL tear and is ruled out until the New Year.Union Berlin's team news states that Swiss coach Urs Fischer will likely keep faith with the bulk of the side that has risen away from the relegation spots.Felix Kroos, brother of the slightly more talented Toni, is struggling with pain in his back.Anthony Ujah could start alongside top scorer Sebastian Andersson, with ex-QPR striker Sebastian Polter also pushing for a spot.Striker Siuleiman Abdullahis and Joshua Mees are both fit again and could be squad options.Keven Schlotterbeck is ruled out with a knee injury.Akaki Gogia will not return until next year after tearing an ACL.Midfielder Grischa Prömel remains on the sidelines with along-term knee problem.

Neither of these two sides can be backed with any confidence.Union are in slightly better form, but that said have only won once away from home this season.Sit on the fence with a draw.

Schalke's team news states that Austria international forward Michael Gregoritsch has joined on loan from Augsburg, while central defender Jean-Clair Todibo has also arrived from Barcelona B until the end of the season.Weston McKennie is not yet ready following a shoulder op.Youngster Markus Schubert will continue in goal as Alexander Nübel is still sidelined by a four game suspension. Much to everyone at Schalke's distaste, Nübel has decided not to extend his contract  and will join Bayern Munich on a free transfer at the end of the season. Guido Burgstaller is fit, but has been ineffective in front of goal this season.Defenders Benjamin Stambouli and Salif Sané are both continuing their recovery. Nabil Bentaleb has recovered from a knee injury. But the ex-Spurs midfielder is ostracised and trying to keep himself fit with the U23s before a move in the transfer window.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Momentum had slowed in the lead up to the winter break, so head coach Marco Rose will have been glad of the rest to freshen up his troops.Certainly, the injury list has improved remarkably with only Ramy Bensebaini ruled out for several weeks with a muscle injury. Oscar Wendt will likely step in.Stefan Lainer has recovered from a knee injury, while versatile defender Tony Jantschke has shaken off a muscle injury and could deputise for Nico Elvedi.Key midfielder Denis Zakaria is available again in midfield and could replace Christoph Kramer.

The Bundesliga returns from winter hibernation with a mouthwatering Friday evening clash.Both these sides outperformed expectations in the first half of the season and would appear very evenly matched.A draw is the favoured outcome to kick off 2020 in Germany.

Fortuna Duesseldorf's team news states that Steven Skrzybski has joined on loan from Schalke.Kevin Stöger has recovered from an ACL tear and is set for a comeback.Adam Bodzek is available after suspension and could replace Marcel Sobottka who has been playing with a special mask after breaking his nose. Aymen Barkok has recovered from a shoulder injury, but Kenan Karaman is still battling a bout of pneumonia and is not expected back until mid February.Werder Bremen's team news states that Kevin Vogt has been signed from Hoffenheim to bolster a porous defence.Philipp Bargfrede will miss at least the next couple of games with a calf problem, while Ludwig Augustinsson is not expected to be fit.Theodor Gebre Selassie suffered a thigh injury at the end of the year and is still ruled out, but Ömer Toprak has recovered from a calf injury.USMNT talent Joshua Sargent is available up front after a muscle injury, while Leonardo Bittencourt can return after suspension.

A genuine relegation six-pointer which neither side can really afford to lose.Neither side inspires too much confidence as the weakest attack in Duesseldorf (18 goals) face the most porous defence in Bremen (41 goals against).Bremen were a disaster area going into the winter break but will look to regroup quickly in 2020.A score draw could be the answer.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Munas Dabbur has joined from La Liga side Sevilla and could start up front.Goalkeeper Michael Esser has been signed from Hannover to cover for Oliver Baumann's injury, but Philipp Pentke will likely get the nod between the sticks.Steven Zuber is nearing a return to the squad, but Ishak Belfodil has undergone a knee operation and is unlikely to play again this season according to coach Alfred Schreuder.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Coach Adi Hutter may opt for a four-man defence, with experienced skipper David Abraham and stalwart Martin Hinteregger both available again after suspension.Kevin Trapp could make his long awaited comeback from a broken shoulder. Understudy Frederik Rönnow is also making good progress from a thigh injury. Spanish midfielder Lucas Torró is ruled out with a knee injury for three to four months.

Eintracht Frankfurt will have been glad of the winter break to regroup after a host of injuries and tired bodies took their toll.Hoffenheim have been unpredictable all season, especially at home, while Eintracht possess the worst away record in the whole division.Starting as they mean to go on in 2020, plump for a rare away win for Frankfurt.

Mainz's team news states that Expect coach Achim Beierlorzer to hand Jean-Philippe Mateta a start after some impressive cameos towards the end of the year.Skipper Danny Latza is still struggling with a back injury, while Stefan Bell is nearing a return.Freiburg's team news states that First-choice goalkeeper Alexander Schwolow is set to return between the sticks. Nicolas Höfler is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow in the final game of 2019.Woo-Yeong Jeong is away on international duty with South Korea.Germany striker Gian-Luca Waldschmidt is nearing a return to the squad.Right-back Lukas Kübler continues his recovery from a knee operation.

Freiburg impressed in the first half of the season, while Mainz improved immensely under new coach Achim Beierlorzer.Two of the less fashionable sides in the league could share the spoils in a low-scoring draw.

Australian international Mathew Leckie is fit following a knee injury, but still has work to do to make the starting line-up.Bayern's team news states that Caretaker Hansi Flick will lead the side until the summer after taking over from sacked Niko Kovac.Serge Gnabry is unlikely to be risked from the start with bigger games ahead, while Robert Lewandowski is expected in the starting eleven after a hernia op.Kingsley Coman has the flu which will delay his recovery from a knee injury for at least another week.Thiago is available after suspension but Joshua Kimmich is on the naughty step after picking up his fifth yellow in the final game before the winter pause.Leon Goretzka and Corentin Tolisso have both recovered from muscle injuries, but Javi Martínez is unavailable with a similar ailment.Teenage striker Jann-Fiete Arp has recovered from an arm injury.Niklas Süle suffered an ACL tear in the autumn and has probably played his last club game of the season.

Hertha did not concede in three games before the winter break. Bayern bounced back from a few too many sloppy defeats to end the year in strong fashion.Back a narrow win for the record German champions as they seek their eighth successive Bundesliga title.

Paderborn's team news states that Striker Streli Mamba scored twice against Borussia Dortmund in the winter, but has gone cold since. Dennis Srbeny has joined from Norwich City and could be thrown into the mix instead of Mamba.Sebastian Vasiliadis is available after suspension, but Jamilu Collins replaces the Greek on the naughty step after picking up his fifth yellow.New Ghana international Christopher Antwi-Adjei is challenging for a starting spot with Gerrit Holtmann on the left side of midfield.Leverkusen's team news states that Exequiel Palacios has joined from River Plate but has to serve a suspension carried over from Argentina.Sven and Lars Bender could line up in defence.Charles Aránguiz has picked up a calf injury.Leon Bailey sits out the last match of a three game ban for the childish red card in the derby woe in Cologne in December. Wendell joins the Jamaican on the naughty step after his sending off in Mainz in the final game before the winter break.Paulinho is away with Brazil on Olympic qualification duty.

Paderborn won their last home match before the winter break, while unpredictable Leverkusen stuttered going into the cessation.The first goal will be crucial in this one, especially if the home side can nick it against a talented but brittle Leverkusen.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Wunderkind striker Erling Haaland has joined from RB Salzburg and will surely make his home debut after a fairytale hat-trick as a substitute last weekend.Dan-Axel Zagadou has a calf injury and is only likely to return next week at the earliest.Axel Witsel is fit again after a facial injury, but has to play for another 3-4 weeks with a specially fitted mask. Marcel Schmelzer is still struggling with a calf injury and Thomas Delaney is battling an ankle problem.FC Koln's team news states that Expect Markus Gisdol to stick with the guts of the side that has won four in a row to move away from immediate relegation strife.Mark Uth has joined on loan from Schalke and boosts attacking options.Elvis Rexhbecaj has arrived from Wolfsburg on an 18-month loan deal.Promising youngster Noah Katterbach will continue at left-back, allowing German international Jonas Hector to prosper in midfield.Anthony Modeste, who Gisdol knows from his Hoffenheim days, has lost his starting spot after a series of ineffective displays.

This seems to be a routine home win on paper.However, Cologne have seriously improved of late, having looked doomed to an inevitable relegation battle for most of the Autumn.But Borussia Dortmund, buoyed by the arrival of Erling Haaland, are unbeaten at home and full of attacking prowess. They should prove too strong on home soil in a game that should see plenty of goals.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Coach Adi Hutter may stick with a four-man defence, with experienced skipper David Abraham and stalwart Martin Hinteregger both impressing on their return from suspension.Kevin Trapp made his long awaited comeback from a broken shoulder, while his understudy Frederik Rönnow has also recovered from a thigh injury. Makoto Hasebe missed the Hoffenheim game last weekend due to illness but could return to the squad.Spanish midfielder Lucas Torró is ruled out with a knee injury for three to four months.RBL's team news states that Matheus Cunha is away with Brazil on Olympic qualification duty.Emil Forsberg missed last week because of flu but could return.Vice captain Diego Demme has surprisingly left to join Napoli so, having recovered from a long-term injury, Tyler Adams looks set to get a run in midfield.Patrik Schick may come in up front to freshen things up in attack.Ibrahima Konaté is nearing a return to the squad after almost shaking off a muscle injury.Skipper Willi Orban is continuing his recovery from a knee op.Kevin Kampl is still ruled out after a foot operation.

Frankfurt kick started 2020 with a good win in Hoffenheim and can push the league leaders all the way.Leipzig continue to make history, becoming the first Bundesliga team ever to score three goals in nine games in a row.Frankfurt are very hard to beat on home soil and if the hosts can prevent Werner and co from scoring three, a share of the spoils could be the answer.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose needs to reinvigorate his troops after losing Bundesliga top spot and a premature Europa League exit.Ramy Bensebaini is ruled out for several weeks with a muscle injury. Oscar Wendt will likely step in.Stefan Lainer has to serve a one match ban after picking up his fifth yellow last weekend. Fabian Johnson could help out at right-back.Versatile defender Tony Jantschke suffered a muscle injury against Schalke and is ruled out for around three weeks. Nico Elvedi could return provided he overcomes a bad back.Mainz's team news states that Expect coach Achim Beierlorzer to hand lively striker Jean-Philippe Mateta another chance to impress from the start after some impressive cameos towards the end of 2019.Skipper Danny Latza has overcome a back injury, while Stefan Bell is nearing a return.Jeremiah St. Juste is battling Alexander Hack for a spot in central defence.Pierre Kunde is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow last weekend.

Gladbach have lost top spot after momentum has slowed over the darker months, especially since their win over Bayern Munich.Mainz have not drawn a game all season, and possess decent talent going forward but a very porous defence with just one clean sheet all season.Gladbach will expect to seal a first home win of 2020 to keep their title hopes alive, but could come unstuck against a Mainz side who are long overdue a share of the spoils.

Marcel Tisserand is available again after suspension and could return in defence.Admir Mehmedi has overcome a thigh injury.Summer signing Xaver Schlager will bolster midfield after a lengthy injury absence.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Niklas Stark missed last weekend's lesson from Bayern with a heavy cold and should return to defence.Dedryck Boyata is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow last weekend.Santiago Ascacibar has signed from second tier side VfB Stuttgart and may slot into midfield.Marvin Plattenhardt has recovered from a heavy cold, while Liverpool loanee Marko Grujic is available after suspension.Former USMNT boss Jürgen Klinsmann is currently tackling queries over his licence to coach in Germany.Davie Selkie could lose his spot up front to Dodi Lukébakio. Australian international Mathew Leckie is fit following a knee injury, but still has work to do to make the starting line-up.

Both sides are looking to recover from heavy defeats in their first game back after the winter break.With very little to choose between the two sides, a single goal could nick this Northern derby, but keep a low-scoring draw in your thoughts as well.

Schalke have an appalling record in the Bavarian capital, but this is the Royal Blues' best chance of a decent result in recent years.Back Bayern though to keep in touch with the leaders Leipzig with a narrow win on home soil.

Eintracht Frankfurt have come out of the blocks quickly after the winter break and can make it a hat-trick of wins against the struggling bottom side.

These two sides are notoriously hard to predict, both picking up some great results coupled with some massive slips on the way.A share of the spoils is a decent shout but back Leverkusen to keep in touch with the leaders with an away win.

Struggling Mainz are yet to draw a game this season in 19 attempts.Mainz would snap your hand off for a share of the spoils, but would appear no match for the record German champions as the Bayern Munich title bandwagon starts to accrue some serious momentum.

Gladbach have been toothless away from home of late.Back Leipzig to bounce back from last weekend's loss to keep their slender lead in tact atop the Bundesliga.

Steven Skrzybski has a torn muscle.Goalkeeper Frederik Rönnow is fit after a muscle injury, but Ralf Fährmann will retain his spot.Kilian Ludewig needs an foot operation and will be out for a minimum of 10 weeks.After a squabble, Vedad Ibisevic's contract has been paid up, while Nabil Bentaleb will train individually until further notice. Amine Harit was given a reprieve though.Gonçalo Paciencia is still on the mend from a knee operation.Veteran striker Klaas Jan Huntelaar, 37, is on the verge of returning from Ajax. The former Real Madrid striker may even be in the squad for the crunch game against Koln.FC Koln's team news states that Sebastian Andersson is ruled out for up to six weeks with a knee problem, while fellow striker Anthony Modeste just cannot shake off a muscle injury to play the full 90.19-year-old Sava-Arangel Cestic made an impressive debut in the shock win at Borussia Dortmund and looks to become a fixture in the side.Stalwart Jonas Hector is fit again after a neck injury, while Florian Kainz is also closing in on a return from a knee injury.Koln have signed Nigerian talent Tolu Arokodare on loan to boost competition for places up front.

Two sides in a slump meet. Schalke have one win in 32 games, while Koln have won only two in 26 games.Until their last away game, a 5-0 drubbing in Freiburg, Koln had performed much better form on their travels than at home this season, recently shocking Borussia Dortmund and keeping a rare clean sheet in the goalless draw with RB Leipzig.Koln enjoy an extra 24 hours rest than Schalke who returned to losing ways on Sunday after smashing Hoffenheim 4-0 in their last home game to avoid matching Tasmania Berlin who went 31 games without a win in 1965/66 for an unenviable record.A genuine relegation six-pointer and goals will likely be at a premium with the fear-factor coming into play.

Augsburg's team news states that Key defender Jeffrey Gouweleeuw and Marco Richter are both available after suspension.Iago has a neck injury and missed the weekend game, but should return.André Hahn is over his encounter with COVID-19.Raphael Framberger is ruled out with a muscle injury.Noah Joel Sarenren Bazee has a knee injury, Fredrik Jensen is battling an ankle problem and Jan Morávek is out with a muscle injury.Bayern's team news states that 21 goals in 16 games, Robert Lewandowski keeps on racking up the Bundesliga records.Leon Goretzka and Kingsley Coman both made their returns from injury on Sunday.Serge Gnabry hobbled off on Sunday with a leg injury and is a doubt.With a clean sheet, Manuel Neuer can draw level with Oliver Kahn on 196 - a Bundesliga record. Neuer has failed to keep a clean sheet in 11 games though, his worst ever run in the Bundesliga for Bayern.Back-up striker Joshua Zirkzee is suspended for two more games after his sending off against 1860 Munich in the third-division local derby recently.Summer signing Tanguy Nianzou is ruled out with a muscle injury.

A Bavarian derby. David against Goliath. Minnow against Superpower.Augsburg will look to keep it tight and hit the visitors on the break, as Bayern's defence is as porous as it has been since the early 80s.Bayern have netted in all 16 Bundesliga games this season. In fact, in their previous 77 games, Bayern have failed to score on only two occasions, both against Leipzig.

Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Key man Andreas Voglsammer has a calf injury, but central defender Amos Pieper is fit again. Joakim Nilsson is fit again after a thigh injury, while Jacob Barrett Laursen has returned from a knee injury.Midfielder Manuel Prietl is almost over a thigh injury, while Noel Niemann has a shoulder injury.Stuttgart's team news states that Silas Wamangituka Fundu and Nicolas Gonzalez are both suspended after each picked up fifth yellow cards.Daniel Didavi is fit again after a hip injury, while the influential Gonzalo Castro is available after suspension.Arsenal loanee Dinos Mavropanos and fellow defender Waldemar Anton are both fit again after knee injuries.Hamadi Al Ghaddioui has a pelvic injury, while Momo Cisse could return to the squad after adductor issues. Maxime Awoudja has an Achilles injury.

Both these sides were promoted from the second division last season, with the home side ending as runaway champions.Boasting the best away record in the division, Stuttgart have been in supreme form on their travels, a complete opposite to their home form where they are yet to taste victory this season.Arminia Bielefeld look destined for a season-long battle against the drop, but have managed to pick up a few priceless wins recently to move out of the relegation places.No goals have been scored during the first half of Bielefeld's last six Bundesliga games, so a goal either way could be enough here, but Stuttgart are missing two of their star players through suspension.

Freiburg's team news states that Baptiste Santamaria, a club record signing from SCO Angers in France, so impressive in midfield during the winning streak, hobbled off after only a few minutes with a knee injury in the narrow defeat in Munich. His replacement Amir Abrashi also went off with a calf injury in the second half.Nicolas Höfler is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow against Bayern on Sunday.Jonathan Schmid is struggling with a thigh injury and has not been able to train at full intensity.Yannik Keitel is close to a return from a knee problem, but Chang-Hoon Kwon is ruled out for around six weeks with a knee injury.New first-choice keeper Mark Flekken immediately got injured, so Florian Müller, a loan signing from Mainz, has grasped his chance in goal.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Luka Jovic enjoyed a dream start with two goals as a substitute after returning to the club on loan from Real Madrid until the end of the season.David Abraham played an emotional final game on Sunday against Schalke before retiring to go back to his family in Argentina.Ragnar Ache is still absent following a thigh injury picked up on international duty with the Germany U21 side in the Autumn.

A meeting between two form sides. Before Sunday's unfortunate defeat at the champions, Freiburg had won five in a row, while Frankfurt have won four games in succession.Frankfurt have shared the spoils on eight occasions in total this season, the joint most draws in the division along with Wolfsburg.Back Frankfurt to keep up their winning run, particular as Freiburg's midfield are missing some of their best players.

RBL's team news states that Hot prospect Dominik Szoboszlai has joined from Salzburg, but has adductor problems and will be out for the rest of the month.Kevin Kampl and skipper Marcel Sabitzer have minor injury worries and will be assessed nearer the game.Christopher Nkunku, Justin Kluivert and Nordi Mukiele could all return to contention after overcoming ankle knocks.Hee-Chan Hwang is back in training after his encounter with COVID-19, as is Lazar Samardzic.Marcel Halstenberg will be assessed nearer the game as he battles adductor problems, while fellow German international Benjamin Heinrichs is ruled out with a knee injury.Konrad Laimer and Lukas Klostermann also have knee issues, with the German international the nearest to a return.Union Berlin's team news states that Sheraldo Becker went off early on Friday with an ankle injury and is extremely doubtful.Leon Dajaku could make the squad after his recent arrival from Bayern Munich.Grisha Prömel is available after suspension and Nico Schlotterbeck could return to the squad after recovering from a thigh problem.Former German international Max Kruse still needs more time to get over a thigh injury.Christian Gentner is training again after a calf injury, but may not be risked just yet, while Finnish striker Joel Pohjanpalo is out for several months.Liverpool loanee Loris Karius cannot dislodge Andreas Luthe in goal, who has been solid and reliable all season.Marius Bülter is available again after his bout of COVID-19, while Akaki Gogia is back in the squad after recovering from ACL damage.Striker Anthony Ujah has been out for close to six months with a long-term knee issue.A training ground injury is expected to keep out Florian Hubner here.

Following the late winner against Leverkusen, Union Berlin kept up their record of scoring in all 16 league games this season and sit in the lofty heights of fifth in only their second season ever in the top-flight.Leipzig are not in great form, letting in five goals in their last two games, for the first time under coach Julian Nagelsmann.Go for a narrow home win with Union drawing a blank for the first time this season in the Eastern Germany derby.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Coach Marco Rose is reportedly a target to takeover at Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season.Marcus Thuram has served his five-game ban and will return to the squad.Swiss forward Breel Embolo should also return to the squad after being dropped in midweek for contravening COVID-19 regulations.Striker partner Alassane Plea is also fit again after minor injury worries.Valentino Lazaro suffered a minor muscle tear and looks likely to miss out again.Key midfielder Denis Zakaria made his return recently after over eight months out.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Axel Witsel has torn his Achilles and will not play again this season, but Emre Can is available after suspension.Marco Reus will be keen to impress against his former employer.English youngster Jude Bellingham returned from a foot injury at the weekend.Thorgan Hazard cannot shake off a muscle injury to face his former club, while Thomas Delaney is suspended after picking up five yellows.Thomas Meunier has recovered from a muscle injury, while former skipper Marcel Schmelzer recovers from a knee op.

Gladbach have improved of late, but will rue spurning a league-high 18 points from winning positions already this season.Borussia Dortmund were mightily impressive in their last away win in Leipzig, in between two particularly turgid away defeats, leaving them a distant 10 points behind Bayern.Back Gladbach to get the job done comfortably on home soil, making Borussia Dortmund ever keener to lure Marco Rose to take over as next head coach.

Union drew a blank in front of goal for the first time this season in the 1-0 defeat in Leipzig, but still sit in the lofty heights of sixth in only their second season ever in the top-flight.Augsburg will have to show more ambition than against Bayern when they looked to keep it tight for long periods, before coming on strong late in the game.Goals could be at a premium in this one and a goal either way could nick the three points.

After taking one point from a possible 12, Bayer Leverkusen deservedly beat Borussia Dortmund in midweek. Wolfsburg have lost only twice this season, to big guns Bayern and Dortmund, but have shared the spoils on eight occasions already this term.A draw could be on the cards here.

Mainz's team news states that Ex-Mainz defender Bo Svensson, who played under the likes of Jürgen Klopp and Thomas Tuchel, has taken over as head coach on a deal until 2024.Jean-Philippe Mateta who has scored the majority of Mainz's goals this season has been sold to Crystal Palace.Stefan Bell made his first Bundesliga appearance in 658 days last weekend at the heart of the Mainz defence.After contracting COVID-19 in the summer, Edimilson Fernandes recently again returned a positive test but is now able to leave quarantine. Youngster Marius Liesegang could return to the squad after recovering from a back injury, while Moussa Niakhaté is available after suspension.Goalkeeper Finn Dahmen made a decent Bundesliga debut in the defeat at Bayern, but first choice Robin Zentner has recovered from a back injury.Philipp Mwene returned from an ankle injury last weekend, while Pierre Kunde Malong is over his encounter with COVID-19, but now needs a knee op and will be missing for several weeks. Former Real Madrid striker Ádám Szalai could return to the squad after recovering from a knee op.Dominik Kohr has joined on loan until the end of the season from Eintracht Frankfurt to boost midfield options and could make his first start.Danny da Costa has joined Mainz from Eintracht Frankfurt, following Kohr who made the same move across the Main earlier this week.RBL's team news states that January signing Dominik Szoboszlai has adductor problems and won't play until next month.Kevin Kampl and skipper Marcel Sabitzer have minor injury worries and will be assessed nearer kick-off.Christopher Nkunku, Justin Kluivert and Nordi Mukiele could all return here.Hee-Chan Hwang is back in training after his encounter with COVID-19, as is Lazar Samardzic.Marcel Halstenberg is over his adductor problems, but fellow German international Benjamin Heinrichs is ruled out with a knee injury.Konrad Laimer and Lukas Klostermann also have knee issues, with the latter the nearest to a return.

Mainz are already on their fourth head coach of a turbulent season. RB Leipzig are not in great form, but remain Bayern's nearest challengers, four points adrift.Mainz have kept only one clean sheet all season and sit only above sorry Schalke on goal difference at the foot of the table.Mainz have not won at home in nine games, a club record, but do enjoy 24 hours extra rest for this game and no travel time.All things considered, anything other than a comfortable away win would be a massive surprise.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Matheus Cunha cannot train at full intensity because of adductor problems and has flattered to deceive of late.Marvin Plattenhardt is suffering with adductor pain as well, while Jessic Ngankam has a muscle injury.Santiago Ascacibar is set for a return to the squad after recovering from a muscle injury.Luca Netz made his debut as a substitute recently. At 17 years and 232 days, the left-sided defender is the second youngest ever player in the club's history.Skipper Dedryck Boyata is doubtful with a foot injury, but key striker Jhon Córdoba is fit again after an ankle injury.Arsenal loanee Matteo Guendouzi has made a decent start to life in the Bundesliga with a couple of vital goals.Javairo Dilrosun has a knee injury and will be out for a few more weeks.Record signing Lucas Tousart is over a knee injury.Werder Bremen's team news states that Young talent Nick Woltemade has given Bremen a boost by extending his contract.Striker Niclas Füllkrug suffered an ankle injury and is ruled out for several weeks. Ludwig Augustinsson has a muscle injury, and Felix Agu stepped in to score on his first Bundesliga start.Christian Groß is struggling with a calf problem and is doubtful, but Marco Friedl is fit again after a thigh injury.Patrick Erras is ruled out with a hip injury.Wantaway Milot Rashica is close to a return after a thigh injury, but is desperate for a move away.Young striker Eren Dinkci scored the priceless winner as a substitute on his Bundesliga debut.Romano Schmid made his first Bundesliga start recently, but may drop to the bench here.Injury-prone centre-back Ömer Toprak has returned from a nagging calf problem, while Milos Veljkovic battles adductor issues.

Two sides in poor form and struggling at the wrong end of the table meet in the Northern Derby.Hertha Berlin have not scored in 280 minutes, with only four goals in their last six games.Werder Bremen have performed marginally better on their travels than at home this season.After their turgid home defeat in midweek, Hertha have amassed 17 points from 17 games, which is very average considering no Bundesliga club spent more on transfers in 2020 than the capital city club.Hertha should have the quality to see off Bremen, especially if the influential Brazil international Matheus Cunha delivers for a change.

Sorry Schalke at least avoided matching Tasmania Berlin who went 31 games without a win in 1965/66.But after smashing Hoffenheim 4-0, the bottom club have returned to losing ways including a devastating last-gasp defeat to relegation rivals Koln in midweek which leaves them eight points from safety.Bayern's defence is as porous as it has been since the early 80s, but the champions will not have to worry too much about Schalke's attack.Bayern have netted in all 17 Bundesliga games this season. In fact, in their previous 78 games, Bayern have failed to score on only two occasions, both against Leipzig.

Niklas Süle may get a chance to impress against his former club.Back-up striker Joshua Zirkzee is available after suspension, but in talks to leave.Tanguy Nianzou and former record signing Corentin Tolisso are both ruled out with muscle injuries.Hoffenheim's team news states that Kevin Vogt is nearing a return from a shoulder injury. Bayern's defence is as porous as it has been since the early 80s, but while the champions have clearly not been at their best for weeks, they have coasted seven points clear and on course for an eighth-straight Bundesliga title.Bayern have netted in all 18 Bundesliga games this season. Leon Goretzka and Javi Martinez both had COVID-19 and missed the trip to Qatar, but have both returned now to the fray.
