Tanguy Nianzou is ruled out with a muscle injury.FC Koln's team news states that Jonas Hector is doubtful with a muscle inury, while Marius Wolf has an ankle injury.Sebastiaan Bornauw is ruled out with a back injury. Sava-Arangel Cestic seems the likeliest to step in at the back.Ismail Jakobs is nearing a return from an ankle injury, while Ondrej Duda has a rib problem.Emmanuel Dennis has joined on loan from Club Bruges. The Nigerian talent has already enjoyed more success than compatriot Tolu Arokodare who has failed to make any sort of impact up front.Max Meyer has been on the scrapheap at Crystal Palace for months but has been offered a deal here until the end of the season.Sebastian Andersson is still ruled out with a knee problem, while Florian Kainz is closing in on a return from a knee injury.

Koln have beaten some decent sides on their travels, including the Borussia's of Monchengladbach and Dortmund, also taking a point off Leipzig.Looking increasingly vulnerable, FIFA Club World Cup champions Bayern have seen their lead at the top dwindle to just two points after some indifferent results.Despite all this, Bayern have scored in 53 games in a row, last going goalless in February 2020 against RB Leipzig. 62 goals after 22 Bundesliga games is a new club record as well.Bayern definitely underestimated lowly Bielefeld recently on home soil, the champions won't make the same mistake here against another relegation-threatened team. So anything other than a comfortable home win would be a HUGE surprise.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Marco Rose will take over as head coach in the summer, arriving from Borussia Monchengladbach.Marco Reus made his 300th Bundesliga appearance last weekend in the Ruhr derby.Manuel Akanji suffered a muscle tear and will be out for several weeks.Axel Witsel has torn his Achilles and will not play again this season.Goalkeeper Roman Bürki, Dan-Axel Zagadou and Thorgan Hazard have all returned to training this week and will be eyeing a comeback.Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Japanese international Masaya Okugawa has joined on loan from RB Salzburg and could force his way into the side.Michel Vlap has signed on loan from Anderlecht and scored the opener against mighty Bayern recently.Andreas Voglsammer has shaken off a calf injury, while Ritsu Doan is fit after a minor muscle tear.Joakim Nilsson is fit again after a thigh injury, while Jacob Barrett Laursen has returned from a knee injury.Midfielder Manuel Prietl is over a thigh injury.

Lowly Arminia Bielefeld took a deserved point off Bayern in their own backyard, so are not to be underestimated. Despite the unexpected share of the spoils in a snowy Bavarian capital, Arminia Bielefeld remain in the relegation play-off place, with Mainz flying in behind.Borussia Dortmund have scored in 30 games in a row in all comps, but have lost eight Bundesliga games already this season, leaving the supposed title challengers a distant 13 points behind Bayern.Inconsistent Borussia Dortmund need to win to keep their Champions League qualification hopes in tact, and in-form Erling Haaland can fire BVB to a welcome victory.

Stuttgart's team news states that Nicolás González has a muscle injury which will rule him out for a few more weeks. Erik Thommy is out with a hip problem.Darko Churlinov is almost over nasal injury, while Daniel Didavi is fit again after a muscle injury. The influential Gonzalo Castro has shaken off a thigh injury.Arsenal loanee Dinos Mavropanos may start at the back, alongside Waldemar Anton.Hamadi Al Ghaddioui is nearing a return from a pelvic injury, while Momo Cisse could return to the squad after adductor issues.Schalke's team news states that Influential Mark Uth has a thigh injury and is struggling to be fit in time, as is Nassim Boujellab with ankle ligament damage.Goalkeeper Frederik Rönnow has a muscle injury, and Ralf Fährmann suffered a stomach muscle injury in the Ruhr derby. Michael Langer will probably continue between the sticks, having come on as sub last weekend.After a squabble, Vedad Ibisevic's contract has been paid up. Amine Harit was, however, given a reprieve and Nabil Bentaleb has also been given another chance as Schalke desperately fight relegation. The ex-Spurs man is struggling though with a muscle injury.January arrival Shkodran Mustafi missed the derby last week and will be assessed nearer this game.Veteran striker Klaas Jan Huntelaar is back from Ajax, but the former Real Madrid striker just cannot shake off a calf problem to help in the relegation battle.Skipper Omar Mascarell is battling a calf injury, while defender Salif Sane has a knee problem. Steven Skrzybski has a torn muscle.Kilian Ludewig had a foot operation and Gonçalo Paciencia, a knee op, both are still on the mend.

Draws are no good for bottom club Schalke in their current predicament, and this is another must win game for the Royal Blues. Schalke have scrambled just a couple of draws in their last seven games and are nine points from safety.Interestingly, Schalke, who are without an away win all season, have won on their last four trips to Stuttgart. Given the prolonged absence of Nicolás González and Stuttgart's poor home form, this represents a good opportunity for the Royal Blues to grab a much-needed away success, provided they can keep in-form dynamo Silas Wamangituka in check.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Coach Oliver Glasner has been able to field the same starting eleven regularly - a nucleus which has proved very hard to beat this season. However, USMNT defender John Brooks is suspended against his former club, so Glasner will have to tinker with the defence.Josip Brekalo suffered concussion in training, while Maximilian Arnold was unable to train in midweek and has to be a doubt.Pavao Pervan, Maxence Lacroix and Jerome Roussillon are available after encounters with COVID-19. Xaver Schlager, Maximilian Philipp and Jeffrey Bruma are all able to play after quarantine as well.Admir Mehmedi is fit again after an Achilles injury.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Márton Dárdai may play at the back, the coach's son.Sami Khedira has joined from Juventus and the German World Cup winner will likely start in midfield.Striker Jhon Córdoba is nearing a return from a muscle injury, but Aussie international Mathew Leckie is ruled out with a muscle injury.Nemanja Radonjic has joined on loan from Marseille but has a groin injury.Skipper Dedryck Boyata is a big loss at the back with a foot injury, but fellow defenders Jordan Torunarigha and Marvin Plattenhardt have both returned to training at least.Matheus Cunha cannot train at full intensity because of adductor problems and has totally flattered to deceive of late. Jessic Ngankam is nearing a return from a muscle injury.Luca Netz made his debut as a substitute recently. At 17 years and 232 days, the left-sided defender is the second youngest ever player in the club's history.Javairo Dilrosun has a knee injury and will be out for a few more weeks.

Third-placed Wolfsburg go into the northern Derby, having not conceded a goal in 577 minutes - a new club record, and are very hard to beat, only losing twice this season to big guns Bayern and Dortmund. The Wolves have, however, struggled to turn one point into three with nine draws, the joint most in the Bundesliga.Hertha Berlin have picked up just a couple of points in eight games, amassing a paltry 18 points this season, which is an extremely poor return considering no Bundesliga club spent more on transfers in 2020 than the capital city club. Wolfsburg have conceded just six goals this year, while Hertha have only found the net six times.After that hideous run, Hertha are just a point off the relegation spot and need to start picking up points. That said, Hertha have shown slow signs of improvement under new (and old) coach Pal Dardai are perfectly capable of nicking a point against the odds.

RBL's team news states that January signing Dominik Szoboszlai has adductor problems and has still not played his first game for the club.Emil Forsberg is over a knee injury, while Justin Kluivert is fit again after an ankle injury.Hee-Chan Hwang is over his encounter with COVID-19, as is Lazar Samardzic.Marcel Halstenberg is over his adductor problems, while fellow German international Benjamin Henrichs is nearing a return from a knee injury. Konrad Laimer is still on his way back from his own knee injury.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will leave for Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season and may have to rotate here after Manchester City in midweek.Marcus Thuram has been battling a knee niggle but may come in for Jonas Hofmann who hobbled off against Manchester City in midweek.Swiss forward Breel Embolo had to pay a heavy fine for contravening COVID-19 regulations. Striker partner Alassane Plea is also fit again after minor injury problems.Valentino Lazaro is fit after a muscle problem, while key midfielder Denis Zakaria should return after a knee injury.Stefan Lainer is definitely out with a thigh injury, while Christoph Kramer and Ramy Bensebaini are doubts after picking up knocks against Manchester City.

RB Leipzig are suddenly back in the title race after Bayern's recent slip, and find themselves just two points adrift. Leipzig boast the best home record, nine home wins, and 11 clean sheets from reliable goalkeeper Péter Gulácsi is a league-high.Needing to recover from a tough midweek encounter Champions League against Manchester City, Gladbach will rue spurning a league-high 18 points from winning positions already this season.Gladbach have not been the same side since news broke that highly-coveted coach Marco Rose will not be at the helm next term. Leipzig should get the job done on home soil to remain in title contention.

Union Berlin's team news states that Striker Taiwo Awoniyi is ruled out with a thigh injury, while Niko Gießelmann is out with a shoulder injury.Loris Karius is likely to keep his spot in goal ahead of Andreas Luthe, who has been missing recently due to personal reasons. The Liverpool loanee has not let in a goal at all since playing his first Bundesliga game in well over four years recently.Petar Musa has signed on loan from Slavia Prague and will boost attacking options.Sheraldo Becker is struggling with an ankle injury, while Leon Dajaku could make the squad after his recent arrival from Bayern Munich.Former German international Max Kruse is nearing a return from a thigh injury which has kept him out since before Xmas. Christopher Lenz has a muscle injury, as does Grisha Prömel, both will be assessed nearer the game.Christian Gentner is fit again after a calf injury, while Finnish striker Joel Pohjanpalo is also back from an ankle injury.Striker Anthony Ujah is facing yet another operation after over six months out with a long-term knee issue.Hoffenheim's team news states that Kevin Vogt is available after suspension and could play alongside Chris Richards, the loan signing from Bayern Munich.Benjamin Hubner, Konstantinos Stafylidis and Ermin Bicakcic are all long-term absentees, while Dennis Geiger is ruled out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury.Ryan Sessegnon returned to action in the Europa League, while Kevin Akpoguma has returned to training as well.Prolific striker Andrej Kramaric is expected to be fit, but Ishak Belfodil has adductor pain.Munas Dabbur and Sargis Adamyan both had COVID-19, but are now available. Stefan Posch is the latest to test positive.

Hoffenheim have improved of late, especially defensively, and are starting to move up the table with intent.Union scrambled their first win in six games last weekend, but the goals seem to have dried up.Union have drawn six at home already this season so a low-scoring draw may be the best option, particularly as Hoffenheim have Europa League action on Thursday to recover from.

Leverkusen's team news states that Leverkusen will desperately miss Lukás Hrádecky in goal, having suffered an Achilles injury. Niklas Lomb has struggled as a replacement.Moussa Diaby is suspended after picking up five bookings. Demarai Gray could replace Diaby.Another January arrival Timothy Fosu-Mensah may play in defence given Bayer Leverkusen's nightmare injury list. Leverkusen's third January arrival, Jeremie Frimpong, is also a good option and could feature on the right.Julian Baumgartlinger has had a knee operation but hopes to play again this season. Former German international Karim Bellarabi is nearing a return from a thigh injury. Nadiem Amiri is back in the squad after his bout of COVID-19, joining Wendell, Daley Sinkgraven, Kerem Demirbay, Edmond Tapsoba who are all over the virus as well. The Bender brothers, Sven and Lars, will retire at the end of the season. Lars needs an operation and will be out until the end of March, but Sven made his first start in three months last weekend.Mitchell Weiser has a thigh injury and is ruled out for several weeks, while Chile star Charles Aránguiz is a welcome addition after recovering from an Achilles injury.Paulinho is still on the mend from an ACL injury, but Exequiel Palacios has returned to training after several months out after suffering a back injury while playing for Argentina.Santiago Arias, on loan from Atletico Madrid, will be out for several months after suffering a fibula fracture while on international duty with Colombia.Freiburg's team news states that Baptiste Santamaria, a club record signing from SCO Angers in France, is fit after a knee injury.Keven Schlotterbeck is nearing a return from a muscle injury, while Roland Sallai is over an ankle injury. Nicolas Höfler is available after suspension.Jonathan Schmid should return after a thigh injury, while Yannik Keitel is close to a return from a knee problem.Chang-Hoon Kwon is ruled out for around six weeks with a knee injury.New first-choice keeper Mark Flekken immediately got injured, so Florian Müller, a loan signing from Mainz, has grasped his chance in goal.

Freiburg will aim to keep free-flowing Leverkusen quiet for long periods and seek joy on the counter.Bayer Leverkusen have not kept a clean sheet in 10 attempts, and must regroup from Europa League inconvenience on Thursday with an ever-growing injury list.Freiburg are never to be underestimated under wily coach Christian Streich, but Leverkusen who have not lost to Freiburg in seven meetings, should secure the home win needed to remain on course for Champions League qualification.

Schalke's team news states that Christian Gross was fired on Sunday, the fourth Schalke coach to lose his job in this horror season. Dimitrios Grammozis is the new man in charge.Benjamin Stambouli is set for his 100th Bundesliga appearance and goes in search of his first league goal.Influential Mark Uth has a thigh injury and is struggling to be fit in time, as is Nassim Boujellab with ankle ligament damage.Goalkeeper Frederik Rönnow has a muscle injury, and Ralf Fährmann suffered a stomach muscle injury in the Ruhr derby. Michael Langer will probably continue between the sticks.After a squabble, Vedad Ibisevic's contract has been paid up. Amine Harit was, however, given a reprieve and Nabil Bentaleb has also been given another chance as Schalke desperately fight relegation. The ex-Spurs man is struggling though with a muscle injury.January arrival Shkodran Mustafi will be assessed nearer this game.Veteran striker Klaas Jan Huntelaar is back from Ajax, but the former Real Madrid striker just cannot shake off a calf problem to help in the relegation battle.Skipper Omar Mascarell is battling a calf injury, while defender Salif Sane has a knee problem. Steven Skrzybski has a torn muscle.Kilian Ludewig had a foot operation and Gonçalo Paciencia, a knee op, both are still on the mend.Mainz's team news states that Danny da Costa has impressed since joining from Eintracht Frankfurt, alongside Dominik Kohr who made the same move across the Main.Robert Glatzel has done well since joining from Cardiff on loan in January, while Robin Quaison is nearing a return from a knee injury. Leandro Barreiro Martins has recovered from an ear injury.Stefan Bell has been a rock since making his first Bundesliga appearance in 658 days at the heart of the Mainz defence.Edimilson Fernandes is over a second bout of COVID-19, but has an ankle knock.Philipp Mwene returned from an ankle injury, while Pierre Kunde Malong is over his encounter with COVID-19.Former Real Madrid striker Adam Szalai has recovered from a knee op and is pushing for a starting spot.

A meeting of the bottom two and Schalke especially look doomed to relegation, on a run of only one win in 39 games, including last season post-COVID19.Draws are no good for bottom club Schalke in their current predicament, and this is another must win game for the Royal Blues. Schalke have scrambled just a couple of draws in their last eight games and sit a forlorn nine points from safety.Mainz have beaten RB Leipzig and Gladbach lately and have shown definite signs of improvement under new coach Bo Svensson, but have squandered 15 points from leading positions explaining why they still sit one off the bottom.Schalke must win to close the gap to a manageable five points, this is their last chance to salvage something from this season, under their fifth head coach!

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Luka Jovic is back on the bench with Andre Silva fit after a back injury.Djibril Sow is available after suspension and could edge out Sebastian Rode in midfield. Frankfurt have Obite Evan Ndicka back from a ban to bolster a defence that looked shaky last week without him.Ragnar Ache returned recently from a long-term thigh injury.Stuttgart's team news states that Nicolás González has a muscle injury which will rule him out for a few more weeks. Erik Thommy is out with a hip problem.Darko Churlinov is almost over nasal injury, while Daniel Didavi is fit again after a muscle injury. The influential Gonzalo Castro has shaken off a thigh injury.Arsenal loanee Dinos Mavropanos may start at the back, alongside Waldemar Anton.Hamadi Al Ghaddioui is nearing a return from a pelvic injury, while Momo Cisse could return to the squad after adductor issues.

Eintracht Frankfurt suffered a shock defeat last Friday, their first loss since 11 December 2020.Only a tardy start to the season, sharing the spoils on nine occasions, has prevented a genuine title challenge. Two attacking sides meet so we should see a few goals, while Stuttgart have racked up six away wins, only champions Bayern have won more often on their travels.Frankfurt have scored in 22 of their 23 league games this season, taking the lead in their last 16 games, smashing a club record from way back in 1971-72.Frankfurt can return to winning ways, provided they keep in-form dynamo Silas Wamangituka in check.

Freiburg's team news states that Baptiste Santamaria, a club record signing from SCO Angers in France, is fit after a knee injury.Keven Schlotterbeck is nearing a return from a muscle injury, while Roland Sallai is over an ankle injury. Nicolas Höfler is available after suspension.Jonathan Schmid should return after a thigh injury, while Yannik Keitel is close to a return from a knee problem.Chang-Hoon Kwon is ruled out for a few more weeks with a knee injury.New first-choice keeper Mark Flekken immediately got injured, so Florian Müller, a loan signing from Mainz, has grasped his chance in goal.RBL's team news states that January signing Dominik Szoboszlai has adductor problems and has still not played his first game for the club.Willi Orban fractured his hand in midweek so is unlikely to be risked, while Marcel Sabitzer is suspended after picking up five yellow cards.Angeliño missed last weekend with a muscle injury but could return. Emil Forsberg is over a knee injury, while Justin Kluivert is fit again after an ankle injury.Hee-Chan Hwang is over his encounter with COVID-19, as is Lazar Samardzic.Marcel Halstenberg is over his adductor problems, while fellow German international Benjamin Henrichs has returned from a knee injury. Konrad Laimer is still on his way back from his own knee injury.

Two points behind Bayern, RB Leipzig stayed in the title race after coming back from two goals down at half time to beat Gladbach last weekend, wrapping up their fifth win in a row.Leipzig had German Cup action in midweek, while the home side enjoy a full week to prepare and no travel.Freiburg beat Borussia Dortmund at home recently, and will aim to keep free-flowing Leipzig quiet for long periods and seek joy on the counter - even on home soil.11 clean sheets from reliable goalkeeper Péter Gulácsi is a joint league best, but Leipzig are sure to have one eye on next week's Champions League return against Liverpool.Freiburg have won their last three at home to Leipzig and are never to be underestimated under wily coach Christian Streich, and love nothing more than upsetting higher-placed opposition.All three results are possible here, but Leipzig are the favourites to take the three points.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Márton Dárdai may play at the back, the coach's son.Sami Khedira will miss the game against his brother's club with a muscle injury.Nemanja Radonjic and Matheus Cunha are also ruled out with muscle injuries.Striker Jhon Córdoba is fit after a muscle injury, but Aussie international Mathew Leckie is ruled out with a muscle injury.Skipper Dedryck Boyata is a big loss at the back with a foot injury, but fellow defenders Jordan Torunarigha and Marvin Plattenhardt have both returned to training at least.Jessic Ngankam is nearing a return from a muscle injury.Luca Netz made his debut as a substitute recently. At 17 years and 232 days, the left-sided defender is the second youngest ever player in the club's history.Javairo Dilrosun has a knee injury and will be out for a few more weeks.Augsburg's team news states that Coach Heiko Herrlich will probably stick with the guts of the side that snatched a win in Mainz last weekend.Ruben Vargas is fit after an ankle injury, while Laszlo Benes has signed on loan from Borussia Monchengladbach and could start here. Alfred Finnbogason has a calf problem which will rule him out, while Iago is a big loss too.André Hahn is over his encounter with COVID-19, but Raphael Framberger has made a return from a muscle injury.Noah Joel Sarenren Bazee is fit after a knee injury, while Jan Morávek is close to a return from a muscle injury.

Hertha Berlin have picked up just a couple of points in nine games, amassing a paltry 18 points this season, which is dreadful considering no Bundesliga club spent more on transfers in 2020 than the capital city club. Hertha have only found the net six times this year, while Augsburg kept their first clean sheet in nine games in the vital win at Mainz.After that hideous run, Hertha are just a point off the relegation spot and need to start picking up points and new (and old) coach Pal Dardai's side can nick the win here.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Kevin Vogt could play alongside Chris Richards, the loan signing from Bayern Munich.Benjamin Hubner, Konstantinos Stafylidis and Ermin Bicakcic are all long-term absentees, while Dennis Geiger is ruled out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury.Ryan Sessegnon could return to the starting line up, while Kevin Akpoguma has returned to training as well.Prolific striker Andrej Kramaric is expected to be fit, but Ishak Belfodil has adductor pain.Munas Dabbur and Sargis Adamyan both had COVID-19, but are now available. Stefan Posch was the latest to test positive.Wolfsburg's team news states that Coach Oliver Glasner has been able to field the same starting eleven regularly - a nucleus which has proved very hard to beat this season. USMNT defender John Brooks is available after suspension, Marin Pongracic replaces him on the naughty step.Glasner may rotate though after Wednesday's German Cup defeat in Leipzig.Pavao Pervan, Maxence Lacroix and Jerome Roussillon are available after encounters with COVID-19. Xaver Schlager, Maximilian Philipp and Jeffrey Bruma are all able to play after quarantine as well.Admir Mehmedi is fit again after an Achilles injury.

Wolfsburg were involved in German Cup action in midweek, while Hoffenheim, unusually, have a full week to prepare, now spared the poison chalice of Europa League Thursdays after their exit.11 clean sheets from solid goalkeeper Koen Casteels are a joint league best, and third-placed Wolfsburg have not conceded a goal in 667 minutes - a new club record.The Wolves have conceded just six goals this year and remain very hard to beat, only losing twice this season to big guns Bayern and Dortmund. That said with nine draws, Wolfsburg have struggled at times to turn one point into three and this could take the Wolves into double figures.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will leave for Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season.Skipper Lars Stindl is suspended after picking up five yellow cards.Swiss forward Breel Embolo had to pay a heavy fine for contravening COVID-19 regulations. Striker partner Alassane Plea is also fit again after minor injury problems.Valentino Lazaro is fit after a muscle problem, while key midfielder Denis Zakaria should return after a knee injury.Stefan Lainer is fit after a thigh injury, while Christoph Kramer and Ramy Bensebaini are both expected to be fit as well after cup action in midweek.Leverkusen's team news states that Leverkusen desperately miss Lukás Hrádecky in goal, having suffered an Achilles injury. Niklas Lomb has struggled as a replacement, so Lennart Grill looks like the new man between the sticks.Moussa Diaby is available after suspension, but Jamaica international Leon Bailey replaces the Frenchman on the naughty step. Ex-Leicester man Demarai Gray could feature in an attacking role. Another January arrival Timothy Fosu-Mensah has suffered an ACL injury and will be out for several months. Daley Sinkgraven is out for three weeks with a thigh injury and will be replaced at left-back by Wendell. Leverkusen's third January arrival, Jeremie Frimpong, is also a good option and could feature on the right.Julian Baumgartlinger has had a knee operation but hopes to play again this season. Former German international Karim Bellarabi is nearing a return from a thigh injury. Nadiem Amiri is back in the squad after his bout of COVID-19, joining Wendell, Daley Sinkgraven, Kerem Demirbay, Edmond Tapsoba who are all over the virus as well. However, young talent Florian Wirtz this week became the sixth Leverkusener to go down with COVID-19. Exequiel Palacios could come into midfield after recovering from a back injury.The Bender brothers, Sven and Lars, will retire at the end of the season. Lars needs an operation and will be out until the end of March, while Sven made his first start in three months recently.Mitchell Weiser has a thigh injury and is ruled out for several weeks, while Chile star Charles Aránguiz is a welcome addition after recovering from an Achilles injury.Paulinho is still on the mend from an ACL injury, while Santiago Arias, on loan from Atletico Madrid, is also out after suffering a fibula fracture while on international duty with Colombia last year.

Spurning a 2-0 half time lead in Leipzig last weekend is typical for Gladbach, who have relinquished a league-high 21 points from winning positions already this season.Indeed, Gladbach winless in five games, have slumped since news broke that highly-coveted coach Marco Rose will not be at the helm next term. Bayer Leverkusen have taken only 9 points from 11 games, since topping the table briefly in December. The untimely slump leaves coach Peter Bosz's job hanging by a thread. Without a clean sheet in 11 attempts, Leverkusen at least do not have to worry about Europa League inconvenience on Thursdays any more.Gladbach exited the German Cup on Tuesday, while the visitors, unusually, have a full week to prepare.Both sides need to win to stay in the hunt for a Champions League qualification spot, so a draw is a good shout here.

Bayern's team news states that 28 goals in 22 appearances, Robert Lewandowski keeps on racking up the Bundesliga scoring records as Bayern seek an eighth-straight league title. "Lewy" especially enjoys playing against his former club too, scoring at least twice in the last five home meetings.Thomas Müller is back from COVID-19, while Serge Gnabry is also fit from a muscle injury. Benjamin Pavard is still feeling the effects of his encounter with COVID-19. Douglas Costa has a foot injury and is ruled out for several weeks, as is Corentin Tolisso with a muscle injury.Leon Goretzka and Javi Martinez both had COVID-19, but have both returned to the fray. Back-up keeper Alexander Nübel is nearing a return from an ankle injury, but Tanguy Nianzou is ruled out with a muscle injury.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Jadon Sancho and Raphael Guerreiro picked up knocks in the cup in midweek and miss out. Giovanni Reyna is also sidelined, which should see Julian Brandt and Thorgan Hazard start on the wings.Marco Reus has not scored in the Bundesliga in 833 minutes. The Bavarian capital would be a good place to end that goal drought.Goalkeeper Roman Bürki is fit after a shoulder injury, but Marwin Hitz may keep his spot in goal.Manuel Akanji suffered a muscle tear and will be out for several weeks, while Axel Witsel has torn his Achilles and will not play again this season.

The Klassiker, the biggest game in German football and yet another meeting of the two heavyweights when the title is not on the line. Dortmund travel in hope, rather than expectation, having lost their last six games in Munich.Looking vulnerable, FIFA Club World Cup champions Bayern have seen their lead at the top dwindle to just two points after some indifferent results. Despite all this, Bayern have scored in 54 games in a row, last failing to do so in February 2020 against RB Leipzig. 67 goals after 23 Bundesliga games is a new club record as well.Borussia Dortmund have scored in 31 games in a row in all comps themselves, but defeats in eight Bundesliga games already this season, leave the supposed title challengers a distant 13 points behind Bayern.Inconsistent Borussia Dortmund need to win to keep their Champions League qualification hopes in tact, and in-form Erling Haaland is the key man in a high-scoring thriller.

FC Koln's team news states that Jonas Hector is nearing a return from a muscle injury, while Marius Wolf is making progress with his ankle injury.Rafael Czichos picked up his fifth yellow at Bayern last weekend and is suspended. Sebastiaan Bornauw is ruled out with a back injury. Sava-Arangel Cestic seems the likeliest to step in at the back, along with Jannes Horn.Ismail Jakobs is nearing a return from an ankle injury, while Ondrej Duda has a rib problem.Emmanuel Dennis has joined on loan from Club Bruges. The Nigerian talent has already enjoyed more success than compatriot Tolu Arokodare who has failed to make any sort of impact up front.Max Meyer has been on the scrapheap at Crystal Palace for months but has been offered a deal here until the end of the season and could play in midfield.Sebastian Andersson is still ruled out with a knee problem, while Florian Kainz is closing in on a return from a knee injury.Werder Bremen's team news states that Defenders Ludwig Augustinsson, Marco Friedl and Milos Veljkovic are struggling with minor injuries but all are expected to make the squad.Davie Selke is struggling with a thigh injury, as is central defender Ömer Toprak. Both will assessed nearer the time.Young talent Nick Woltemade has given Bremen a boost by extending his contract.Striker Niclas Füllkrug is over an ankle injury, while Christian Groß has shaken off a calf problem.Patrick Erras continues his struggles against a hip injury.

Werder Bremen ended Frankfurt's fine run with a shock win last Friday, and boast identical home and away records 3 wins, 4 draws / defeats.Koln have the second worst home league record, only picking up six points, with just one win in the cathedral city.Neither of these two can be backed with any confidence so a share of the spoils could be the answer, sitting firmly on the fence.

Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Arminia have hit the panic button and sacked coach Uwe Neuhaus, despite almost beating Bayern Munich two games ago. Frank Kramer is the new man in charge, on a contract until 2023.Japanese international Masaya Okugawa has joined on loan from RB Salzburg and could force his way into the side.Fabian Kunze is suspended after picking up five yellow cards. Nils Seufert could slot into midfield.Michel Vlap has signed on loan from Anderlecht and scored the opener against mighty Bayern recently.Andreas Voglsammer has shaken off a calf injury, while Ritsu Doan is fit after a minor muscle tear.Midfielder Manuel Prietl is over a thigh injury.Union Berlin's team news states that Striker Taiwo Awoniyi is ruled out with a thigh injury, while Niko Gießelmann is out with a shoulder injury.Loris Karius is likely to lose his spot in goal to Andreas Luthe, who has been missing recently due to personal reasons. The Liverpool loanee has performed well since stepping in for his first Bundesliga game in well over four years.Sheraldo Becker is struggling with an ankle injury, while Leon Dajaku could make the squad after his arrival from Bayern Munich.Former German international Max Kruse scored last week after his comeback from a thigh injury which kept him out since before Christmas. Christopher Lenz has a muscle injury, as does Grisha Prömel, both will be assessed nearer the game after missing training again in midweek.Christian Gentner is fit again after a calf injury, while Finnish striker Joel Pohjanpalo is also back from an ankle injury.Striker Anthony Ujah has had yet another operation after over six months out with a long-term knee issue.

Only two games ago, lowly Arminia Bielefeld took a deserved point off Bayern in their own backyard, but decided to hit the panic button and sack coach Uwe Neuhaus.Arminia have won only one of their last 15 meetings with the visitors from the capital, but will be looking for the proverbial new manager bounce with Frank Kramer in charge.Union have a league-high ten draws already this season so a low-scoring draw may be the best option here.

Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Arminia activated the panic button and sacked coach Uwe Neuhaus, despite almost beating Bayern Munich three games ago. Frank Kramer is the new man in charge on a contract until 2023.Sergio Córdova suffered a mouth injury on Sunday but is expected to be fit, while Cebio Soukou has a muscle injury and is ruled out.Japanese international Masaya Okugawa has joined on loan from RB Salzburg and could force his way into the side.Fabian Kunze is available after suspension and may come in for Nils Seufert in midfield.Michel Vlap has signed on loan from Anderlecht and scored the opener against mighty Bayern recently.Andreas Voglsammer has shaken off a calf injury, while Ritsu Doan is fit after a minor muscle problem.Midfielder Manuel Prietl is over a thigh injury.Werder Bremen's team news states that Striker Niclas Füllkrug is over an ankle injury and started at the weekend, while Christian Groß has shaken off a calf problem. US talent Joshua Sargent scored though and may keep his spot up front.Defenders Ludwig Augustinsson, Marco Friedl and Milos Veljkovic are struggling with minor injuries, but all are expected to make the squad.Davie Selke is struggling with a thigh injury, as is key central defender Ömer Toprak. Both will assessed nearer the time.Young talent Nick Woltemade has given Bremen a boost by extending his contract.Patrick Erras continues his struggles against a hip injury.

A rearranged game after the earlier fixture fell victim to the snow in Germany. Both teams played on Sunday and fitness worries will be assessed closer to kick off.Arminia will be looking for the proverbial new manager bounce with Frank Kramer in charge for the second home game in succession, and with a much-needed win can move them out of the relegation places.Werder Bremen ended Frankfurt's fine run recently and will be favourites for the three points.Neither of these two can be backed with any confidence so a share of the spoils could be the answer, but a slight preference is given to Bremen who look to have more goals in them at the moment.

Augsburg's team news states that Coach Heiko Herrlich is under pressure for a result against his former club where he starred as a striker in the nineties.Ruben Vargas is fit after an ankle injury, while Laszlo Benes has signed on loan from Gladbach and will be keen to impress against his parent club.Alfred Finnbogason has a calf problem which will rule him out, while Iago is a big loss too.André Hahn is over his encounter with COVID-19, but Raphael Framberger has made a return from a muscle injury.Noah Joel Sarenren Bazee is fit after a knee injury, while Jan Morávek is close to a return from a muscle injury.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will leave for Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season.Skipper Lars Stindl is available after suspension.Swiss forward Breel Embolo had to pay a heavy fine for contravening COVID-19 regulations. Striker partner Alassane Plea is also fit again after minor injury problems.Valentino Lazaro is fit after a muscle problem, while key midfielder Denis Zakaria should return after a knee injury.Stefan Lainer is fit after a thigh injury, while Ramy Bensebaini is also expected to be fit. Germany 2014 World Cup winner Christoph Kramer is struggling with a muscle tear.

A meeting of two struggling sides led by two under-pressure coaches.Augsburg are not out of the relegation mire just yet under Heiko Herrlich and have kept only one clean sheet in 10 games, while Gladbach have lost five straight games, nosediving since news broke that highly-coveted coach Marco Rose will not be at the helm next term. Gladbach have relinquished a league-high 21 points from winning positions already this season, with too many draws (10) until the "Rose Rot" recently set in.That said, Gladbach need to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot and can nick the win.

Mainz's team news states that Karim Onisiwo is ruled out with a thigh problem.Danny da Costa has impressed since joining from Eintracht Frankfurt, alongside Dominik Kohr who made the same move across the Main.Robert Glatzel has done well since joining from Cardiff on loan in January, while Robin Quaison is nearing a return from a knee injury. Leandro Barreiro Martins has recovered from an ear injury.Stefan Bell has been a rock since making his first Bundesliga appearance in 658 days at the heart of the Mainz defence.Edimilson Fernandes is over a second bout of COVID-19, and could return from an ankle knock.Philipp Mwene returned from an ankle injury, while Pierre Kunde Malong is over his encounter with COVID-19.Former Real Madrid striker Adam Szalai has recovered from a knee op and is pushing for a starting spot.Freiburg's team news states that Chang-Hoon Kwon is close to a return from a knee injury.Baptiste Santamaria, a club record signing from SCO Angers in France, is fit after a knee injury.Keven Schlotterbeck is fit after a muscle injury, while Roland Sallai is over an ankle injury. Nicolas Höfler is available after suspension.Jonathan Schmid should return after a thigh injury, while Yannik Keitel is close to a return from a knee problem.New first-choice keeper Mark Flekken immediately got injured, so Florian Müller, a loan signing from Mainz, has grasped his chance in goal.

Mainz have beaten RB Leipzig and Gladbach lately and have shown definite signs of improvement under new coach Bo Svensson, but have squandered 15 points from leading positions explaining why they still sit one off the bottom.Freiburg beat in-form Borussia Dortmund recently and are never to be underestimated under wily coach Christian Streich.But Mainz have mustered 13 wins in 23 meetings with Freiburg, their best record against any Bundesliga opponent. Back Mainz to keep up that positive run of results.

Union Berlin's team news states that Striker Taiwo Awoniyi is ruled out with a thigh injury, while Niko Gießelmann is out with a shoulder injury.Loris Karius has lost his spot in goal to Andreas Luthe, who was missing recently due to personal reasons. The Liverpool loanee performed well though after stepping in for his first Bundesliga game in well over four years.Sheraldo Becker is struggling with an ankle injury, while Leon Dajaku could make the squad after his arrival from Bayern Munich.Former German international Max Kruse has made his comeback from a thigh injury which kept him out since before Christmas. Christopher Lenz has a muscle injury, as does Grisha Prömel, both will be assessed nearer the game. Christian Gentner is fit again after a calf injury, while Finnish striker Joel Pohjanpalo is also back from an ankle injury.Striker Anthony Ujah has had yet another operation after over six months out with a long-term knee issue.FC Koln's team news states that Jonas Hector scored last weekend on his return from a muscle injury, while Marius Wolf is making progress with his ankle injury.Rafael Czichos is available after suspension, while Sebastiaan Bornauw is ruled out with a back injury. Sava-Arangel Cestic seems the likeliest to step in at the back, along with Jannes Horn.Ismail Jakobs is fit after an ankle injury, while Ondrej Duda is over a rib problem.Emmanuel Dennis has joined on loan from Club Bruges. The Nigerian talent has already enjoyed more success than compatriot Tolu Arokodare who has failed to make any sort of impact up front.Max Meyer has been on the scrapheap at Crystal Palace for months but has been offered a deal here until the end of the season and could play in midfield.Sebastian Andersson is back in training following a knee problem, but is not expected to feature against his former club, while Florian Kainz is closing in on a return from a knee injury.

Koln have beaten some decent sides on their travels, including Dortmund and Gladbach and snatched a point off Leipzig.Goals have dried up of late for Union Berlin, who have a league-high 11 draws already this season.Neither of these two can be backed with any confidence so a share of the spoils could be the answer, sitting firmly on the fence.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Striker Niclas Füllkrug is struggling with an ankle injury, but US talent Joshua Sargent has scored in three consecutive games and will probably start up front anyway.Marco Friedl will miss the game against his former club through suspension after picking up his fifth yellow in midweek. Christian Groß could come into defence.Young talent Nick Woltemade has given Bremen a boost by extending his contract.Patrick Erras could return to the squad after recovering from a hip injury.Bayern's team news states that With a hat-trick in Der Klassiker to reach 31 goals in 23 appearances, Robert Lewandowski keeps on racking up the Bundesliga scoring records as Bayern seek an eighth-straight league title. Bremen and Leipzig are the only Bundesliga sides that "Lewy" has not scored against this season.Jerome Boateng hobbled off in Der Klassiker with a knee injury but has since returned to training.Thomas Müller is back from COVID-19, while Serge Gnabry is also fit from a muscle injury. Benjamin Pavard is also nearing a return after his encounter with COVID-19. Leon Goretzka and Javi Martinez had COVID-19 too, but have both successfully returned to the fray. Douglas Costa has a foot injury and is ruled out for several weeks, as is Corentin Tolisso with a muscle injury.Back-up keeper Alexander Nübel is nearing a return from an ankle injury, but Tanguy Nianzou is ruled out with a muscle injury.David Alaba did not train on Thursday and will be assessed nearer the game.

Bayern recovered from two goals down to beat Dortmund and keep their two point lead at the top in tact. Bayern's sixth comeback win of the season matches a club record. Bayern have scored in 55 games in a row, last failing to do so in February 2020 against RB Leipzig. 71 goals after 24 Bundesliga games is a new club record as well.Werder Bremen won in midweek, while Bayern enjoy a rare full week to rest and prepare.Bremen are winless in 24 attempts against Bayern, and have lost their last 11 home games against the reigning champions, who clinched the title in June 2020 on this ground. Anything other than a comfortable Bayern win would be a huge surprise.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Coach Oliver Glasner has been able to field the same starting XI regularly - a nucleus which has proved very hard to beat this season. But the Austrian will have to make changes this week. Maxence Lacroix and Xaver Schlager are both suspended for one game after picking up five yellow cards.Marin Pongracic is however available after suspension, but Paulo Otavio replaces him on the naughty step after his red card last weekend which means a hefty four match ban.Renato Steffen is ruled out "long term" with an ankle injury, while Jerome Roussillon has a calf injury.John Anthony Brooks and Marin Pongracic violated COVID-19 protocols recently by attending a party. The defensive duo have been fined by Wolfsburg and may not feature at the weekend.Schalke's team news states that Christian Gross became the fourth Schalke coach to lose his job in this horror season. Dimitrios Grammozis is the new man in charge and started with a goalless draw last Friday.Benjamin Stambouli made his 100th Bundesliga appearance recently but is still to score his first league goal.Omar Mascarell is suspended after picking up five yellow cards, while 18-year-old Kerim Calhanoglu, cousin of AC Milan ace Hakan, made his debut last weekend.Influential Mark Uth has a thigh injury and is struggling to be fit in time, as is Nassim Boujellab with ankle ligament damage.Goalkeeper Frederik Rönnow has recovered from a muscle injury and will play in goal as Ralf Fährmann suffered a stomach muscle injury.After a squabble, Vedad Ibisevic's contract has been paid up. Amine Harit was, however, given a reprieve and Nabil Bentaleb has also been given another chance as Schalke desperately fight relegation. The ex-Spurs man is struggling though with a muscle injury.Veteran striker Klaas Jan Huntelaar is back from Ajax, but the former Real Madrid striker just cannot shake off a calf problem to help in the relegation battle.Salif Sane has a knee problem and Steven Skrzybski has a torn muscle.Kilian Ludewig had a foot operation and Gonçalo Paciencia, a knee op, both are still on the mend.

Schalke look doomed to relegation, on a nightmare run of only one win in 40 games, including last season post-COVID19.Since matchday 18, Schalke have only scored twice, while Wolfsburg have only let in two goals.Draws are no good for bottom club Schalke in their current predicament, and this is another must win game for the Royal Blues. Schalke have scrambled just three draws in their last nine games, and sit a forlorn 10 points from safety.Wolfsburg are missing three regulars through suspension but should be still too good for the beleaguered visitors.Wolfsburg let in their first goal in 673 minutes last weekend in the defeat to Hoffenheim.With nine draws, Wolfsburg have struggled at times to turn one point into three and this could take the Wolves into double figures.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Jadon Sancho, Raphael Guerreiro and Giovanni Reyna all missed the defeat in Munich. The England international will miss out again here, but Guerreiro and Reyna could return to the squad.Erling Haaland hobbled off in Der Klassiker and with it BVB chances of winning the game. The Norwegian goal machine starred again in midweek and BVB cannot do without him at the moment.Marco Reus has not scored in the Bundesliga in over 1000 minutes. Goalkeeper Roman Bürki is fit after a shoulder injury, but Marwin Hitz may keep his spot in goal.Manuel Akanji is back in light training after a muscle tear, while Axel Witsel has torn his Achilles and will not play again this season.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Márton Dárdai may play at the back, the coach's son, while Rune Jarstein has won the goalkeeping spot under coach Pal Dardai.Sami Khedira will miss the game along with Matheus Cunha with muscle injuries.Nemanja Radonjic is also struggling, but striker Jhon Córdoba and Aussie international Mathew Leckie are both fit after muscle injuries.Skipper Dedryck Boyata is a big loss at the back with a foot injury. The Belgian international has not played this year, but at least fellow defenders Jordan Torunarigha and Marvin Plattenhardt are nearing a return, along with Jessic Ngankam.Luca Netz made his debut as a substitute recently. At 17 years and 232 days, the left-sided defender is the second youngest ever player in the club's history.Javairo Dilrosun is nearing a return from a knee injury.

Hertha Berlin picked up their first win under new (and old) coach Pal Dardai last weekend, their first in nine games.Hertha have garnered 21 points from 24 games this season, which is appalling considering no Bundesliga club spent more on transfers in 2020 than the capital city club. Dortmund squandered a two goal lead in Munich and their ninth defeat in the Bundesliga, leaves the supposed title challengers a distant 16 points behind Bayern.That said, Borussia Dortmund have scored in 32 games in a row in all comps and will be buoyed by their progress to the Champions League quarter-finals.BVB have found the net at home to Hertha in the previous 29 meetings, and need to win to keep their Champions League qualification hopes in tact. In-form Erling Haaland is the key man once again.

Leverkusen's team news states that Leverkusen desperately miss Lukás Hrádecky in goal, having suffered an Achilles injury. Niklas Lomb struggled as a replacement, so Lennart Grill is the new man between the sticks.Moussa Diaby and Jamaica international Leon Bailey will both return from suspension, so ex-Leicester man Demarai Gray could drop to the bench.Another January arrival Timothy Fosu-Mensah has suffered an ACL injury and will be out for several months. Daley Sinkgraven is out for three weeks with a thigh injury and will be replaced at left-back by Wendell. Leverkusen's third January arrival, Jeremie Frimpong, is also a good option and could feature on the right side of defence.Julian Baumgartlinger has had a knee operation but hopes to play again this season. Former German international Karim Bellarabi is nearing a return from a thigh injury. Nadiem Amiri is back in the squad after his bout of COVID-19, joining Wendell, Daley Sinkgraven, Kerem Demirbay, Edmond Tapsoba who are all over the virus as well. Young talent Florian Wirtz could return after his encounter with  COVID-19, while Exequiel Palacios could come into midfield after recovering from a back injury.The Bender brothers, Sven and Lars, will retire at the end of the season. Lars needs an operation and will be out until the end of March, while Sven made his first start in three months recently.Mitchell Weiser has a thigh injury and is ruled out for several weeks, while Chile star Charles Aránguiz is a welcome addition after recovering from an Achilles injury.Paulinho is still on the mend from an ACL injury, while Santiago Arias, on loan from Atletico Madrid, is also out after suffering a fibula fracture while on international duty with Colombia last year.Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Jacob Barrett Laursen went off in midweek with a thigh injury and is doubtful, while Nathan de Medina was sent off against Bremen and is suspended.Sergio Córdova suffered a mouth injury on Sunday but is expected to be fit, while Cebio Soukou has a muscle injury and is ruled out.Japanese international Masaya Okugawa has joined on loan from RB Salzburg and could force his way into the side.Michel Vlap has signed on loan from Anderlecht and scored the opener against mighty Bayern recently.Andreas Voglsammer has shaken off a calf injury, while Ritsu Doan is fit after a minor muscle problem.

Despite winning last weekend, Bayer Leverkusen have taken only 12 points from 12 games, a disappointing run since topping the table briefly in December playing some delightful football.This untimely slump leaves coach Peter Bosz's job hanging by a thread. Having kept their first clean sheet in 16 games in the win last weekend, Leverkusen at least do not have to worry about Europa League inconvenience on Thursdays any more.Only a few games ago, lowly Arminia Bielefeld took a deserved point off Bayern in their own backyard, but decided to activate the panic button and sack coach Uwe Neuhaus.Looking for the proverbial new manager bounce, Frank Kramer has not been able to win a game so far.Leverkusen need to win to stay in the hunt for a Champions League qualification spot, and can get the job done against an ailing Arminia, short of ideas and goals.

Stuttgart's team news states that Nicolás González is nearing a return from a muscle injury, but will not be risked just yet. Erik Thommy is expected to return after a hip problem.Darko Churlinov is almost over nasal injury, while Daniel Didavi is fit again after a muscle injury. The influential Gonzalo Castro has shaken off a thigh injury.Arsenal loanee Dinos Mavropanos may start at the back, alongside Waldemar Anton.Hamadi Al Ghaddioui is nearing a return from a pelvic injury, while Momo Cisse could return to the squad after adductor issues.Hoffenheim's team news states that Kevin Vogt could play alongside Chris Richards, the loan signing from Bayern Munich.Benjamin Hubner, Konstantinos Stafylidis and Ermin Bicakcic are all long-term absentees, while Dennis Geiger is ruled out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury.Ryan Sessegnon could return to the starting line up, while Kevin Akpoguma has returned to training as well.Prolific striker Andrej Kramaric is expected to be fit, but Ishak Belfodil has adductor pain.Munas Dabbur and Sargis Adamyan both had COVID-19, but are now available. Stefan Posch was the latest to test positive but is also expected to return this weekend.

A South West derby where Hoffenheim, unusually, have a full week to prepare, now spared the poison chalice of Europa League Thursdays after their exit.Hoffenheim approach the derby on a four game unbeaten, their best run of form under coach Sebastian Hoeness.Two attacking sides meet so we should see a few goals. Stuttgart are not to be feared at home with just two wins in 11 games, as opposed to six on their travels.In-form striker Sasa Kalajdzic has scored in six games in a row and a draw could be the answer here.

Bayern's team news states that With 32 goals, Robert Lewandowski keeps on racking up the Bundesliga scoring records and is well on course to break the legendary Gerd Müller's tally of 40 goals. After scoring last weekend against Bremen, Leipzig remains the only Bundesliga side that "Lewy" has not scored against this season.Back-up keeper Alexander Nübel is over an ankle injury and played in the Champions League in midweek but will drop to the bench, with the great Manuel Neuer returning in goal.Tanguy Nianzou is ruled out with a muscle injury, but David Alaba is fit again after a minor muscle problem.Thomas Müller is back from COVID-19, while Serge Gnabry is also fit from a muscle injury and may replace Kingsley Coman who has a minor muscle problem.Benjamin Pavard will return to the squad after his encounter with COVID-19. Leon Goretzka and Javi Martinez had COVID-19 too, but have both successfully returned to the fray. Douglas Costa has a foot injury and is ruled, as is Corentin Tolisso with a muscle injury.Stuttgart's team news states that Nicolás González is nearing a return from a muscle injury, while Erik Thommy is fit after a hip problem.Darko Churlinov is over nasal injury, while Daniel Didavi is fit again after a muscle injury. The influential Gonzalo Castro has shaken off a thigh injury.Arsenal loanee Dinos Mavropanos may start at the back, alongside Waldemar Anton.Hamadi Al Ghaddioui has succumbed to another injury, while Momo Cisse is back in the squad after adductor issues.

A Southern derby where the visitors, unbeaten in five, have a full week to prepare, whereas Bayern were involved in the routine Champions League return against Lazio.Two attacking sides meet so we should see a few goals. In-form striker Sasa Kalajdzic has scored in seven games in a row in an interesting side story with the prolific Robert Lewandowski. Bayern's sixth comeback win of the season against Dortmund two games ago matched a club record. Four points clear, Bayern have scored in 56 games in a row, last failing to do so in February 2020 against RB Leipzig. 74 goals after 25 Bundesliga games is a new club record as well.Stuttgart have six wins on their travels - only the champions have racked up more, but all things considered, anything other than a comfortable Bayern win would be a huge surprise.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Tuta and Amin Younes are both suspended after picking up five yellow cards.Martin Hinteregger and 2014 Germany World Cup winner Erik Durm are doubtful with muscle injuries.Luka Jovic could start up front with Andre Silva, but Almamy Touré tore a muscle and is ruled out.Ragnar Ache returned recently from a long-term thigh injury.Union Berlin's team news states that Striker Taiwo Awoniyi is ruled out with a thigh injury, while Niko Gießelmann is out with a shoulder injury.Loris Karius has lost his spot in goal to Andreas Luthe, who was missing recently due to personal reasons. The Liverpool loanee performed well though after stepping in for his first Bundesliga game in well over four years.Sheraldo Becker has gone under the knife for an ankle injury, but Leon Dajaku could make the squad after his arrival from Bayern Munich.Former German international Max Kruse has made his comeback from a thigh injury which kept him out since before Christmas. Christopher Lenz has a muscle injury, but Christian Gentner is fit again after a calf injury, while Finnish striker Joel Pohjanpalo is also back from an ankle injury.Striker Anthony Ujah has had yet another operation after over six months out with a long-term knee issue.

A meeting of the draw specialists, with both sides racking up 11 a piece, the most in the league.Frankfurt are unbeaten at home but too many draws have prevented a genuine title challenge. The hosts though have scored in 24 of their 25 league games this season.Frankfurt came back to draw in Leipzig, "earning" 16 points this season from losing positions, showing great spirit.Frankfurt should edge this one, but a draw would not be complete surprise.

FC Koln's team news states that Koln cancelled training on Wednesday due to a positive COVID-19 test among the support staff.Jonas Hector is over a muscle injury, while Marius Wolf is making progress with his ankle injury.Rafael Czichos is available after suspension, while Sebastiaan Bornauw is ruled out with a back injury. Sava-Arangel Cestic seems the likeliest to step in at the back, as Jannes Horn is suspended after picking up five yellow cards.Ismail Jakobs is fit after an ankle injury, while Ondrej Duda is over a rib problem.Emmanuel Dennis has joined on loan from Club Bruges. The Nigerian talent has already enjoyed more success than compatriot Tolu Arokodare who has failed to make any sort of impact up front.Max Meyer has been on the scrapheap at Crystal Palace for months but has been offered a deal here until the end of the season and could play in midfield.Sebastian Andersson is nearing a return after a knee problem, while Florian Kainz is closing in on a return from a knee injury.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Jadon Sancho is struggling with a muscle injury.Raphael Guerreiro and Giovanni Reyna could return to the squad after injury, but Mateu Morey is ruled out with muscle pain.Marco Reus has gone more than 1000 minutes without scoring in the Bundesliga.Goalkeeper Roman Bürki is fit after a shoulder injury, but Marwin Hitz is the new number one in goal.Manuel Akanji is nearing a return after a muscle tear, while Axel Witsel has torn his Achilles and will not play again this season.

Following nine defeats, supposed title challengers Borussia Dortmund are a distant 16 points behind Bayern. That said, Borussia Dortmund have scored in 33 games in a row in all comps and will be buoyed by their progress to the Champions League quarter-finals.Koln beat Dortmund in the reverse fixture, but have won only once at home all season in 12 attempts, with only sorry Schalke having a worse home record.BVB need to win to keep their Champions League qualification hopes in tact. In-form Erling Haaland is the key man once again to avenge a particularly woeful defeat to earlier in the season.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Striker Niclas Füllkrug is battling an ankle injury, but US talent Joshua Sargent will probably start up front anyway.Former Bayern defender Marco Friedl is available after suspension and will step in at the back.Young talent Nick Woltemade has given Bremen a boost by extending his contract.Patrick Erras could return to the squad after recovering from a hip injury.Wolfsburg's team news states that Maxence Lacroix and Xaver Schlager are both available after suspension, but Paulo Otavio remains on the naughty step for three more games..Renato Steffen is ruled out "long term" with an ankle injury, while Jerome Roussillon and Kevin Mbabu are both battling minor injuries. John Anthony Brooks and Marin Pongracic violated COVID-19 protocols recently by attending a party. The defensive duo have been fined by Wolfsburg.

Werder Bremen as expected lost to Bayern last weekend, but looked a decent side in patches.Wolfsburg have proved very hard to beat this season and last weekend celebrated their biggest ever win under coach Oliver Glasner - 5-0 at home to Schalke.Wolfsburg have a host of regulars back from suspension and are favourites to take the spoils in a hard-fought Northern Derby.Both sides have racked up nine draws, struggling at times to turn one point into three, and double figures could beckon after this one.

Schalke's team news states that Christian Gross became the fourth Schalke coach to lose his job in this horror season. Dimitrios Grammozis is the new man in charge but has not been able to stop the rot.Omar Mascarell is available after suspension, while 18-year-old Kerim Calhanoglu, cousin of AC Milan ace Hakan, made his debut recently.Benjamin Stambouli made his 100th Bundesliga appearance recently but is still to score his first league goal.Influential Mark Uth has a thigh injury and is struggling to be fit in time, as is Nassim Boujellab with ankle ligament damage.Schalke are already planning for the second tier by signing Mainz captain Danny Latza on a free at the end of the season.Goalkeeper Frederik Rönnow has recovered from a muscle injury and will play in goal as Ralf Fährmann suffered a stomach muscle injury.After a squabble, Vedad Ibisevic's contract has been paid up. Amine Harit was, however, given a reprieve and Nabil Bentaleb has also been given another chance as Schalke desperately fight relegation. The ex-Spurs man has had a groin op and is ruled out, as is Hamza Mendyl who picked up an ankle injury in training.Veteran striker Klaas Jan Huntelaar is back from Ajax, but the former Real Madrid striker just cannot shake off a calf problem to help in the relegation battle.Salif Sane has a knee problem and Steven Skrzybski has a torn muscle.Kilian Ludewig had a foot operation and Gonçalo Paciencia, a knee op, both are still on the mend.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Head coach Marco Rose will leave for Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season, explaining to some extent a savage downturn in results.Skipper Lars Stindl is available after suspension.Swiss forward Breel Embolo had to pay a heavy fine for contravening COVID-19 regulations. Striker partner Alassane Plea is also fit again after minor injury problems.Valentino Lazaro is fit after a muscle problem, while key midfielder Denis Zakaria should return after a knee injury.Stefan Lainer is fit after a thigh injury, while Ramy Bensebaini is also expected to be fit. Germany 2014 World Cup winner Christoph Kramer is struggling with a muscle tear but should make the squad.

A meeting of two struggling sides. Since matchday 18, Schalke have only scored twice, while Gladbach have lost six straight games, nose-diving since news broke that highly-coveted coach Marco Rose will not be at the helm next term. Schalke look doomed to relegation, on a nightmare run of only one win in 41 games, including last season post-COVID.Draws are no good for bottom club Schalke in their current predicament, and this is another must win game for the Royal Blues. Schalke have scrambled just three draws in their last ten games, and sit a forlorn 12 points from safety.Gladbach have relinquished a league-high 21 points from winning positions already this season, with too many draws (10) until the "Rose Rot" completely set in. That said, Gladbach need to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot and can return to winning ways against beleaguered Schalke.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Kevin Vogt could play alongside Chris Richards, the loan signing from Bayern Munich.Christoph Baumgartner has a thigh injury, while Benjamin Hubner, Konstantinos Stafylidis and Ermin Bicakcic are all long-term absentees, and Dennis Geiger is ruled out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury.Ryan Sessegnon could return to the starting line up, while Kevin Akpoguma has returned to training as well.Prolific striker Andrej Kramaric is expected to be fit, but Ishak Belfodil has adductor pain.Munas Dabbur and Sargis Adamyan both had COVID-19, but are now available. Stefan Posch was the latest to test positive but is also expected to return this weekend.Mainz's team news states that Karim Onisiwo is struggling with a thigh problem, as is Mainz captain Danny Latza, who will join relegation-haunted Schalke on a free at the end of the season, probably to play in the second-tier.Danny da Costa has impressed since joining from Eintracht Frankfurt, alongside Dominik Kohr who made the same move across the Main.Robert Glatzel has done well since joining from Cardiff on loan in January, while Robin Quaison scored a vital winner on his return from a knee injury. Leandro Barreiro Martins has recovered from an ear injury.Stefan Bell has been a rock since making his first Bundesliga appearance in 658 days at the heart of the Mainz defence.Edimilson Fernandes is over a second bout of COVID-19, and could return from an ankle knock. Philipp Mwene returned from an ankle injury, while Pierre Kunde Malong is over his encounter with COVID-19.Former Real Madrid striker Adam Szalai has recovered from a knee op and is pushing for a starting spot.

Hoffenheim, unusually, have a full week to prepare for this South-West derby, now spared the poison chalice of Europa League Thursdays after their recent exit.Mainz have beaten RB Leipzig and Gladbach lately and have shown definite signs of improvement under new coach Bo Svensson, but have squandered 15 points from leading positions explaining why they still sit one off the bottom.A draw could be the answer here.

Freiburg's team news states that Chang-Hoon Kwon is close to a return from a knee injury, while Lino Tempelmann is also back in training.Baptiste Santamaria, a club record signing from SCO Angers in France, may return to the starting line up after being benched last weekend.Keven Schlotterbeck is fit after a muscle injury, while Roland Sallai is over an ankle injury.  Jonathan Schmid should return after a thigh injury, while Yannik Keitel is over a knee problem.New first-choice keeper Mark Flekken immediately got injured, so Florian Müller, a loan signing from Mainz, has grasped his chance in goal.Augsburg's team news states that Daniel Caligiuri will be especially motivated against his former club.Mads Pedersen has problems with his adductors, but Ruben Vargas is fit after an ankle injury, while Laszlo Benes might lose his spot in midfield.Alfred Finnbogason has a calf problem which will rule him out, while Iago is a big loss too.André Hahn is over his encounter with COVID-19, but Raphael Framberger has made a return from a muscle injury.Noah Joel Sarenren Bazee is fit after a knee injury, while Jan Morávek is close to a return from a muscle injury.

A meeting of two Burgs, two of the less fashionable Bundesliga clubs but both are not to be underestimated on their day.Freiburg have failed to score in five of their last seven, while Augsburg are not out of the relegation mire just yet under Heiko Herrlich and have kept only one clean sheet in 11 games. Freiburg beat in-form Borussia Dortmund at home recently and wily coach Christian Streich would not be out of place in charge at a top four club.Freiburg need to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot and can nick the win.

Andrej Kramaric returned from international duty with a knock to his ankle, while Sargis Adamyan suffered a thigh injury while playing for Armenia.It's unclear whether Munas Dabbur will be available after poor flight connections back from international duty with Israel. Dennis Geiger is also ruled out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury.Ryan Sessegnon could return to the starting line up, while Kevin Akpoguma and Mijat Gacinovic are also now fit.

Augsburg are not quite out of the relegation mire just yet under Heiko Herrlich and have kept only one clean sheet in 12 games. Hoffenheim, now spared the poison chalice of Europa League Thursdays after their recent exit have shown better form domestically of late.Hoffenheim have won their last five aways in Augsburg and needing to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot, can nick the points here.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Jadon Sancho is struggling with a muscle injury, but Raphael Guerreiro, Giovanni Reyna and Mateu Morey are all expected to return to the squad.Marco Reus has gone more than 1000 minutes without scoring in the Bundesliga.Goalkeeper Roman Bürki is fit after a shoulder injury, but Marwin Hitz is the new number one in goal.Manuel Akanji is over a muscle tear, but Axel Witsel has torn his Achilles and will not play again this season, along with Dan-Axel Zagadou who has had a knee operation.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Tuta and Amin Younes are both available after suspension, but Japanese stalwart Makoto Hasebe is on the naughty step after picking up five yellow cards.Martin Hinteregger and 2014 Germany World Cup winner Erik Durm are doubtful with muscle injuries. Durm returned to training in midweek, and could line up against his former club.Luka Jovic could start up front with Andre Silva who is set up for his 50th Bundesliga appearance (33 goals.).Almamy Touré tore a muscle and is ruled out, while Ragnar Ache is out for the rest of the season with a ligament injury.

Following nine defeats, supposed title challengers Borussia Dortmund are a distant 18 points behind Bayern. That said, Borussia Dortmund have scored in 34 games in a row in all comps and, offensively, are looking in reasonable shape for their Champions League quarter-final 1st leg against Manchester City. Dortmund are bound to have one eye on that clash with the Citizens, but need to win here to keep their Champions League qualification hopes in tact.Frankfurt lie four points ahead of Dortmund and have already garnered two more points than during the whole of last season, only too many draws (11) have prevented a genuine title challenge.  Frankfurt have earned 16 points this season from losing positions, showing great spirit, but have lost their last nine games in Dortmund.BVB can edge this one, with key man Erling Haaland to the fore.

The Finland goalkeeper should return here.Moussa Diaby was the latest star to succumb to COVID-19 before the international break, but could make the bench after a reported quarantine release of Friday. A meeting of two struggling sides, both on the crest of a slump.Since matchday 18, Schalke have only scored twice, while Bayer Leverkusen have taken only 12 points from 14 games, a woeful run since topping the table briefly before Christmas playing some delightful football. This untimely slump meant that coach Peter Bosz inevitably paid the ultimate price with the sack. Hannes Wolf takes over until the end of the season.Schalke look doomed to relegation, on a nightmare run of only one win in 42 games, including last season post-COVID.Draws are no good for bottom club Schalke in their current predicament, and this is another must win game for the Royal Blues. Schalke have scrambled just three draws in their last 11 games, and sit a forlorn 14 points from safety.Meanwhile, Leverkusen need to win to stay in the hunt for a Champions League qualification spot, and can claim the points here in a positive start for young Wolf.

Wolfsburg have proved very hard to beat this season and sit nicely in third spot.Koln are better away from home, having beaten some decent sides on their travels including Borussia Dortmund, but have slipped into relegation danger thanks to their woeful home form.Wolfsburg have regulars back from suspension and can seal the three points on home soil with a goal from Wout Weghorst helping the Wolves cause.

A meeting of two struggling sides although Gladbach did manage to beat relegation-haunted Schalke to snap a run of six straight defeats, completely nose-diving since news broke that highly-coveted coach Marco Rose will not be at the helm next term. Gladbach have relinquished a league-high 21 points from winning positions already this season, with too many draws (10) not helping their cause either. In the previous 25 meetings of the two clubs, there has not been an away win -- Gladbach's win in Freiburg in 2002 being the last. Freiburg beat in-form Borussia Dortmund recently and wily coach Christian Streich would not be out of place in charge at a top four club.That said, Gladbach need to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot and can nick the points.

Both these sides lost to Bayern recently, but looked decent sides in patches.Silas Wamangituka's serious knee injury against Bayern is a real blow to Stuttgart, not helped by Nicolás González's new injury either.Both sides have racked up nine draws, struggling to turn one point into three, and double figures could beckon after this one.

The Berlin derby. East (Union) vs West (Hertha).Union are the draw specialists with a joint league high of 11 but remain unbeaten at home in 12 games, while Hertha have not won on their travels in nine games.Despite taking six points from nine, Hertha have mustered a paltry 24 points from 26 games this season, which is terrible considering no Bundesliga club spent more on transfers in 2020 than the capital city club. Neither of these two sides can be backed with any confidence so a draw could be a good shout, with honours even in the derby.

A relegation six pointer with just six points separating the two sides.Augsburg are not quite out of the relegation mire just yet under Heiko Herrlich but will have added belief having won all five previous competitive meetings with Bielefeld.Lowly Arminia Bielefeld shocked Bayer Leverkusen recently and took a deserved point off Bayern in their own backyard as well, but sit in the relegation play-off place on goal difference.Neither of these two can be backed with any confidence, a low-scoring draw could be the outcome here.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Yann Sommer is suspended for two games after his red card against Hertha Berlin last weekend. Tobias Sippel will likely play in goal.2014 Germany World Cup winner Christoph Kramer is also suspended after picking up five yellow cards, while the influential Lars Stindl is doubtful with a muscle injury.Valentino Lazaro is fit after a muscle problem, while German international Jonas Hofmann is likely to be available after his encounter with COVID-19.Ramy Bensebaini is available after suspension, key midfielder Denis Zakaria is fit after a knee injury, while Stefan Lainer is over a thigh injury.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Austrian defender Martin Hinteregger is nearing a return while 2014 Germany World Cup winner Erik Durm is fit after a muscle injury.Japanese stalwart Makoto Hasebe may have to settle for a spot on the bench, while Luka Jovic could start up front with Andre Silva in a prolific partnership.Almamy Touré tore a muscle and is ruled out, while Ragnar Ache is also out for the rest of the season with a ligament injury.

A meeting of two draw specialists, Gladbach have 10 and Frankfurt 11, given extra spice as news has broken that Frankfurt coach Adi Hütter will take over at Gladbach next season.With Hütter in charge, Eintracht have only lost three games this term, seriously punching above their weight in fourth, already garnering eight more points than during the whole of last season.Gladbach have recovered to take seven points in nine since snapping a run of six straight defeats, nose-diving since it was revealed that their own highly-coveted coach Marco Rose will take charge of Borussia Dortmund next season.Gladbach are a strange side, relinquishing a league-high 21 points from winning positions, but have earned 17 points from losing positions this season, leading to a stack of draws (10) as a consequence.Gladbach need to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot, and with Hütter's departure a done deal, Frankfurt may be set for a downturn in results till the end of the season.

Union Berlin's team news states that Captain Christopher Trimmel broke his nose and will be assessed nearer the game.Striker Taiwo Awoniyi is ruled out with a thigh injury, while Niko Gießelmann is over a shoulder injury.Christian Gentner will be keen to impress against his former club.Sheraldo Becker has gone under the knife for an ankle injury, while Leon Dajaku is struggling with a foot injury.Loris Karius has lost his spot in goal to Andreas Luthe, who was missing last month due to personal reasons. Arsenal loanee Dinos Mavropanos may start at the back, alongside Waldemar Anton.Hamadi Al Ghaddioui has succumbed to another injury, while Momo Cisse is back in the squad after adductor issues.

Union are the draw specialists and will be chuffed to bits with number 13 in the Bavarian capital last weekend.Stuttgart have shown better form on their travels than at home with six away wins, but injuries to the ultra-talented Silas Wamangituka and Nicolás González are serious blows. Stuttgart celebrated their 750th Bundesliga win recently, but may have to settle for a share of the spoils against the side that sent them tumbling into the second-tier two seasons ago.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Paulo Otavio is available after suspension but influential midfielder Maximilian Arnold replaces him on the naughty step after totting up five yellow cards. Josuha Guilavogui is struggling to shake off adductor issues. Admir Mehmedi has a calf injury, while Renato Steffen is ruled out "long term" with an ankle injury.
