Lewandowski is currently stranded on 35 league goals for the season, just five shy of Gerd Muller's Bundesliga record of 40 in a single campaign.Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting may play up front as Serge Gnabry is the latest to test positive for COVID-19. Gnabry is expected to leave quarantine early next week.Manuel Neuer kept his 200th Bundesliga clean sheet recently, the first goalkeeper to ever reach this milestone, ahead of Oliver Kahn's 196.Tanguy Nianzou is back in training after muscle injury, Douglas Costa has a foot injury and is ruled out as is Corentin Tolisso with a muscle injury.

Five points clear with six games remaining, Bayern's ninth title in succession still appears a mere formality, but this is a tough game for the injury-hit champions.Wolfsburg are unbeaten at home this season and 13 clean sheets from solid goalkeeper Koen Casteels are a joint league best for the Wolves. Casteels has not conceded a goal in his last five home games either - a new club record, while in 79 competitive games under coach Hansi Flick, Bayern have only failed to score once - in February 2020 against RB Leipzig. Only 11 draws for Wolfsburg have prevented a genuine title challenge and another one here would not be a complete surprise.

Lars had a knee operation, but Sven could come into the side after overcoming an ankle injury. Leverkusen have not tasted defeat in any of the 13 Bundesliga games Sven has featured in this season.Leverkusen desperately missed Lukás Hrádecky in goal, with Niklas Lomb and Lennart Grill struggling to fill in. Kingsley Ehizibue suffered concussion and may not be cleared to play.Jonas Hector is over a muscle injury, while Marius Wolf is making progress with his ankle injury.Sebastiaan Bornauw is close to a return from a back injury, while Jannes Horn is likely to replace Ismail Jakobs who has an ankle injury. Emmanuel Dennis has joined on loan from Club Bruges. The Nigerian talent has already enjoyed more success than compatriot Tolu Arokodare who has failed to make any sort of impact up front.

Two new coaches are in situ for this local derby with 67-year-old veteran Friedhelm Funkel pitting his wits against Hannes Wolf, aged 40.Leverkusen are now spared the poison chalice of Europa League Thursdays after their recent exit and have all week to concentrate on the local derby.Koln have not kept a clean sheet in 12 games - the longest such run in the whole league, and have also failed to score 10 times this season. Not a good mix all in all and certainly explains why the Billy Goats have slipped into the bottom two.Leverkusen need to win to stay in the hunt for a Champions League qualification spot and can claim the points here to continue a positive start for young Wolf.

Relegation-threatened Hertha Berlin face the first of six games in 20 days and a fixture backlog after a COVID-19 enforced break from the action.Mainz are a form team on a seven-game unbeaten run, managing for the first time in five years three Bundesliga wins in a row. Hertha have mustered a paltry 26 points from 28 games this season, which is awful considering their massive outlay on transfers in 2020.Mainz have upward momentum, but have squandered 17 points from leading positions explaining why they were struggling towards the foot of the table in the first place.Teams often struggle to back up a big performance against Bayern, so a shock Hertha win would not be totally out of the question.

Relegation-threatened Hertha Berlin face a fixture backlog after a COVID-19 enforced break from the action, and this is their second game in 20 days, which will decide their Bundesliga status.Hertha picked up a valuable point at in-form Mainz on Monday, but a return of 27 points from 29 games this season is awful considering the capital city club's massive outlay on transfers in 2020.Freiburg have very little to play for and could be there for the taking for Hertha, who could move up three places with the win and out of the relegation spots.

Nicolás González has suffered a muscle injury, while Erik Thommy is fit after a hip problem.Silas Wamangituka suffered a knee injury against Bayern and is ruled out for the rest of the season.Orel Mangala is nearing a return from a thigh injury and Darko Churlinov is over nasal injury, while Daniel Didavi is fit again after a muscle injury. Just 160km separates these two clubs on the A8 motorway in Southern Germany.Augsburg probably need another win to secure status and pressed the panic button, sacking Heiko Herrlich. Markus Weinzierl is the new and old coach of FCA.Stuttgart have lost their last four games after injuries to the ultra-talented Silas Wamangituka and Nicolás González have taken their toll. Neither of these two sides can be backed with any confidence so a draw could be a good shout, which would be a decent result for FCA in their current predicament.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Chris Richards is touch and go to make this one with his thigh injury, while Munnas Dabbur is back home in Israel on compassionate leave.Sebastian Rudy could play in midfield against his parent club if he shakes off a thigh injury.Ryan Sessegnon could return to the starting line-up, while Sebastian Rudy and the Kevins, Vogt and Akpoguma are all nearing returns as well, along with Marco John who is over a hip injury, Sargis Adamyan is over a thigh injury and Ishak Belfodil has recovered from a back injury to boost options in attack.Christoph Baumgartner is over a thigh injury, but Benjamin Hubner, Konstantinos Stafylidis, Ermin Bicakcic and Håvard Nordtveit are all long-term absentees. Schalke are relegated after a horror season which covered five different trainers and much grumbling in Gelsenkirchen.Hoffenheim somehow came unstuck in the previous meeting 4-0, Schalke first win of the season, one of only two of a miserable campaign. In fact, Schalke have won only two Bundesliga games in their last 46, a sorry decline which started pre-COVID.Hoffenheim have not been pulling up any trees either but should have too much for sorry Schalke.

Both sides are eyeing European qualification after exceeding expectations this season.Union have already surpassed last season's 41 points and are on course for a Europa League spot.Wolves have lost their last two at home, but these defeats came against heavyweights Bayern and Dortmund so there are mitigating circumstances.It's meeting of two draw specialists - Union Berlin have 13 and Wolfsburg nine and that could be the solution here again with honours shared.

Welcome to the original "Klassiker" of German football - beware all those other pale imitations.Gladbach are aiming to the double over Bayern, just like they did back in 2011-12 along with Borussia Dortmund, the last time any Bundesliga side has managed two wins against Bayern in a season.Gladbach have relinquished a league-high 26 points from winning positions this season, but have won four out of their last six, scoring at least twice in those six games and celebrated their highest win in over five years last time out. (5-0 vs. Bielefeld).Gladbach need to win to stay in the hunt for a European qualification spot, while seven points clear with three games remaining, Bayern's ninth title in succession can be sealed with a win this weekend. Coach Hansi Flick has dropped a bombshell, announcing that he wants out at the end of the season. In 82 competitive games under Flick, Bayern have only failed to score once - in February 2020 against RB Leipzig. Life's too short - let's go for a shock Gladbach win against a Bayern side who might already be crowned champions - if Dortmund do them a favour against Leipzig.

Not a good mix and certainly explains why the Billy Goats are haunted by the prospect of relegation in the first place.Neither of these two sides can be backed with too much confidence so a draw could be a good shout.

A derby across the Main river with plenty at stake for both sides.Mainz are one of the form sides of 2021, showing their massive improvement with a win against Bayern in their last game.Unbeaten in 17 at home, Frankfurt's last home loss came against Mainz last season.Pressure is heating up in Frankfurt as coach Adi Hütter takes over at Borussia Monchengladbach next season, leading to genuine fears that the Eagles could squander Champions League qualification. With Hütter in charge, Eintracht have only lost five games this term, seriously punching above their weight in fourth, already garnering 14 more points than during the whole of last season.A draw could be the answer here leaving the door open for BVB to claim fourth spot.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Chris Richards is touch and go to make this one with his thigh injury, while Munnas Dabbur is back home in Israel on compassionate leave.Mijat Gacinovic is suspended after accumulating five yellow cards. Reliable keeper Oliver Baumann will miss the final game of the season with back-up Philipp Pentke filling in between the sticks.Sebastian Rudy is struggling with a thigh injury, as is Kevin Akpoguma.Ryan Sessegnon could return to the starting line-up along with Marco John who is over a hip injury.Sargis Adamyan is over a thigh injury and Ishak Belfodil has recovered from a back injury to boost options in attack.Benjamin Hubner, Konstantinos Stafylidis, Ermin Bicakcic and Håvard Nordtveit are all long-term absentees. Dennis Geiger is also ruled out for the rest of the season with a thigh injury.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Striker Jhon Cordoba has an ankle injury, but Dodi Lukebakio and Vladimir Darida are both available after suspension, but defender Jordan Torunarigha is on the naughty step after picking up his fifth yellow card.Arsenal loanee Matteo Guendouzi broke his foot, while Maximilian Mittelstädt should return after concussion.Sami Khedira is struggling with a calf problem and has announced his retirement at the end of the season. Matheus Cunha has an ankle injury.Skipper Dedryck Boyata had not featured at all this year, but made his starting comeback earlier this month and has bolstered a brittle backline.Rune Jarstein has tested positive for COVID-19. Alexander Schwolow will play in goal.Luca Netz is ruled out after a fracturing his foot.

Hoffenheim are unbeaten in six, showing good spirit, twice in their last four games coming back from two goals down to win well. This is relegation-threatened Hertha's sixth game in less than three weeks following a COVID-19 enforced break, but the capital city side are unbeaten in eight games, saving themselves from relegation.The heavy workload, injuries and suspensions could catch up with Hertha here allowing a home win.

Union Berlin's team news states that Grisha Prömel has a muscle injury, while Cedric Teuchert suffered a bad knee injury.Robert Andrich is suspended after racking up five yellow cards. Marcus Ingvartsen remains a doubt with ankle pain.Captain Christopher Trimmel broke his nose and will be assessed nearer the game.Striker Taiwo Awoniyi is nearing a return from a thigh injury, while Niko Gießelmann is over a shoulder injury. Leon Dajaku has tested positive for COVID-19 and also has a foot injury. Sheraldo Becker has gone under the knife for an ankle injury.Christopher Lenz is nearing a return from a muscle injury, but striker Anthony Ujah has had yet another operation because of a long-term knee issue.RBL's team news states that Goalkeeper Péter Gulácsi gets a break, Josep Martinez is set for a Bundesliga debut.Tyler Adams has back pain. Angeliño was left out of the cup final and may return to the squad.Captain Marcel Sabitzer should be available along with striker Yussuf Poulsen.Hwang Hee-Chan is over an ankle injury as is Justin Kluivert, but Lazar Samardzic has a knee injury.January signing Dominik Szoboszlai has adductor problems and has still not played his first game for the club.Konrad Laimer is also on the verge of a return from a knee injury.

Union have already surpassed last season's 41 points and are on course for a Europa Conference spot at the very minimum.Julian Nagelsmann ends his Leipzig spell and the alleged "Wundertrainer" has still never won any silverware in professional football, just like current club RB Leipzig. Never mind Julian a few bits of silverware are surely reserved at next club Bayern Munich.Union Berlin have a league high 13 draws with eight at home and that could be a good option here.

Werder Bremen's team news states that Teenager Eren Dinkci is suspended following his red card against Leverkusen, while Christian Gross was sent off last week against Augsburg.Swede Ludwig Augustinsson is suffering with groin pain and will be assessed nearer the game.Striker Niclas Füllkrug is nearing a return from a broken toe.Ömer Toprak, Marco Friedl and Jean-Manuel Mbom remain doubts, but Milos Veljkovic is over a thigh injury, while Maximilian Eggestein is available after suspension.Young talent Nick Woltemade has ligament damage, but Patrick Erras could return to the squad after recovering from a hip injury.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that The influential Lars Stindl is nearing a return from a muscle injury.Mamadou Doucoure has suffered an Achilles injury.Valentino Lazaro is fit after a muscle problem, while German international Jonas Hofmann is available after his encounter with COVID-19.Key midfielder Denis Zakaria is fit after a knee injury, while Stefan Lainer is over a thigh injury.

Werder Bremen are enduring their second worst season in their long Bundesliga history, and have lost eight of their nine Bundesliga games.Bremen are desperate for a win to probably secure their Bundesliga status for another season and pressed the panic button by sacking coach Florian Kohfeldt with a game to go.Thomas Schaaf, Werder's wily coach from 1999 to 2013 takes over for this vital game.A Werder defeat and a Koln win on the final day would mean automatic relegation.Gladbach have relinquished a league-high 29 points from winning positions this season and are battling only for the potential joys of a Europa Conference League spot, not the greatest of leaving presents from coach Marco Rose before he departs for BVB.Neither of these two sides can be backed with any confidence, but Gladbach may just raise their game for Rose's last game in charge.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Koen Casteels has 14 clean sheets this season but is ruled out for the last game as he needs an op.Kevin Mbabu and Paulo Otavio are both available after suspension.Bartosz Bialek has suffered an ACL injury and is out until the Autumn at the earliest.Key defender Maxence Lacroix is over a muscle injury, while Josuha Guilavogui cannot shake off adductor issues. Admir Mehmedi has a minor calf niggle, while Renato Steffen is ruled out "long-term" with an ankle injury.Mainz's team news states that Jonathan Burkardt has a thigh problem and Robin Zentner a stomach muscle injury and both are doubtful.Luca Kilian is nearing a return from a thigh injury, while defensive stalwart Stefan Bell is available after suspension. Karim Onisiwo is over a thigh problem, as is Mainz captain Danny Latza, who will join relegated Schalke on a free at the end of the season to play in the second-tier.Danny da Costa has impressed since joining on loan from Eintracht Frankfurt, alongside Dominik Kohr who made the same move across the Main.Edimilson Fernandes is over a second bout of COVID-19, and could return from an ankle knock. Philipp Mwene has returned from an ankle injury, while Pierre Kunde Malong is over his encounter with COVID-19.

Wolfsburg have secured Champions League football after Eintracht Frankfurt's recent implosion. Mainz are one of the form sides of 2021, enjoying their best ever second half of the season with 30 points, as evidenced by a recent win over the champions Bayern.But now safe from relegation, not showing any urgency in their play, Mainz slipped back to their old ways last week against Borussia Dortmund.Wolfsburg have racked up 10 draws and Mainz nine and that could be the solution here again with honours shared.

Greuther Fuerth's team news states that Talented Gideon Jung needs a knee operation and will be out for months. New signing Jessic Ngankam has picked up an ACL injury. Gian-Luca Itter is nearing a return from a thigh injury.Julian Green will be keen to impress against his former club. Free transfer signing Jetro Willems may start at left-back back here.Bayern's team news states that Kingsley Coman is out until next month after minor heart surgery but Serge Gnabry and Jamal Musiala were both able to train on Thursday and barring a reaction should make the squad.Marcel Sabitzer, who made the switch from Leipzig late in the summer, may play in a wide role.Lucas Hernandez is a safe bet for Bayern - 30 times the French World Cup winner has started in the Bundesliga since the summer of 2019 without losing a game.Corentin Tolisso remains doubtful with a calf injury. Back-up goalkeeper Sven Ulreich suffered a knee injury in training and is ruled out.

Can anybody stop Robert Lewandowski scoring? The prolific striker is looking to better his record 41 Bundesliga goals from last season. Lewy has notched in 19 consecutive games in all competitions for Bayern, and has already scored seven goals in five Bundesliga games this term. Promoted Fuerth did bolster their squad with a host of promising loan signings, but this season is going to be a long slog after conceding 13 goals in five games.Record champions Bayern have scored in 52 consecutive Bundesliga games and put seven goals past another promoted side Bochum last weekend. Anything other than a comfortable Bayern win would be a huge surprise.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Christopher Lenz has a muscle injury and Erik Durm had to break off training in midweek with a knee injury. Both will be assessed nearer the game.Sam Lammers has signed on loan from Atalanta and could start instead of Rafael Borre.Captain Sebastian Rode has had a knee operation. New signings Jens Petter Hauge or Ajdin Hrustic could slot into midfield as a result.Filip Kostic went on strike to try and force a move to Lazio but remains at the club and they are better for him being in the team than in the stands.FC Koln's team news states that Florian Kainz is available after suspension.In-form striker Anthony Modeste has scored four goals in five games, matching the total in his previous 37 Bundesliga games last season.Defender Timo Hübers is nearing a return from an ankle injury, while Jan Thielmann is also likely to be back from illness.Luca Kilian could start after signing on loan from Mainz to boost FC Koln's defensive options.Sava-Arangel Cestic and Kingsley Schindler are nearing returns, while Jannes Horn continues to recover from a hip injury.Dejan Ljubicic has joined from Rapid Vienna, while keeper Marvin Schwäbe, a free transfer signing from Danish side Brondby, has recovered from a hand injury.

Frankfurt have drawn four out of five in the Bundesliga, but a share of the spoils at deposed leaders Wolfsburg shows promise.Koln stayed up by the skin of their teeth last season, winning a play-off against Holstein Kiel, but have looked revitalised under effervescent new coach Steffen Baumgart.Frankfurt need a win to kick start their season and the home side can just nick this.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Ermin Bicakcic is still on his way back from ACL trouble, while Benjamin Hübner is on the mend from long-standing ankle problems. Håvard Nordtveit has a thigh problem. Sebastian Rudy and Munas Dabbur are both expected to return to the squad, while Andrej Kramaric has not scored for 451 minutes for Hoffenheim.US international Chris Richards has arrived for another loan spell from champions Bayern to bolster their defence.Diadie Samassekou and Pavel Kaderabek are both nearing a return, while Ihlas Bebou and Kevin Akpoguma could also feature in the squad after their experience with COVID-19.Wolfsburg's team news states that Kevin Mbabu is over a knee problem, while Paulo Otávio is out with an ankle injury.Gian-Luca Waldschmidt has a minor hip injury which has prevented him from training.William, Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager all have ACL injuries.

Wolfsburg dropped Bundesliga points for the first time under new coach Mark van Bommel last weekend with a 1-1 home draw against Eintracht Frankfurt.Hoffenheim spent most of last season in the lower reaches of the table, flattering to deceive regularly, and have won only once this term.Second placed Wolfsburg can keep their unbeaten run going but may have to settle for a draw.

Leverkusen's team news states that Robert Andrich is suspended for three games after his red card last weekend.Exequiel Palacios sustained an ankle knock in the Europa League and is still ruled out.Former German international Karim Bellarabi is over a muscle injury, while Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury.Timothy Fosu-Mensah has an ACL injury, while Florian Wirtz is over adductor issues, as is Lucas Alario. Edmond Tapsoba has a ligament tear.Back-up Niklas Lomb has a finger injury, not ideal for a goalkeeper.Mainz's team news states that Moussa Niakhaté is out for several weeks with a thigh injury, while Aarón Martín is nearing a return from a groin injury.Ádám Szalai needs a knee op and will be out for several months.

Fourth placed Leverkusen host fifth placed Mainz with only goal difference separating the two sides.Mainz were great towards the end of last season and have overcome COVID-19 problems well this time around to start with four clean sheets in five games. In fact, Mainz are going for a fourth clean sheet in a row which would match the club record. After Jürgen Klopp and Thomas Tuchel, Bo Svensson seems set to be the next Mainz coach to reach the very top echelons of the game.Leverkusen, often known as Neverkusen, have started the season brightly and won last weekend despite playing with 10 men for over an hour. They have taken 19 of a possible 21 points against Mainz in the future and remain slight favourites here.

RBL's team news states that Marcelo Saracchi is recovering from an ACL injury, while Marcel Halstenberg has an ankle injury. Dani Olmo is now sidelined for a few weeks.Youngster Josko Gvardiol has signed from Dynamo Zagreb and could keep out ex-Manchester City man Angelino.Brian Brobbey will compete with Andre Silva up front, but the latter will win that battle, despite being short of goals after his summer move from Eintracht Frankfurt.Mohamed Simakan has signed from Strasbourg in France and has been impressive in defence so far.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Lukas Klünter needs an operation and will be out for several weeks. Krzysztof Piatek is nearing a return from an ankle injury, while Marvin Plattenhardt has returned to training.Dedryck Boyata is out with a thigh injury and new signing Myziane Maolida from Nice also remains a doubt.Jurgen Ekkelenkamp scored on his home debut 87 seconds after coming on as a substitute against Fuerth and could start here. Stevan Jovetic is nearing a return from a calf injury but is likely to be out for at least another week. Denmark U21 goalkeeper Oliver Christensen has been signed from Odense BK to provide competition between the sticks. Another keeper, Rune Jarstein, will be eased back after a heart issue.

Hertha have picked up back-to-back wins after starting the season with three straight defeats.RB Leipzig lost captain Marcel Sabitzer to rivals Bayern Munich late in the summer and have started poorly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats in five games.That said, Leipzig have picked up more points against Hertha Berlin in their short Bundesliga career (25) than any other opponent, with eight wins from 10 match-ups.

Union Berlin's team news states that New signing Bastian Oczipka strengthens Union Berlin's defensive options after signing on a free. Midfielder Kevin Möhwald is also expected to return from injury here.After Robert Andrich's departure, Genki Haraguchi will likely step into midfield.Marvin Friedrich is available after suspension. Paul Jaeckel, signed from Greuther Fürth on a free, will likely make way. Grischa Prömel is nearing a return from a slight groin injury.Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Sebastian Vasiliadis from Paderborn will bolster the club's midfield options once he has recovered from injury, along with fellow new signing Edimilson Fernandes. Lennart Czyborra has joined from Serie A club CFC Genua, while Austrian international Alessandro Schöpf is available after suspension.

A meeting of the draw specialists.Arminia have drawn four out of five this season, while Union Berlin have drawn three out of four. Union also racked up the most draws (14) last season in the whole league.Why not go for a draw again here?

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Stefan Lainer remains on the sidelines, but Marcus Thuram could return.Mamadou Doucouré has an Achilles injury, but Matthias Ginter is back after his bout of COVID-19.Manu Koné is over his knee injury, while Denis Zakaria and Breel Embolo are both fit again.Coach Adi Hütter said Jonas Hofmann is "100 Percent fit" after his thigh injury and could face his former club. However, Ramy Bensebaini's comeback is on hold after suffering a knock in training.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Dan-Axel Zagadou is nearing a return after a knee operation. Axel Witsel has been helping out in defence, but Mats Hummels should return after injury. Gio Reyna suffered a muscle injury on international duty, while Emre Can has a thigh injury and is out for several weeks.Thorgan Hazard is fit after an ankle injury, Mateu Morey has a knee injury, while Nico Schulz is close to a return from a muscle injury.Julian Brandt sustained a muscle injury in midweek and will be out for a couple of weeks.

The match of the day in the Bundesliga as Dortmund coach Marco Rose returns to Gladbach.Hopes remain high that the Black and Yellows can mount a title challenge for the first time in 10 years and after his brace last weekend, star man Erling "Machine" Haaland can boast 47 goals in 48 Bundesliga games.  Gladbach earned a decent point against Bayern and after suffering some key injuries, have only managed three below par defeats and just a solitary win.The "Foals" can raise their game against their former boss and share the spoils at least.

Bochum's team news states that Maxim Leitsch is nearing a return from a muscle injury, but Erhan Masovic could step into defence.Striker Sebastian Polter has signed on a free from Fortuna Sittard and could start up front.Saulo Decarli is almost over a thigh injury, while Herbert Bockhorn is fit after his bout of COVID-19. Danny Blum is over his knee injury, while youngster Paul Grave has a shoulder problem. Defender Cristan Gamboa has had an operation on his shoulder and will be out for several weeks.Key man Simon Zoller suffered an ACL injury in training and will not play again this year.Stuttgart's team news states that Waldemar Anton will return to defence after suspension.Mohamed Sankoh faces six months out with a serious knee injury, but new signing Chris Furich is close to a return from a foot fracture and could make his first appearance.Omar Marmoush scored on debut after arriving on loan from leaders Wolfsburg, while Wahid Faghir, another young attacker, has signed from Vejle BK in Denmark and could make the squad.Silas Wamangituka Fundu is still out with a knee injury, but has at least served his suspension for playing under a false identity.Nikolas Nartey and Tanguy Coulibaly are both fit after COVID-19. Top scorer Sasa Kalajdzic returned from COVID-19, but immediately succumbed to a shoulder injury which could keep him out of the action until the winter break.Naouirou Ahamada has a calf injury, while Momo Cissé has a foot injury and Lilian Egloff has had a foot op.

This already has the feel of a relegation six-pointer. Stuttgart won their opener 5-1 against bottom side Fuerth, but have only picked up a point and conceded 11 goals in their last four games.  VfB, three-time Bundesliga champions, have a host of injuries, and are badly missing Sasa Kalajdzic and Silas Wamangituka Fundu, who combined for 27 goals last season. Bochum, champions of Bundesliga 2 last season, will look to bounce back from a 7-0 hammering at Bayern last weekend.A draw could be a good shout here.

Freiburg's team news states that Maximilian Eggestein will bolster midfield as record signing Baptiste Santamaria has moved back to France in a switch to Rennes. Nicolas Höfler is over his foot injury, so Eggestein lose his spot. Nils Petersen has returned from a knee operation, Jonathan Schmid tested positive for COVID-19, so Lukas Kübler could slot in on the left.Promising youngster Kimberly Ezekwem has a muscle injury.Augsburg's team news states that Tobias Strobl is over an ankle injury, while Alfred Finnbogason continues to be plagued by an Achilles problem. Jan Moravek has problems with his adductors, as does Jeffrey Gouweleeuw.Augsburg have added Swiss striker Andi Zeqiri to the squad on loan from Premier League side Brighton.

Augsburg have only managed two goals in five games, but have managed five points, including their first win of the season last weekend, naturally by the narrowest of margins.Freiburg will be a tough nut to crack, unbeaten in five with a couple of wins.A draw could be a good shout here, but a slight preference is given to the home side.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Mahmoud Dahoud is suspended after his red card last weekend, though he suffered a knee injury in midweek anyway.Erling Haaland has missed Dortmund's last two matches and remains a doubt here but Marco Reus returned in midweek.Dan-Axel Zagadou is nearing a return after a knee operation. Axel Witsel has been helping out in defence, but Mats Hummels is fit after injury. Gio Reyna is still on his way back from a muscle injury suffered on the last international break, while Emre Can has a thigh injury and is out for several weeks.Thorgan Hazard is fit after an ankle injury, Mateu Morey has a knee injury, while Nico Schulz is close to a return from a muscle injury.Julian Brandt sustained a muscle injury and remains a doubt.Augsburg's team news states that Tobias Strobl is over an ankle injury, while Alfred Finnbogason continues to be plagued by an Achilles problem. Jan Moravek iis nearly over problems with his adductors, as is Jeffrey Gouweleeuw.Augsburg have added Swiss striker Andi Zeqiri to the squad on loan from Premier League side Brighton.

Hopes remain high that the Black and Yellows can mount a title challenge for the first time in 10 years but they are already four points behind Bayern.Star man Erling "Machine" Haaland boasts 47 goals in 48 Bundesliga games, but was badly missed last weekend in the dire defeat at Gladbach. Augsburg have managed two goals in six games, but have somehow picked up five points. Augsburg could be put to the sword against Dortmund, but to their credit they usually perform well here and will aim to keep the game tight for long periods.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Lukas Klünter needs an operation and will be out for several weeks. Krzysztof Piatek is nearing a return from an ankle injury, while Marvin Plattenhardt is now fit.Dedryck Boyata is nearing a return from a thigh injury, but new signing Myziane Maolida from Nice remains a doubt, along with defender Jordan Torunarigha. Stevan Jovetic is nearing a return from a calf injury as well.Jurgen Ekkelenkamp scored on his home debut 87 seconds after coming on as a substitute and could start here. Denmark U21 goalkeeper Oliver Christensen has been signed from Odense BK to provide competition between the sticks. Another keeper, Rune Jarstein, will be eased back after a heart issue.Freiburg's team news states that Maximilian Eggestein will bolster midfield as record signing Baptiste Santamaria has moved back to France in a switch to Rennes. Nicolas Hofler is over his foot injury, so Eggestein could lose his spot. Nils Petersen has returned from a knee operation, Jonathan Schmid is on his way back from COVID-19, so Lukas Kübler could slot in on the left.Promising youngster Kimberly Ezekwem has a muscle injury.

Freiburg will be a tough nut to crack, unbeaten in six with three wins. Hertha did pick up back-to-back wins, but slipped back to their old ways losing 6-0 in Leipzig last weekend. A draw could be a good shout here, Hertha have not drawn yet this season so could be due for a share of the spoils.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Kevin Mbabu is over a knee problem, while Paulo Otávio is out with an ankle injury.Gian-Luca Waldschmidt is over a minor hip injury which prevented him from training.William, Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager all have ACL injuries.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Stefan Lainer remains on the sidelines, while Marcus Thuram has a muscle tear.Mamadou Doucoure has an Achilles injury, but Matthias Ginter is back after his bout of COVID-19.Manu Koné is over his knee injury, while Denis Zakaria and Breel Embolo are both fit again.Ramy Bensebaini's is nearing a return from a foot injury.

Gladbach earned a decent point against Bayern and beat Dortmund last week, amid a string of poor results.Wolfsburg have lost top spot and will have to recover from Champions League action in midweek.The "Foals" can raise their game and earn a share of the spoils at least, if not better.

RBL's team news states that Marcelo Saracchi is recovering from an ACL injury, while Marcel Halstenberg has an ankle injury. Dani Olmo is now sidelined for a few weeks.Youngster Josko Gvardiol has signed from Dynamo Zagreb and could keep out ex-Manchester City man Angelino.Brian Brobbey will compete with Andre Silva up front, but the latter will win that battle, despite being short of goals after his summer move from Eintracht Frankfurt.Mohamed Simakan has signed from Strasbourg in France and has been reasonably impressive in defence so far.Bochum's team news states that Maxim Leitsch is nearing a return from a muscle injury, but Erhan Masovic could step into defence.Striker Sebastian Polter has signed on a free from Fortuna Sittard and could start up front.Saulo Decarli is almost over a thigh injury, while Herbert Bockhorn is fit after his bout of COVID-19. Danny Blum is over his knee injury, while defender Cristan Gamboa has had an operation on his shoulder and will be out for several weeks.Key man Simon Zoller suffered an ACL injury in training and will not play again this year.

RB Leipzig lost captain Marcel Sabitzer to rivals Bayern Munich and have started poorly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats already in the Bundesliga. They lost 2-1 at home to Club Bruges in the Champions League as well in midweek.Bochum, champions of Bundesliga 2 last season, will be no pushovers, but Leipzig should get the job done on home soil.

Mainz's team news states that Moussa Niakhaté is out for several weeks with a thigh injury, while Aarón Martín is nearing a return from a groin injury.Alexander Hack missed the game last weekend because of a positive COVID-19 test.Ádám Szalai needs a knee op and will be out for several months.Union Berlin's team news states that Midfielder Kevin Möhwald is expected to return from injury here.After Robert Andrich's departure, Genki Haraguchi will likely step into midfield.Grischa Prömel is nearing a return from a slight groin injury.

Mainz were marvellous towards the end of last season and have overcome COVID-19 problems well this time around to start with four clean sheets in five games. Union Berlin have drawn three out of six so far, having also racked up the most draws (14) last season in the whole league.Union have the poison chalice of European football to contend with on Thursday nights and may struggle against a fit, fresh and firing Mainz side.

Bayern's team news states that Benjamin Pavard is suspended for two games after his red card in Fuerth, while Kingsley Coman is nearing a return following minor heart surgery.Lucas Hernandez is a safe bet for Bayern - 31 times the French World Cup winner has started in the Bundesliga since the summer of 2019 without losing a game.Corentin Tolisso remains doubtful with a calf injury. Back-up goalkeeper Sven Ulreich suffered a knee injury and is ruled out.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Obite Evan Ndicka has a knee injury and is doubtful, Christopher Lenz has a muscle injury and Erik Durm suffered concussion.Captain Sebastian Rode has had a knee operation. New signings Jens Petter Hauge or Ajdin Hrustic could slot into midfield as a result.Filip Kostic went on strike to try and force a move to Lazio, but remains at the club and they are much better for him being in the team than in the stands.

Both these sides played in Europe in midweek, but Bayern enjoy at least 24 hours more rest and recuperation than Frankfurt who travelled to Belgium.Robert Lewandowski AMAZINGLY did not score for the first time in 20 games in all comps against bottom side Fuerth, but bounced back with a brace in midweek.Winless Frankfurt have drawn five in a row and are going for their fifth 1-1 in succession too in the Bundesliga, and the vistors would bite your hand off for a share of the spoils here.Record champions Bayern have scored in 53 consecutive Bundesliga games and anything other than a comfortable Bayern win would be a huge surprise.

Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Sebastian Vasiliadis from Paderborn will bolster the club's midfield options once he has recovered from injury, along with fellow new signing Edimilson Fernandes. Lennart Czyborra has joined from Serie A club CFC Genua, while Austrian international Alessandro Schöpf is available after suspension.Leverkusen's team news states that Robert Andrich is suspended for two more games after his red card.Exequiel Palacios sustained an ankle knock in the Europa League and is still ruled out.Former German international Karim Bellarabi is over a muscle injury, while Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury.Timothy Fosu-Mensah has an ACL injury, while Florian Wirtz is over adductor issues, as is Lucas Alario. Edmond Tapsoba has a ligament tear.Back-up Niklas Lomb has a finger injury, not ideal for a goalkeeper.

Fourth placed Leverkusen return from Glasgow and the delights of Thursday's in the Europa League.Winless Arminia have drawn four out of six this term, and much like last season, face a long drawn out battle against relegation. Leverkusen, often known as Neverkusen, have started the season brightly and sit nicely in second.But with tiredness possibly a factor, Arminia can snatch a point on home soil.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Erling Haaland could return after missing Dortmund's last few matches because of a muscle injury.Mahmoud Dahoud is available after suspension, but has a slight niggle.Manuel Akanji had to leave Swiss national camp after adductor pain, while goalkeeper Gregor Kobel did not even travel. Thomas Meunier left Belgium's camp early too, as did Thorgan Hazard with ankle pain.Youssoufa Moukoko suffered a muscle tear while away with Germany U21s, and Raphael Guerreiro picked up a similar injury while away with Portugal.Dan-Axel Zagadou continues his rehab after a knee operation. Gio Reyna is still on his way back from a muscle injury suffered on the last international break, but Emre Can is over a thigh injury. Mateu Morey has a knee injury.Mainz's team news states that Dominik Kohr is suspended after his red card before the international break.Moussa Niakhaté is nearing a return from a thigh injury, while Aarón Martín is also fit after a groin injury.Alexander Hack tested positive for COVID-19 and is unlikely to feature.Ádám Szalai has had a knee op and will be out for several weeks.

Hopes remain high that the Black and Yellows can mount a title challenge for the first time in 10 years and despite two away defeats BVB are only a point behind leaders Bayern.Star man Erling "Machine" Haaland boasts 47 goals in 48 Bundesliga games and holds the key to those title hopes in front of a potential crowd of 67,000.Mainz coach Bo Svensson seems sure to follow in the footsteps of Jurgen Klopp and Thomas Tuchel, the next Super Coach to start at Mainz, and who knows - next stop could be BVB.Mainz were marvellous towards the end of last season and overcame COVID-19 problems to start the season well this time around, but are without a win in three games which is likely to be extended here.

Freiburg's team news states that Maximilian Eggestein has bolstered midfield after record signing Baptiste Santamaria moved back to France in a switch to Rennes. Nicolas Hofler is over his foot injury.Nils Petersen has returned from a knee operation, Jonathan Schmid is on his way back from COVID-19, so Lukas Kübler could slot in on the left.Promising youngster Kimberly Ezekwem is fit after a muscle injury.RBL's team news states that Marcelo Saracchi is recovering from an ACL injury, while Marcel Halstenberg has an ankle injury. Dani Olmo is also sidelined for a few weeks.Youngster Josko Gvardiol has signed from Dynamo Zagreb and could keep out ex-Manchester City man Angelino.Brian Brobbey had to go off injured playing for Netherlands U21 and will be out for a couple of weeks. Mohamed Simakan has signed from Strasbourg in France and has been reasonably impressive in defence so far.

RB Leipzig lost influential captain Marcel Sabitzer to rivals Bayern Munich and have started poorly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats already in the Bundesliga. Freiburg will be a tough nut to crack, unbeaten at home in seven games, while Leipzig have not won on their travels in six games.  Freiburg are never pushovers on home soil, but Leipzig's last away win came in Freiburg in March and this is too close to call.

Greuther Fuerth's team news states that Robin Kehr has an ACL injury.Talented Gideon Jung needs a knee operation and will be out for months. New signing Jessic Ngankam has picked up an ACL injury. Gian-Luca Itter is nearing a return from a thigh injury.Marius Funk is Fuerth's new first choice keeper, ahead of the more experienced Sascha Burchert.Maximilian Bauer suffered a head injury while playing for Germany U21 and will be assessed nearer the game.Free transfer signing Jetro Willems, formerly of Newcastle, has nailed down a spot at left-back.Bochum's team news states that Maxim Leitsch continues to struggle with a muscle injury, but Erhan Masovic could step into defence.Robert Tesche has a muscle injury and unlikely to feature.Saulo Decarli is almost over a thigh injury, but Herbert Bockhorn has a muscle tear.  Danny Blum is over his knee injury, while defender Cristan Gamboa is back from a shoulder injury.Key man Simon Zoller suffered an ACL injury in training and will not play again this year.

Bochum, champions of Bundesliga 2 last season, travel to Fuerth in a meeting of two clubs promoted last season.Fuerth played twice in a row on a Friday evening, so may be glad to play on a Saturday afternoon, as they seek a first ever home win in their brief Bundesliga history, (5 draws,15 defeats).After conceding 19 goals in seven games, Fuerth are bottom with just a solitary point, only Schalke in 1967 have endured such a bad start to a Bundesliga campaign.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Stefan Lainer remains on the sidelines, while Marcus Thuram has a muscle tear. Ramy Bensebaini is nearing a return from a foot injury.Denis Zakaria had to leave Swiss national camp after an injury scare, while Christoph Kramer has a muscle injury.Mamadou Doucoure has an Achilles injury, but Matthias Ginter is back after his bout of COVID-19.Manu Koné is over his knee injury.Stuttgart's team news states that Goalkeeper Florian Müller and midfielder Orel Mangala are the latest of five positive COVID-19 tests at VfB Stuttgart, joining Waldemar Anton, Erik Thommy, Fabian Bredlow and Roberto Massimo on the sidelines.Back-up keeper Bredlow and Massimo have been double vaccinated though and Bredlow may replace Müller in goal. Youngster Florian Schock is another candidate to play in goal if all else fails.Mohamed Sankoh faces six months out with a serious knee injury.Omar Marmoush scored on debut after arriving on loan from leaders Wolfsburg, while Wahid Faghir, another young attacker, has signed from Vejle BK in Denmark and could make the squad.Silas Wamangituka Fundu is still out with a knee injury, but has at least served his suspension for playing under a false identity.Nikolas Nartey and Tanguy Coulibaly are both fit after COVID-19. Top scorer Sasa Kalajdzic returned from COVID-19, but immediately succumbed to a shoulder injury which could keep him out of the action until the winter break.Naouirou Ahamada is over a calf injury, while Momo Cissé has a foot injury and Lilian Egloff has had a foot op.

Gladbach have won two in a row and also earned a decent point against Bayern and beat Dortmund so are clearly no mugs.Stuttgart won their opener 5-1 against bottom side Fuerth, and won last time out before the international break, amid a poor run of two points in four games.VfB have COVID-19 issues and a host of injuries, and are badly missing Sasa Kalajdzic and Silas Wamangituka Fundu, who combined for 27 goals last season. The "Foals" can raise their game and beat 3-time Bundesliga champs Stuttgart with plenty to spare.

Leverkusen's team news states that Robert Andrich serves the final game of a three match ban, but Exequiel Palacios is fit after his ankle knock.Former German international Karim Bellarabi is over a muscle injury, while Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury.Timothy Fosu-Mensah has an ACL injury, while Florian Wirtz is over adductor issues, as is Lucas Alario. Edmond Tapsoba has a ligament tear.Bayern's team news states that Benjamin Pavard is suspended for one more game following his red card in Fuerth, while Kingsley Coman is back following minor heart surgery.Lucas Hernandez has judicial problems with the courts in Madrid, but no injury concerns.Corentin Tolisso is back in training after a calf injury, but back-up goalkeeper Sven Ulreich suffered a knee injury and is ruled out.

A meeting of the top two after the international break, only separated by goal difference.The stats are significantly in Bayern's favour when top plays second. Bayern have lost none of the last 14 games with 10 wins and four draws.Bayern slipped to their first defeat under coach Julian Nagelsmann and will look to bounce back. Leverkusen, often known as Neverkusen, have started the season brightly and sit nicely in second.Goal machine Robert Lewandowski has not scored in last two Bundesliga games, which constitutes a goal drought for the prolific Polish striker.Record champions Bayern have scored in 54 consecutive Bundesliga games and can get the job done here.

Bayern's team news states that Coach Julian Nagelsmann has tested positive for COVID-19, despite being double vaccincated and will have to miss this one against his former club.Alphonso Davies and Leon Goretzka missed the Champions League trip to Benfica in midweek and are absent here, too.Benjamin Pavard is available after suspension, while Kingsley Coman is back following minor heart surgery. Both these sides scored five last week so are in free-scoring form. In fact, record champions Bayern have scored in 55 straight Bundesliga games.Hoffenheim have a decent record against Bayern, picking up 13 points since 2016/17 and will be buoyed by their own demolition of Koln last week.Bayern slipped to their first league defeat under coach Julian Nagelsmann in their last home game and will be looking to put things right here.Goal machine Robert Lewandowski scored twice in last Sunday's 5-1 win over Leverkusen to end a two-game barren Bundesliga spell.Hoffenheim have had all week to prepare for this game, while Bayern had a hard match in Lisbon (for 70 minutes) to recover from and a tough test awaits here.

Newly promoted Fuerth are rooted to the bottom of the table with just a solitary point, only Schalke in 1967 have endured such a bad start to a Bundesliga campaign.RB Leipzig lost influential captain Marcel Sabitzer to rivals Bayern Munich and have started poorly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats already in the Bundesliga. Despite, Leipzig's ropy form, anything other than a comfortable home win would be a massive surprise. They did at least push PSG all the way in midweek, albeit only to lose 3-2.

Freiburg are remarkably the only unbeaten side left in the Bundesliga, though they have drawn four of their eight games. A local derby with only 20 odd km separating the two clubs on the Rhein. Both sides come into the derby having shipped five goals last weekend.Koln stayed up by the skin of their teeth last season, but have been revitalised this season under effervescent new coach Steffen Baumgart, until a 5-0 defeat at Hoffenheim brought them back to earth with a bump last Friday.Leverkusen could have gone top last weekend, but when asked the question forgot how to defend against Bayern and shipped five goals in the first half instead.Leverkusen have the attacking talent to win, but need to be up for the derby fight.

In their last away outing, Frankfurt shocked perennial champions Bayern 2-1 on their own patch, their first win at Bayern in 21 years.But it's tough to follow up a win against Bayern and Frankfurt slipped to a shock defeat, their first home loss in 22 games, last weekend against Hertha Berlin. Frankfurt also have to recover from a tough Europa League game on Thursday.Bochum, champions of Bundesliga.2 last season, grabbed an away win at fellow strugglers Fuerth to move out of the automatic relegation spots.Frankfurt can edge a narrow win but need to be up for the fight.

Both these sides picked up wins to progress to the next round of the DFB Pokal on Tuesday.Hertha are a true test of Hoffenheim's Bundesliga credentials, after the hosts hit Koln for five goals recently but shipped four, as most expected, against Bayern last weekend. After four wins and five defeats, Hertha are due a draw this season and it's time that run is broken.

Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that New signing Sebastian Vasiliadis is still making his way back from injury, but fellow newbie Edimilson Fernandes should make the squad.Lennart Czyborra has joined from Serie A club CFC Genua, while Austrian international Alessandro Schöpf is available after a suspension.Mainz's team news states that Dominik Kohr is available after suspension. Moussa Niakhaté is fit after a thigh injury, while Aarón Martín is also over a recent groin injury.Alexander Hack should be available after his COVID-19 experience, while Ádám Szalai is fit following a knee operation.

This was beginning to look like a relegation six-pointer, but Mainz broke a four-game winless run with an emphatic 4-1 rout of Augsburg last time out. These two sides went to extra time in the DFB Pokal on Tuesday with Mainz enjoying the last laugh in a five-goal thriller.Winless Arminia have drawn five out of nine in the league this term, and much like last season, face a long, drawn out battle against relegation.Unlike the cup thriller, a low-scoring draw game is in store with perhaps a happy end for the home side.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Erling Haaland is ruled out for several weeks with a thigh injury, but Donyell Malen, Gregor Kobel and youngster Youssoufa Moukoko are all expected to be fit.Gio Reyna is still on his way back from a muscle injury suffered on the last international break, but Emre Can is over a thigh injury. Jannes Horn continues to recover from a hip injury.

Despite two away defeats and the absence of Erling Haaland, BVB are currently managing to keep pace with Bayern.Koln stayed up by the skin of their teeth last season, but have been revitalised this season under effervescent new coach Steffen Baumgart, and battled back from two goals down to draw the derby at Leverkusen.Dortmund have won five in a row in the league at home this season, but lost this equivalent fixture last season in a real shock, even with goal machine Haaland on board.Neither keeper has kept a clean sheet this season so we should see a few goals. Dortmund played in the German Cup on Tuesday, while Koln were in action a day later, so BVB have 24 hours advantage in terms of rest.

Freiburg are remarkably the only unbeaten side left in the Bundesliga, rising to third in the table, boasting the meanest defence in the league with just six goals conceded.Newly promoted Fuerth are rooted to the bottom of the table with just a solitary point, the worst ever start in the history of the Bundesliga and have conceded 24 goals, four times as many as the hosts.Fuerth can concentrate all week on this match, having made a first round DFB Pokal exit, while Freiburg had to go to penalties on Tuesday evening to progress.Despite that inconvenience, Freiburg will fancy their chances of continuing their unbeaten streak, but Fuerth will scrap for their lives here.

Leverkusen's team news states that Robert Andrich is available after a three-match ban, but Moussa Diaby is on the naughty step after picking up five yellow cards already.Exequiel Palacios is expected to return after his heavy cold, while Patrik Schick hobbled off with an ankle injury last weekend and is ruled out for a few weeks. Lucas Alario is not 100 per cent fit either, while former German international Karim Bellarabi is also ruled out with a muscle injury. Maxence Lacroix is back from suspension, while Paulo Otávio is nearing a return from an ankle injury.William, Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager all have ACL injuries, with Willam the closest to a return.

Leverkusen could have gone top recently, but shipped five first half goals against Bayern and also sloppily let slip a two-goal half time lead to draw the derby versus Koln.Wolfsburg started the season with four straight wins to go top, but promptly lost four in a row and pressed the panic button by sacking hapless Mark van Bommel. Former Werder Bremen coach Florian Kohfeldt takes over.Wolfsburg have won on their last three visits to Leverkusen and all week to concentrate on this game, having been thrown out of the DFB Pokal for using too many subs. Leverkusen, on the other hand, have a quick turn around after suffering another bad home defeat on Wednesday in the DFB Pokal to second-tier Karlsruhe.Leverkusen have the attacking talent to win, but mounting injury concern and poor form are a worry, so we may see a modest new manager bounce from the visitors.

Union Berlin's team news states that Pawel Wszolek is struggling with heavy bruising, while Timo Baumgartl has recovered from concussion. Key defender Marvin Friedrich has tested positive for COVID-19, so Baumgartl can step in. Rick van Drongelen also tested positive for COVID-19, while Julian Ryerson is feeling unwell.Midfielder Kevin Möhwald is expected to return from injury, but there's an injury cloud hanging over Max Kruse.Bayern's team news states that Coach Julian Nagelsmann tested positive for COVID-19, but could return to the coaching zone on the sidelines for this one, after setting up a virtual coaching hub in his kitchen for recent games. The food won't have tasted too good after the 5-0 mauling in midweek.Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting missed the cup defeat with a muscle injury, but Alphonso Davies and Leon Goretzka made their comebacks after injury in midweek. Lucas Hernandez has escaped jail time following his judicial problems with the courts in Madrid.Corentin Tolisso is fit after a calf injury, but back-up goalkeeper Sven Ulreich suffered a knee injury and is ruled out.

Bayern will look to bounce back from an embarrassing 5-0 cup thrashing in Gladbach, failing to score for the first time in 84 matches in all competitions. Union racked up the most draws (14) last season in the whole league and were the only Bundesliga side not to lose to Bayern last season, twice drawing 1-1.Union are unbeaten at home in 21 in the Bundesliga, while record champions Bayern have scored in 56 straight Bundesliga games. Bayern will expect to bounce back and can end Union's proud unbeaten home record.

RB Leipzig have started slowly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats already in the Bundesliga, while Frankfurt were good enough to shock perennial champions Bayern 2-1 in their own backyard, but that remains the Eagles' only league win this season.But it's tough to follow up a win against Bayern and Frankfurt slipped to a shock defeat, their first home loss in 22 games, against Hertha Berlin and followed that with another turgid showing in Bochum. They have had all week to work on their game plan having made an embarrassing DFB Pokal frst round exit, while Leipzig were involved in Cup action on Tuesday.Leipzig are yet to win away in the league this season under Marsch. In fact, Leipzig have never won at Eintracht Frankfurt in five attempts. Ever. Eintracht are without a home win under coach Oliver Glasner, who drew all his four games with Leipzig which at Wolfsburg. A draw could be the best option.

Only 160km separate these two clubs on the A8 motorway in Germany, with under-pressure Augsburg coach Markus Weinzierl facing his former club.Augsburg have scored only five goals in nine games, but have somehow picked up six points which keeps them out the automatic relegation spots for now.Three-time Bundesliga champs VfB have COVID-19 issues and a host of injuries, and are badly missing Sasa Kalajdzic and Silas Wamangituka Fundu, who combined for 27 goals last season. A low-scoring draw could be the answer with the fear of defeat playing a large role.

Bochum, champions of Bundesliga.2 last season, have moved up to 14th after a couple of wins and have not lost to Gladbach in 15 games, the longest unbeaten run against any club in Bochum's history.Gladbach will be buoyant after their midweek 5-0 cup drubbing of Bayern and also beat Dortmund in the league too, so are clearly no mugs.That said, Gladbach have struggled to rack up wins against the lesser lights, and this may be a bit of a struggle too after the cup euphoria has worn off.

Bayern's team news states that Coach Julian Nagelsmann was back on the sidelines for Wednesday's romp over Benfica after recovering from COVID-19.Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting is fit after a muscle injury, while Lucas Hernandez recently escaped jail time following his judicial problems with the courts in Madrid.Corentin Tolisso is fit after a calf injury, but back-up goalkeeper Sven Ulreich suffered a knee injury and is ruled out.Freiburg's team news states that Yannik Keitel has recovered from COVID-19 but Jonathan Schmid is still on his way back from his experience with the virus. Bayern bounced back from an embarrassing 5-0 DFB Pokal thrashing in Gladbach, with two emphatic 5-2 wins over Union Berlin and Benfica. They have scored in 57 straight league matches.Remarkably it is Freiburg and not Bayern who are the only unbeaten side left in the Bundesliga this season. They head into the weekend in third with the best defensive record in the division (7 goals conceded).Obviously Bayern are expected to end Freiburg's proud unbeaten run but it will likely be a hard-fought win, most likely helped by an almost inevitable goal from the league's top scorer Robert Lewandowski.
