Orel Mangala, Waldemar Anton, Erik Thommy and Roberto Massimo are all back in training after their COVID-19 experiences too. Atakan Karazor is available after suspension.Mohamed Sankoh faces six months out with a serious knee injury, while Silas Wamangituka Fundu is still out with a knee injury.Top scorer Sasa Kalajdzic returned from COVID-19, but immediately succumbed to a shoulder injury, which could keep him out of the action until the winter break.Momo Cisse has a foot injury and Lilian Egloff has had a foot operation.Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Summer signing Sebastian Vasiliadis could make his first start after a dogged injury, alongside fellow newbie Edimilson Fernandes in midfield.

This is a genuine relegation six-pointer.Winless Arminia have drawn five out of 10 in the league, and much like last season face a long, drawn out battle against relegation.Three-time Bundesliga champs VfB have suffered major COVID-19 issues and a host of injuries, and are badly missing Sasa Kalajdzic and Silas Wamangituka Fundu, who combined for 27 goals last season. A low-scoring draw could be the answer with the fear of defeat playing a large role.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Star striker Wout Weghorst has recovered from COVID-19. Paulo Otavio is back fit after injury.Jerome Roussillon has calf pain, while Admir Mehmedi and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt are both struggling with muscle injuries.Maxence Lacroix is suspended for two games after his sending off against Leverkusen.Sebastian Bornauw has adductor pain and Kevin Mbabu a muscle injury. Both will be assessed nearer kick-off.  William, Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager all have ACL injuries, with Willam the closest to a return.Augsburg's team news states that Iago has an hand injury, while youngster Tim Civeja has suffered an ankle ligament tear. Noah Sarenren Bazee has a knee injury.Florian Niederlechner returned from injury with a goal off the bench last time out and is pushing for a start here alongside Brighton loanee Andi Zeqiri.Tobias Strobl is over an ankle injury, while Alfred Finnbogason is struggling with a dogged Achilles problem. Jan Moravek is over problems with his adductors, as is Jeffrey Gouweleeuw.

After sacking hapless Mark van Bommel, former Werder Bremen coach Florian Kohfeldt has taken over and Wolfsburg have enjoyed the proverbial new manager bounce with a decent 2-0 win in Leverkusen, followed by a Champions League win against RB Salzburg in midweek.Before smashing four past Stuttgart last weekend, Augsburg had managed only five goals in nine games this season, and have not won on their travels in 11 games, the worst away run in their Bundesliga history.Back the Wolves to continue their transformation under new coach Kohfeldt.

RBL's team news states that Willi Orban suffered a muscle injury in midweek and is ruled out this weekend. Marcelo Saracchi is still recovering from an ACL injury, while Marcel Halstenberg needs a knee operation. Brian Brobbey is nearing a return. Lukas Klostermann has suffered a muscle tear and will be out for a few weeks.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Erling Haaland may not play again this year in a big blow for Borussia Dortmund. Gio Reyna is closing in on a return. Dortmund have a huge problem at left-back with Nico Schulz and Raphael Guerreiro ruled out and Marius Wolf expected to joint hem on the sidelines after coming off injured in midweek. Felix Passlack may be required to step up here. Dan-Axel Zagadou made his return from a knee injury for the second team last weekend and will bolster the squad.

Both sides failed to win in the Champions League in midweek, though RB Leipzig did face Paris Saint-Germain and Borussia Dortmund were controversially reduced to 10 men in defeat to Ajax. Leipzig have lost their last three meetings with Dortmund and have started slowly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats already in the Bundesliga.BVB are currently managing to keep pace with Bayern, despite two away defeats and the continued absence of Erling Haaland.With both defences suspect, this promises goals at both ends.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Dedryck Boyata is suspended for three games after his red card last time out, the seventh time the robust Belgian has been sent off in his career.Lukas Klunter is out for several weeks after a shoulder operation. Krzysztof Piatek is fit after an ankle injury, while Marvin Plattenhardt is also now back. Kevin-Prince Boateng is struggling with persistent knee pain, however. Lucas Tousart is over his ankle knock, while Marton Dardai, son of the coach Pal, is back in training and could return this weekend. Defender Jordan Torunarigha is back in training following a thigh injury. Niklas Stark could return too.Leverkusen's team news states that Moussa Diaby missed last weekend due to suspension before returning with a bang in the Europa League on Thursday with a 10 rated performance. Mitchel Bakker is out with an ankle injury for four weeks and Patrik Schick hobbled off with an ankle injury last weekend and is out for a few weeks. Lucas Alario is not 100 per cent fit either and winger Karim Bellarabi is sidelined with a muscle injury. Charles Aranguiz is only expected back after the international break after suffering a calf injury, while Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury. Timothy Fosu-Mensah has an ACL injury and is still on the mend.Exequiel Palacios is at least expected to return from a cold.

Bayer Leverkusen missed the chance to go top recently, though were emphatically beaten by Bayern Munich. Their confidence should be bubbling after Thursday's 4-0 win over Real Betis, however. After four wins and six defeats, Hertha are due a draw this season and it's time that run is broken. Leverkusen have not scored against Hertha in four games and have mounting injury problems.

FC Koln's team news states that Ellyes Skhiri is back in light training following his knee injury incurred while away playing for Tunisia. He will not be rushed back.Defender Timo Hubers is fit after an ankle injury, while Jan Thielmann is over a stomach complaint. Jannes Horn continues to recover from a hip injury.Union Berlin's team news states that Key defender Marvin Friedrich is over his COVID-19 experience, while Rick van Drongelen is also nearing a return.Midfielder Kevin Möhwald is expected to return from injury, but there's an injury cloud hanging over Max Kruse.

Union have won all four Bundesliga meetings with Koln, but racked up the most draws (14) last season in the whole league.Koln stayed up by the skin of their teeth last season, but have been revitalised this season under effervescent new coach Steffen Baumgart.With Union involved in Europa Conference League action against Feyenoord on Thursday, Koln can nick the points in front of their fervent home crowd.

Augsburg's team news states that Iago has an hand injury, while youngster Tim Civeja has suffered an ankle ligament tear. Noah Sarenren Bazee has a knee injury, while Tobias Strobl is ruled out for the rest of the season with an ACL tear.Florian Niederlechner has bad swelling on his foot and remains touch and go, while Jeffrey Gouweleeuw has an ankle injury and Reece Oxford has knee pain. Alfred Finnbogason is struggling with a dogged Achilles problem, but Jan Moravek is over problems with his adductors.Bayern's team news states that Niklas Sule tested positive for COVID-19 during the international break and that forced Joshua Kimmich, Serge Gnabry, Jamal Musiala and Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting to quarantine. Those that aren't fully vaccinated have to stay in a different hotel to the team. Kimmich will not feature here in any capacity. Josip Stanisic has also tested positive for COVID.Thomas Muller celebrates his 600th Bundesliga appearance in his next outing. Given his form, he is expected to start on Friday night. Alphonso Davies won't start this one after a heavy workload and lengthy travel for international duty. Omar Richards may deputise in a rare appearance. Leon Goretzka should be fit after getting kicked on international duty and Corentin Tolisso is fit after a calf injury. Back-up goalkeeper Sven Ulreich is back in training following a knee injury.Kingsley Coman featured more for France than anticipated and he won't be risked from the start on Friday with the Champions League round the corner.

Bundesliga matchday 12 begins with a Bavarian derby with FCA hosting champions-in-waiting FCB who have moved serenely four points clear.Apart from smashing four past struggling Stuttgart, Augsburg have managed only five goals in their other 10 games this season, while Bayern have scored in 58 straight league matches and notched 100 Bundesliga goals in total in 2021. Bayern bounced back from an embarrassing 5-0 DFB Pokal thrashing in Gladbach with three straight wins in all comps before the international break.Augsburg have annoyed their noisy neighbours Bayern before, but this current side looks short of quality and a hard-fought derby win for Bayern awaits, most likely settled by an almost inevitable goal from the league's top scorer Robert Lewandowski.

Arminia Bielefeld's team news states that Patrick Wimmer should be fit after suffering a facial injury, but will have to wear a specially-fitted mask though.Summer signing Sebastian Vasiliadis could make another start after a dogged injury, alongside fellow newbie Edimilson Fernandes in midfield.Wolfsburg's team news states that William has suffered a serious knee injury and will be out for several months, meaning he will likely never play for the club again.Maxence Lacroix is suspended for one more game following his sending off against Leverkusen before the international break.Sebastian Bornauw has a foot injury, while Micky van de Ven has a muscle injury. But Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager are nearing returns from long-term ACL injuries.

After sacking hapless Mark van Bommel, former Werder Bremen coach Florian Kohfeldt took over and Wolfsburg enjoyed the proverbial new manager bounce with three straight wins in all competitions.Arminia finally got off the mark with a win at struggling Stuttgart before the international break, but have only scored seven goals in 11 games.Wolfsburg have not conceded a goal in Bielefeld in their last five trips, while goalkeeper Koen Casteels has kept five clean sheets this season, the joint best in the division.Therefore, back the Wolves to continue their transformation under new coach Kohfeldt.

Hoffenheim's team news states that Robert Skov will not play again this year because of a thigh injury. Christoph Baumgartner is out with a thigh injury.It would be a surprise if Andrej Kramaric featured here after he was briefly knocked unconscious on duty for Croatia. Sebastian Rudy will most likely miss out here with a muscle injury.Florian Grillitsch has dropped into defence for his last four appearances for Hoffenheim but may be required back in midfield given their absences. Ermin Bicakcic is still out from ACL trouble and Benjamin Hubner is back in light training after 14 months out. Havard Nordtveit is back available after recovering from a thigh problem but USA international Chris Richards is set to play in defence here.Pavel Kaderabek is struggling with an ankle injury. Marco John has suffered a shoulder injury and is ruled out for several weeks.RBL's team news states that Willi Orban could return from a muscle injury this weekend, but fellow defenders Marcelo Saracchi and Marcel Halstenberg are sidelined. Lukas Klostermann is also a doubt.Yussuf Poulsen is out for a few weeks with a calf injury.

RB Leipzig started slowly under new coach Jess Marsch with three defeats, but a seven-game unbeaten run before the international break has seen the east German side move up to 5th.Hoffenheim won their last three at home before the international break, but have not scored against Leipzig in three games. Leipzig could earn their first away win of the season here.

Leverkusen's team news states that Mitchel Bakker is ruled out with an ankle injury, but Patrik Schick is in the squad, which is a huge boost.Lucas Alario is not 100% fit either, but winger Karim Bellarabi could return after recovering from a muscle injury. Charles Aranguiz is also nearing a return from a calf injury, but Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury. Timothy Fosu-Mensah has an ACL injury and is still on the mend.Not one but two 16-year-old's have played for Bayer Leverkusen this season in Iker Bravo and Zidan Sertdemir. More talent off the club's ridiculous conveyor belt.Bochum's team news states that Gerrit Holtmann has undergone a groin operation, while Maxim Leitsch continues to struggle with a muscle injury. Erhan Masovic may step into defence.Key man Simon Zoller suffered an ACL injury in training and will not play again this year.Robert Tesche is nearing a return from a muscle injury. Saulo Decarli has a shoulder injury and Herbert Bockhorn has a muscle tear and is ruled out.

Improving Bochum, champions of Bundesliga.2 last season, have moved up to 12th after three wins before the international break. Goalkeeper Manuel Riemann has kept five clean sheets, the joint best in the division, but Bochum have lost five out of six away, only beating relegation-bound Fuerth.Bayer Leverkusen were riddled with injuries before the international break and had to bring on two 16-year-old substitutes in their bid to salvage a point in Berlin. With the injuries abating, the home side can get back to winning ways.

Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Breel Embolo and Nico Elvedi both had to go off early through injury in the draw at Mainz before the international break and are still ruled out for this one.Louis Jordan Beyer suffered a muscle injury, while club legend Tony Jantschke is not expected to play again this year, but Stefan Lainer is nearing a return.Christoph Kramer and Mamadou Doucoure are both injured too but Marcus Thuram is over a muscle tear for Gladbach.Greuther Fuerth's team news states that Jeremy Dudziak, Sascha Burchert, Maximilian Bauer, Dickson Abiama and Nils Seufert could all return to the squad after their COVID-19 experience.Nick Viergever has an ankle injury, while Justin Hoogma has suffered a knee injury and will be out for several weeks.Robin Kehr has an ACL injury, while Havard Nielsen is nearing a return from an ankle problem.Talented Gideon Jung needs a knee operation and will be out for months. New signing Jessic Ngankam has picked up an ACL injury. Gian-Luca Itter is unwell.

Gladbach only lost one of their last seven before the international break and in that time memorably thrashed Bayern Munich 5-0 in the cup and also overcame Borussia Dortmund in the league.Newly promoted Fuerth are rooted to the bottom of the table with just a solitary point, the worst ever start in the history of the Bundesliga, conceding 29 goals.Gladbach have struggled to get wins against the lesser lights, so don't be too surprised if they make tough work of this one against a relegation-bound Fuerth side who will scrap for their lives.

Union Berlin's team news states that Key defender Marvin Friedrich is over his COVID-19 experience, while Rick van Drongelen is also nearing a return, but is still awaiting his league debut.Former German international striker Max Kruse is close to a return, but striker Kevin Behrens has tested positive for COVID-19.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Dedryck Boyata is suspended for two more games after the seventh sending off of his career. Stevan Jovetic tested positive for COVID-19 while on international duty.Lukas Klünter is out for several weeks after a shoulder operation. Krzysztof Piatek is fit after an ankle injury, while Marvin Plattenhardt is also now back. Kevin-Prince Boateng is struggling with persistent knee pain, while Vladimir Darida has a thigh problem.

A mouth-watering top-flight derby awaits in the capital in front of a potential full-house.Union lost their remarkable unbeaten home record (21 games) last time out, albeit to Bayern Munich. Hertha Berlin have lost four of their six away league matches this season, so look for Union to bounce back here.

Mainz's team news states that 20-year-old Niklas Tauer has a knee injury, while Jeremiah St. Juste is ruled out after a shoulder operation. Anderson Lucoqui is out with a knee injury sustained in training.Alexander Hack is available after recovering from COVID-19 and Adam Szalai is fit again following a knee operation.FC Koln's team news states that Ellyes Skhiri is back in light training following his knee injury incurred while away playing for Tunisia. He will not be rushed back though.Defender Timo Hubers is fit after an ankle injury, while Jan Thielmann is over a stomach complaint. Jannes Horn is nearing a return from a hip injury.

Mainz went into the international break unbeaten in three league matches having previously gone without a win in four.Koln have gained eight points from losing positions this season, with leading goalscorer Anthony Modeste leading by example with eight goals.Mainz can nick the points in a meeting of two "Carnival" clubs.

Stuttgart's team news states that Silas Wamangituka Fundu could make his long-awaited comeback, while Omar Marmoush and Chris Führich are both expected to return to the squad too.Tanguy Coulibaly is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow card.Naouirou Ahamada has shaken off his Achilles pain, while Enzo Millot continues his rehab from a knee injury. Erik Thommy has a pelvic injury and is ruled out. Mohamed Sankoh faces six months out with a serious knee injury. Marc Oliver Kempf is still struggling to shake off a thigh injury.Top scorer Sasa Kalajdzic returned from COVID-19, but immediately succumbed to a shoulder injury, which could keep him out of the action until next month.Momo Cisse has a foot injury and Lilian Egloff has had a foot operation.Mainz's team news states that Stefan Bell is suspended after picking up his fifth yellow card. David Nemeth may deputise in defence.Dominik Kohr will be out for several weeks with a thigh injury, while 20-year-old Niklas Tauer has a knee injury.Jeremiah St. Juste is ruled out after a shoulder operation, while Anderson Lucoqui is out with a knee injury sustained in training.

Ailing three-time Bundesliga champions VfB have lost three in a row, major COVID-19 issues and a host of injuries contributing to a run of poor form.Mainz are unbeaten in four, having previously gone without a win in four.Silas Wamangituka Fundu might make his long-awaited comeback, having scored in both wins over Mainz last season. He can be the main man again.

Bochum's team news states that Patrick Osterhage has a muscle injury, while Danny Blum has a thigh problem.Goalkeeper Manuel Riemann is struggling with a thigh injury but should be fitGerrit Holtmann is back in training after a groin operation and defender Maxim Leitsch is close to a return after three months out with a muscle injury.Key man Simon Zoller suffered an ACL injury in training and will not play again for the foreseeable future.Robert Tesche is nearing a return from a muscle injury. Saulo Decarli has a shoulder injury, but Herbert Bockhorn is fit after recovering from a muscle tear.Freiburg's team news states that Nico Schlotterbeck is in contention again after recovering from a thigh injury, while Jonathan Schmid is still on his way back from his experience with COVID-19.Nils Petersen is still battling knee pain but Philipp Lienhart and Roland Sallai should be fit. Kimberly Ezekwem is nearing a return from a muscle injury.

Improving Bochum, champions of Bundesliga.2 last season, are decent at home with three wins out of five this season.Goalkeeper Manuel Riemann has kept five clean sheets, the joint best in the division, keeping three straight at home as well. Freiburg have lost two in a row but still sit nicely in third with the best defensive record in the division (11 goals conceded).This will be Christian Streich's 300th Bundesliga game in charge of Freiburg (98 wins, 89 draws and 112 defeats) and he may have to content himself with a draw here.

FC Koln's team news states that Timo Horn played his 200th Bundesliga game for Koln last weekend but suffered a knee injury in training and is ruled out. Marvin Schwäbe is set for his Bundesliga debut in goal.Ellyes Skhiri has recovered from a knee injury, while defender Timo Hubers is fit after an ankle injury. Jannes Horn is nearing a return from a hip injury.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Breel Embolo is still out with a thigh injury, but Nico Elvedi is back in training ahead of schedule and could return for the derby.Louis Jordan Beyer suffered a muscle injury, while club legend Tony Jantschke is not expected to play again this year, but Stefan Lainer and Christoph Kramer are both nearing a return.Mamadou Doucoure is on his way back from an Achilles problem.

Koln have gained nine points from losing positions this season, with leading goalscorer Anthony Modeste leading by example with eight goals.Gladbach have only lost one one of their last eight and in that time memorably thrashed Bayern Munich 5-0 in the German Cup and also overcame Borussia Dortmund in the league.A close battle can be expected in the Rhein derby with Gladbach more fancied for the win.

Greuther Fuerth's team news states that Jetro Willems suffered an ankle injury in training and is doubtful, while Paul Seguin had a heavy cold and could not train fully this week. Gian-Luca Itter has COVID.Jeremy Dudziak, Sascha Burchert, Maximilian Bauer, Dickson Abiama and Nils Seufert could all return to the squad after their COVID-19 experience.Nick Viergever has an ankle injury, while Justin Hoogma has suffered a knee injury and will be out for several weeks.Robin Kehr has an ACL injury, while Havard Nielsen is nearing a return from an ankle problem.Talented Gideon Jung needs a knee operation and will be out for months. New signing Jessic Ngankam has picked up an ACL injury.Hoffenheim's team news states that Robert Skov will not play again this year because of a thigh injury, while Christoph Baumgartner is still struggling with the same problem.Andrej Kramaric has returned to training after being briefly knocked unconscious on duty for Croatia. Sebastian Rudy will most likely out again with a muscle injury.Ermin Bicakcic is still out from ACL trouble, but Benjamin Hubner is back in the squad after 14 months out. Pavel Kaderabek is struggling with an ankle injury. Marco John has suffered a shoulder injury and is ruled out for several weeks.

Newly promoted Fuerth have lost 10 in a row, rooted to the bottom of the table with just a solitary point - the worst ever start in the history of the Bundesliga, conceding 29 goals.Relegation-bound Fuerth will scrap for their lives, but Hoffenheim boast too much quality in the final third and can cruise to a leisurely away win.

Wolfsburg's team news states that Goalkeeper Koen Casteels has tested positive for COVID-19. Pavao Pervan will likely play in goal.Maxence Lacroix will bolster defence on his return from suspension, while Renato Steffen is struggling with a calf injury.William has suffered a serious knee injury and will be out for several months, meaning he will likely never play for the club again.Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager are nearing returns from long-term ACL injuries.Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Erling Haaland is making a quicker recovery than expected and could even cameo this weekend in a massive boost for Borussia Dortmund. Jude Bellingham has a knee problem and won't be available to face Wolfsburg, however. Thorgan Hazard has tested positive for COVID-19 and is also ruled for Dortmund this weekend. Gio Reyna continues his comeback from a muscle injury.Youssoufa Moukoko is over an eye infection, while Raphael Guerreiro will need to be checked for a muscle injury. Marius Wolf is nearing a return.

Both teams must respond to Champions League defeats in midweek. Borussia Dortmund are now out of the Champions League, but Wolfsburg can still qualify for the knock-out stage despite sitting bottom of their group heading into the final match.The gap at the top of the Bundesliga is now a point after Dortmund capitalised on Bayern's shock defeat last time out. Dortmund are coping relatively well domestically in the prolonged absence of star striker Erling Haaland.Former Werder Bremen manager Florian Kohfeldt has steadied the ship at Wolfsburg after the sacking of Mark van Bommel. He is unbeaten in the Bundesliga and a draw could be on the cards here.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Coach Oliver Glasner will have to see how his side rock up after their Europa League affair with Antwerp.Goncalo Paciencia is over his thigh problem and scored a tremendous last-gasp equaliser on Thursday. Christopher Lenz is battling a muscle injury.Captain Sebastian Rode is fit after a knee operation, while Aymen Barkok is also over his knee injury.Union Berlin's team news states that Coach Urs Fischer will have to assess his squad after their return from Israel.Striker Kevin Behrens has tested positive for COVID-19 and is ruled out.

Two evenly-matched sides meet here with both involved in European competition on Thursday. However, Union had a trip to Israel, so Frankfurt have appreciably more rest having played on home soil.Frankfurt have remarkably not won at home all season, but did have the quality to beat leaders Bayern and have prevailed in their previous two Bundesliga games.Union bagged 14 draws last season - the most in the division, while Frankfurt have drawn four of five on home soil, so a share of the spoils could be the best option in Germany's financial capital.

RBL's team news states that There has been a massive outbreak of COVID-19 at RB Leipzig with head coach Jesse March and players Peter Gulacsi, Hugo Novoa, Yussuf Poulsen, Willi Orban and Mohamed Simakan all testing positive. Dominik Szoboszlai and Amadou Haidara are both doubts and will be assessed near the match. Dani Olmo will be out for a few weeks with a muscle injury and defenders Marcelo Saracchi and Marcel Halstenberg are sidelined.Leverkusen's team news states that Mitchel Bakker is ruled out with an ankle injury, but striker Patrik Schick is fit again, which is a huge boost.Lucas Alario is not 100% fit either, but winger Karim Bellarabi could return after recovering from a muscle injury. Charles Aranguiz is also over a calf injury, but Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury. Timothy Fosu-Mensah has an ACL injury and is still on the mend.Not one but two 16-year-old's have played for Bayer Leverkusen this season in Iker Bravo and Zidan Sertdemir. More talent off the club's ridiculous conveyor belt.

RB Leipzig will be buoyed by their 5-0 win in the Champions League in midweek, but have started slowly domestically under new coach Jess Marsch with four defeats. RBL have won five out of six at home in the Bundesliga, but this game is likely to be played without fans so any home advantage goes out the window.Having played on Wednesday, Leipzig also enjoy 24 hours more prep time for this game, as Bayer Leverkusen came from behind to beat Celtic on Thursday in the Europa League. Leverkusen are unbeaten away from home this season and will hope to at least preserve that streak here.

Union Berlin's team news states that Apart from Laurenz Dehl, coach Urs Fischer will likely have a near full strength squad at his disposal as striker Kevin Behrens will be available after his COVID-19 experience.RBL's team news states that There has been a massive outbreak of COVID-19 at RB Leipzig with head coach Jesse March and players Peter Gulacsi, Hugo Novoa, Yussuf Poulsen, Willi Orban and Mohamed Simakan all testing positive. Simakan and Gulacsi could be cleared to play in this one, however.Dominik Szoboszlai and Amadou Haidara are both doubts and will be assessed near the game. Dani Olmo will be out for a few weeks with a muscle injury and defenders Marcelo Saracchi and Marcel Halstenberg are also sidelined.

Union have lost three out of four against Leipzig but are ultra-strong in front of their own fans, only losing to champions Bayern in their last 22 Bundesliga home games.With the COVID situation deteriorating in Germany, the question remains if fans are allowed in Bundesliga stadiums though to generate any atmosphere and a decisive home advantage.Eighth placed RB Leipzig have started slowly domestically under new coach Jess Marsch winning and losing five games, and are yet to win away from home this season.Another defeat here in the East German derby could leave Marsch's job hanging by a thread.

Augsburg's team news states that English centre-back Reece Oxford has suffered a muscle injury and is ruled out. Another youngster, Frederik Winther, 20, should benefit with another start here. Felix Uduokhai is back in training but will not be rushed back, while striker Alfred Finnbogason cannot shake off a muscle injury. Iago is fit after recovering from a hand injury.Ruben Vargas should be available after his experience with COVID but now Jeffrey Gouweleeuw has tested positive for the virus. Youngster Tim Civeja has suffered an ankle ligament tear. Noah Sarenren Bazee has a knee injury, while Tobias Strobl is ruled out for the rest of the season with an ACL injury.Bochum's team news states that Goalkeeper Manuel Riemann is ruled out with a thigh injury and Michael Esser will likely deputise.Robert Tesche is nearing a return from a muscle injury, while Danny Blum should make the squad after recovering from a thigh problem. Patrick Osterhage is over a muscle injury and Gerrit Holtmann is fit after a groin operation. Meanwhile, defender Maxim Leitsch could get his first start after three months out.Key man Simon Zoller suffered an ACL injury in training and will not play again for the foreseeable future.Saulo Decarli has a shoulder injury, but Herbert Bockhorn is fit again for the away side.

In a famous last home outing, underdogs Augsburg shocked champions Bayern in the Bavarian derby and look to be on an upward curve.Bochum, champions of Bundesliga.2 last season, have picked up four wins in six games to rise the table too.Augsburg have remarkably not beaten a promoted side in 14 attempts at home - a Bundesliga record and that run could continue here.

Hoffenheim's team news states that First choice keeper Oliver Baumann has recovered from the flu and will play in goal.Sebastian Rudy and Christoph Baumgartner are both struggling to shake off muscle injuries, while Robert Skov will not play again this year because of a thigh injury.Pavel Kaderabek is still feeling an ankle injury and is unlikely to start, but Andrej Kramaric will likely be in the XI as he chases his 100th competitive goal for Hoffenheim.Ermin Bicakcic is still out from ACL trouble, but Benjamin Hubner is back in the squad after 14 months out. Marco John has suffered a shoulder injury and is ruled out for several weeks.Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Coach Oliver Glasner is unlikely to make too many changes to a side that have picked up in recent weeks.Goncalo Paciencia is over his thigh problem and is good option from the bench, while Christopher Lenz nears a return from a muscle injury.

Hoffenheim have won four in a row at home, and scored six last time out, albeit at against relegation-bound Fuerth. However, the home side will have to overcome an awful record against Frankfurt, losing six in a row in all competitions.Frankfurt are on a run of three straight wins, and had the quality to beat leaders Bayern, also prevailing in their previous two Bundesliga away games.Two evenly-matched sides meet here and a draw could be a good shout.

Leverkusen's team news states that Mitchel Bakker is ruled out with an ankle injury, but striker Patrik Schick is fit again, which is a huge boost.Timothy Fosu-Mensah is nearing a return from an ACL injury.Lucas Alario is not yet 100 per cent for the full 90, but winger Karim Bellarabi could return after recovering from the flu.Charles Aranguiz is also over a calf injury, but Julian Baumgartlinger will be out until the new year with a knee injury.Greuther Fuerth's team news states that Paul Seguin has recovered from a heavy cold but now Havard Nielsen is now suffering with the same illness. Gian-Luca Itter should return after his bout of COVID.Jetro Willems is nearing a return from an ankle injury, but Nick Viergever is out with a similar problem. Justin Hoogma, Gideon Jung, Robin Kehr and Jessic Ngankam remarkably all have knee injuries.

Third-placed Bayer Leverkusen boast the best away record in the division, but have lost half of their home league games.Newly promoted Fuerth have lost a league record 11 in a row, rooted to the bottom of the table with just a solitary point - the worst ever start in the history of the Bundesliga, conceding 39 goals.Leverkusen boast too much quality in the final third and it would be a shock if they continued to slip up at home here.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Erling Haaland returned from injury much quicker than expected in last weekend's victory over Wolfsburg and naturally scored off the bench. His return ahead of this weekend's clash with title rivals Bayern Munich is massive for the league. Gio Reyna received a round of applause from his team-mates after returning to first-team training after so long out injured but he wont be rushed back.Dortmund are sweating on the availability of England international Jude Bellingham, who has a knee injury. Thorgan Hazard is still struggling to overcome COVID-19, while Youssoufa Moukoko has suffered a muscle injury and will not play again this year.Raphael Guerreiro and Marius Wolf are both nearing returns.Bayern's team news states that Robert Lewandowski is set for his 350th competitive game for Bayern and will be looking to add to his magnificent tally of 319 goals.Leon Goretzka has a hip injury and could not train at full tilt this week, while Josip Stanisic is ruled out with a thigh injury. Niklas Süle is back training after COVID and could start ahead of Benjamin Pavard.Joshua Kimmich and Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting were the latest Bayern stars to test positive for COVID and miss out again, but Serge Gnabry, Jamal Musiala and Michael Cuisance are cleared to play. Marcel Sabitzer has a calf injury, Tanguy Nianzou is struggling with a shoulder injury while Bouna Sarr has an adductor injury.

Dortmund have won all seven home league matches this season but their biggest test awaits this weekend. Bayern Munich have scored in 60 straight league matches and have notched a record 102 Bundesliga goals in 2021. For Dortmund to be only one point off Bayern when they played many games without Erling Haaland is massive and now he is back they will be confident of staying with the title favourites. The fact only 15,000 fans will be present in the stadium following new restrictions in Germany is undeniably a blow for Dortmund here. A Dortmund player from 2010-14, Robert Lewandowski has scored 20 goals in 14 games against his former employer, no other player in Bundesliga history has scored so often against his ex-club.Despite Bayern's COVID issues, notably the absence of Joshua Kimmich, the almost inevitable goal or two from Lewandowski could swing this one Bayern's way.

Stuttgart's team news states that Silas Wamangituka Fundu made his long-awaited comeback last week as a late substitute. He should get more game time here off the bench.Chris Führich has tested positive for COVID.Naouirou Ahamada is struggling with Achilles pain, while Enzo Millot continues his rehab from a knee injury. Erik Thommy has a pelvic injury and is ruled out. Mohamed Sankoh faces six months out with a serious knee injury. Marc Oliver Kempf is still struggling to shake off a thigh injury.Top scorer Sasa Kalajdzic returned from COVID-19, but immediately succumbed to a shoulder injury, which could keep him out of the action until next month.Momo Cisse and Lilian Egloff are both out with foot injuries. Tanguy Coulibaly is available after suspension.Hertha Berlin's team news states that Pal Dardai was fired and replaced with Tayfun Korkut on an interim basis until the end of the season. His first game is a trip to his former club.Márton Dárdai, son of the sacked boss, has suffered a muscle injury and is struggling, but Dedryck Boyata is available after a three-game suspension. Norway goalkeeper Rune Jarstein is ruled out with a knee injury.Lukas Klünter is nearing a return from a shoulder operation. Kevin-Prince Boateng is struggling with persistent knee pain, but Vladimir Darida is over a thigh problem.Fredrik André Björkan will join in January from Norwegian champions Bodö/Glimt.

Three-time Bundesliga champions VfB grabbed a vital win last time out against Mainz to snap a run of three straight league defeats. This game will be played behind closed doors due to new local restrictions in Germany.Hertha have not kept a clean sheet in 15 away games, while Stuttgart have conceded in their last 11 homes, so we should see some goals.

Bayern's team news states that Coach Julian Nagelsmann will have to see how his troops rock up after their Champions League stroll against Barcelona in midweek.Joshua Kimmich will not play again this year, now suffering with a lung problem after his COVID experience, while Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting is also still suffering from the effects of the virus. Seventh-placed Mainz look set for a season of serenity, bereft of relegation worries and have all week to concentrate on this one, while leaders Bayern breezed past Barcelona in midweek.Mainz have only conceded 14 goals this season, one fewer than champions-in-waiting Bayern.Bayern Munich have scored in 61 straight league matches and have notched a record 105 Bundesliga goals in 2021.Mainz will make this a lot tougher than Barca did in midweek and with no fans in the Allianz Arena, a narrow Bayern win is the obvious call.

Gio Reyna received a round of applause from his teammates after returning to first-team training after so long out injured but he wont be rushed back.Thorgan Hazard is nearing a return from COVID-19, while Youssoufa Moukoko has suffered a muscle injury and will not play again this year. Former skipper Marcel Schmelzer continues his comeback from a knee injury.

Borussia Dortmund will aim to bounce back from that bitter Klassiker defeat against minnows Bochum in the Ruhr Derby.Bochum, champions of Bundesliga.2 last season, will be no pushovers having picked up five wins in their last seven games to impressively jump the table. Only Bayern have picked up more points during this time than Bochum.Dortmund will still feel a little aggrieved after penalty decisions went against them last weekend and can seal the points against their local rivals with an inevitable goal or two from Erling "Machine" Haaland.

In their last respective home and away fixtures, three-time Bundesliga champions VfB Stuttgart picked up their first away win of the season, while Koln slipped to their first home defeat.VfB will look to bounce back from a 5-0 thrashing against the champions-in-waiting Bayern in midweek.After twice coming from behind to beat Wolfsburg 3-2 in midweek, Koln have gained a league best 12 points from losing positions this season, with leading goalscorer Anthony Modeste setting the standard with 10 goals, including, amazingly, seven times with his head.A draw could be the best option here between two evenly-matched sides.

Eintracht have have won six out of their last seven, garnering 11 points from losing positions this season to rise imperiously to sixth spot.After a poor end to the year and four defeats on their travels, Borussia Dortmund have slipped nine points behind usual suspects Bayern and their title hopes lie in tatters once again.The inevitable goal or two from Erling "Machine" Haaland is Dortmund's best hope of securing a successful start to 2022. An attractive game and a high-scoring start to the year awaits in Germany's financial capital with the points shared.

Bochum's team news states that Jürgen Locadia has joined from Brighton, while Erhan Masovic is unavailable through suspension.Eduard Löwen should return after COVID-19, but Konstantinos Stafylidis also tested positive while in Greece and remains a doubt. Goalkeeper Manuel Riemann is fit after a thigh injury, while defender Danilo Soares fit after a back injury.Key man Simon Zoller is still on his way back from an ACL injury.Wolfsburg's team news states that Gian-Luca Waldschmidt is back and could replace Lukas Nmecha who will be out for several weeks with a foot injury.Kevin Mbabu contracted COVID-19 for a second time but may be on the bench, while Dodi Lukébakio and Aster Vranckx have also contracted the virus. Daniel Ginczek also has to quarantine.Jérôme Roussillon is available after suspension, but Paulo Otavio has suffered a season-ending knee injury.William has suffered a serious knee injury and will be out for several months, meaning he will likely never play for the club again with his contract up in the summer. Bartosz Bialek and Xaver Schlager are both nearing returns from long-term ACL injuries.

Coach Florian Kohfeldt will have to lift his side after seven straight defeats in all competitions, encompassing a miserable Champions League exit.Promoted Bochum boast a decent home record with four wins and in a meeting of two evenly-matched sides, honours could be shared with the visitors just pleased to stop the rot.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that Dan-Axel Zagadou could return to defence after COVID, while fellow defender Manuel Akanji nears a return from a knee problem.Gio Reyna could return to the squad after several months out, while Mateu Morey remains on the sidelines with a serious knee injury.Youssoufa Moukoko is fit after a muscle injury, while former skipper Marcel Schmelzer continues his comeback from a knee injury.Freiburg's team news states that Nico Schlotterbeck, Mark Flekken and Kiliann Sildillia tested positive for COVID-19. Schlotterbeck is the likeliest to feature in the squad.Belgian U21 defender Hugo Siquet has joined to bolster options at the back, while Yannik Keitel is fit after an adductor injury.

After a poor year-end, Borussia Dortmund famously bounced back from a two-goal deficit to win 3-2 in Frankfurt to cut the gap at the top to "only" six points.Fourth-placed Freiburg have only conceded 18 goals, the same as champions-in-waiting Bayern, but let slip a two-goal lead themselves last weekend, only drawing at home to lowly Bielefeld.A narrow win could be the answer for Dortmund to cement second spot with a goal or two from Erling "Machine" Haaland in front of 750 fervent home fans.

Despite a surprise home defeat to Gladbach, Bayern Munich are still six points clear. Robert Lewandowski will fancy his chances of adding a couple more to his tally of 20 league goals for the season.

Bayern Munich restored their six-point lead at the top of the Bundesliga with a ruthless 4-0 win in Koln last weekend. Union Berlin are a side not to be underestimated, currently sitting in a Champions League qualification spot and safely into the German Cup quarter-finals.Augsburg did manage to beat leaders Bayern back in November, but face another relegation battle, something FCA have become well accustomed to. In fact, this is Augsburg's 91st time occupying a spot in the Bundesliga bottom three, but FCA have always managed to escape the Bundesliga drop.A share of the spoils could be the answer here.

Hoffenheim have gained a league-best 15 points from losing positions this season, while Mainz have gained only a single point after falling behind, the league's worst such record. Mainz have the fourth best home record in the league, with 21 points and six wins.In a derby with local pride at stake, back Mainz to win the day in front of 6800 home fans.

Bayern's team news states that Alphonso Davies is ruled out for the foreseeable future after mild myocarditis was detected following his bout of COVID-19.With another three points, Manuel Neuer can draw level with the great Oliver Kahn on 310 Bundesliga wins.Lucas Hernandez, Kingsley Coman, Corentin Tolisso, Omar Richards, Tanguy Nianzou, Leroy Sane, Dayot Upamecano, Neuer and Corentin Tolisso are all over COVID. Bayern remain on course for a 10th league title in a row with a six-point lead at the top, creating a new Bundesliga record by scoring in 67 straight matches. Furthermore, in their last 115 Bundesliga matches, Bayern have failed to score only twice, both against Leipzig, with the last of those coming in Feb 2020.RB Leipzig entered the season with title aspirations under the jettisoned Jesse Marsch, but have already suffered seven defeats, as many as the whole of last season. Leipzig broke their away duck recently with their first away win of the season with new coach Domenico Tedesco finding the winning touch, and come to Munich on the back of three straight league wins.After reaching 300 league goals last month with his 14th Bundesliga hat-trick, Robert Lewandowski will fancy his chances of adding to his tally of 23 league goals for the season.

Much will depend on the fitness of the the much-vaunted Erling "Machine" Haaland in front of 10,000 fans in Dortmund, while the away side have their own goal machine in Czech hitman Patrik Schick with 18 goals.Leverkusen have scored a club record 49 goals after 20 league games and their last six games have seen 27 goals in total, so goals can be expected at both ends here.

A genuine relegation six-pointer.Wolfsburg have failed to score in their last four league games, remain winless in 11 games in all competitions (nine defeats), also suffering a miserable Champions League exit.Having already conceded 52 goals, Greuther Fuerth have the worst defensive record in the league, but have shown signs of improvement of late, with nine of their 10 points coming in their last six games.Fuerth are on a club record four game unbeaten run and the bottom side will be confident of nicking a win to drag the "Wolves" into the relegation mix.

RB Leipzig have already suffered eight defeats, one more than during the whole of last season. But new coach Domenico Tedesco seems to have rejuvenated Leipzig as evidenced by pushing the champions-in-waiting Bayern all the way last weekend.FC Koln only just avoided relegation last season but are flying in sixth spot this campaign thanks to 14 goals from Frenchman Anthony Modeste, 42% of Koln's goals tally this term.With keyman Modeste ruled out, however, Leipzig should comfortably claim the points in front of 15,000 home fans as they close in on a Champions League qualification spot.

Bochum's team news states that Erhan Masovic and skipper Anthony Losilla could both return after COVID, but Eduard Löwen has tested positive.Jürgen Locadia has joined from Brighton to boost attacking options, while Danny Blum is still having to be patient with regards a comeback from injury. A fierce local derby awaits with both sides (unusually) at the right end of the table.FC Koln only just avoided relegation last season, but are riding high in eighth currently thanks to 15 goals from Frenchman Anthony Modeste, over 40% of their goals tally.Bayer Leverkusen have notched a club-record 64 goals after 25 league games, with their last 11 matches seeing 50 goals in total. Leverkusen grabbed a decent point at Bayern last weekend and despite a tough Europa League trip in midweek, can claim the derby bragging rights against the Billy Goats.

Borussia Dortmund's team news states that A COVID outbreak at Mainz forced the postponement of last weekend's game, so Borussia Dortmund will have had time to get a few players fit and back into the action.Coach Marco Rose is hoping that defenders Manuel Akanji and Dan-Axel Zagadou Zagadou will make the squad.Borussia Dortmund's defender Raphael Guerreiro tested positive for the Coronavirus on Tuesday along with Mats Hummels.Steffen Tigges has broken his ankle and will miss the rest of the season.Mateu Morey remains on the sidelines with a serious knee injury, and former skipper Marcel Schmelzer continues his comeback from a knee injury.Coach Marco Rose said Gio Reyna has had a week of training with the team and may be an option here, while Erling Haaland is fit but will not start. Andres Andrade has an ankle problem but may have to play through the pain barrier.

Just over 110 kilometres separate the two sides in Westphalia, Germany.Borussia Dortmund continue to sweat on the fitness of Erling Haaland and would be wise not to underestimate the visitors, despite their recent spate of COVID cases.Arminia Bielefeld are the epitome of efficiency, amassing 25 points despite only finding the net 22 times.Dortmund have failed to score only once in their last 56 Bundesliga games and should have the quality to win this on home soil, despite Haaland's prolonged absence.

Eintracht Frankfurt's team news states that Rotation could be the order of the day after a strenuous Europa League trip to play Real Betis in midweek.Christopher Lenz is available after suspension, while Danny da Costa could return after a knock kept him out last weekend.Ragnar Ache will be out for several weeks with a muscle injury, while Diant Ramaj has undergone a knee op.Daichi Kamada is fit after a muscle injury, while Martin Hinteregger has a pelvic injury, which needs monitoring.Bochum's team news states that Maximm Leitsch and Luis Hartwig both tested positive for COVID.Cristian Gamboa is suspended after picking up five yellows, while Bochum are monitoring Jürgen Locadia's back problem.Elvis Rexhbecaj is available again after suspension and Danny Blum is fit again after a long-term niggle. A probable line up is therefore difficult to predict.What we do know is that defender Jeremiah St. Juste is ruled out with shoulder pain, while back up keeper Finn Dahmen has damaged ankle ligaments and will be out for 4-6 weeks. Seven points behind Bayern, this is Borussia Dortmund's precious game in hand.Robin Zentner has kept eight clean sheets and Mainz have won five in a row at home, before a COVID outbreak stalled their season.Borussia Dortmund, even with the fit-again Erling Haaland, would be wise not to underestimate Mainz, despite their recent spate of COVID cases.Dortmund have failed to score only once in their last 57 Bundesliga games and if this game goes ahead, it is hard to see Mainz being able to field an experienced Bundesliga side so Dortmund should win comfortably.

Bochum's team news states that Maxim Leitsch and Luis Hartwig are both still struggling with the effects of COVID, while Milos Pantovic and Robert Tesche are the latest to test positive for the virus and will miss this one.Danilo Soares is still struggling with injury, so Bochum need a big reshuffle in defence as Cristian Gamboa is available after suspension, but has now tested positive for COVID as well.Danny Blum has a muscle injury, but key man Simon Zoller is nearing a return after a long term ACL injury.Head Coach Thomas Reis has tested positive for COVID.Borussia M.Gladbach's team news states that Under-pressure coach Adi Hütter missed last weekend's win due to COVID and remains absent for this one.Defender Nico Elvedi is the latest to test positive for COVID, so Marvin Friedrich will likely make his comeback having recovered from the flu. German international Jonas Hofmann is nearing a return from a muscle injury.Mamadou Doucouré has a muscle injury, but Jordan Beyer is available after suspension and the influential Lars Stindl made his comeback last weekend after a knee problem.

Bochum have failed to score in eight games this term, and lost a lead for the first time this season in the 2-1 defeat at Eintracht Frankfurt last weekend.Gladbach secured their first clean sheet in four months in last weekend's vital win.With Bochum struggling with a host of COVID absences, Gladbach can win this to move further from relegation danger.

Hertha Berlin's team news states that Coach Tayfun Korkut was fired on Sunday after five straight defeats. Norway's goalkeeper Rune Jarstein is ruled out with a knee injury.Kevin-Prince Boateng has a muscle injury, while Suat Serdar and Niklas Stark are both over COVID. Marton Dardai has recovered from an ankle problem.Stevan Jovetic, a key man to any potential Hertha revival, has a muscle injury that needs careful monitoring.Hoffenheim's team news states that Benjamin Hübner could return after COVID, while Diadie Samassekou is suspended after picking up five yellows.Philipp Pentke missed last weekend due to COVID and remains doubtful.Håvard Nordtveit pulled a thigh muscle and will be out for several weeks. Sebastian Rudy suffered a muscle tear and will be out for a few weeks as well. Chris Richards has a foot injury.Ermin Bicakcic and Robert Skov are nearing returns from ACL and thigh injuries, respectively.

Only Fuerth have conceded more goals than Hertha (60) who also have the worst record in 2022 without a win all year with the fewest points (2) and goals scored (6). Before taking a creditable point against the champions-in-waiting Bayern, Hoffenheim had won their last four games, coming from behind in two of those, showing just why they have garnered a league-best 21 points from losing positions this season.Hertha will look for a new manager bounce with the experienced Felix Magath in charge but an in-form Hoffenheim side should win this comfortably against the beleaguered capital city side.

This is a genuine relegation six-pointer and the fear of defeat could mean goals are at a premium.3-time Bundesliga champions Stuttgart have kept just three clean sheets all season, but are unbeaten in their last two to move out of the automatic relegation spots.Despite flirting with the drop on numerous occasions, Augsburg have always managed to escape the Bundesliga drop and won the reverse fixture 4-1, the only occasion in their last 34 games FCA have scored more than two goals.Stuttgart have to carry on the winning momentum, but Augsburg may have the nous to grab a point.

Seeking a tenth Bundesliga in a row, Bayern's lead at the top has been whittled down to just four points with eight games remaining. Frankfurt have a tough Europa League game to recover from, while RB Leipzig were given a bye into the next round so will be totally refreshed in comparison.RB Leipzig have already suffered eight league defeats, one more than during the whole of last season, but new coach Domenico Tedesco has rejuvenated Leipzig, who have moved into fourth on goal difference.With Eintracht tired from European exertions, Leipzig should comfortably claim the points on home soil as they chase down that Champions League qualification spot.

Borussia Dortmund won their game in hand in midweek with a late goal in Mainz and find themselves a mere four points behind Bayern all of a sudden.FC Koln only just avoided relegation last season, but are riding high in 7th currently thanks to 15 goals from Frenchman Anthony Modeste, around 40% of their goals tally.Borussia Dortmund, even with the fit-again Erling Haaland, would be wise not to underestimate Koln with a fervent home crowd of 50,000 fans roaring their favourites on.Dortmund have failed to score only once in their last 58 Bundesliga games and should have the quality to win this to maintain their title challenge.

Kingsley Ehizibue could line up in defence.Timo Horn and Anthony Modeste are both feeling unwell. Kingsley Schindler will miss this one because of "personal reasons."

Union Berlin have failed to score in five out of seven league matches since the departure of key man Max Kruse to slip below the visitors.FC Koln avoided relegation last season by the skin of their teeth, but are riding high in seventh currently thanks to 15 goals from Frenchman Anthony Modeste, around 40% of their goals tally.That said, with main man Modeste missing, Union can go above Koln with a win and can nick the three points in front of a sell-out crowd of just over 22,000 for the first time since November last year.

Greuther Fuerth have conceded 70 goals, the worst defensive record in the league, with 46 conceded away from home, picking up just a single point on their travels.Frankfurt will naturally have one eye on their attractive Europa League tie against Barcelona on Thursday.Frankfurt should claim the points against relegation-bound Fuerth as they chase down a Europa League qualification spot, but the scoreline may be closer than their table position might suggest.

Looking good for a 10th Bundesliga in a row, Bayern's lead at the top is a very healthy six points with seven games remaining. The two teams with the best defensive records meet. Only Bayern have conceded fewer goals (28) than Freiburg's 29, but Bayern have scored almost twice as many (81) compared to the home side's 43.Unheralded Freiburg are chasing Champions League qualification and talented Dutch keeper Mark Flekken has kept the joint most clean sheets of nine.Bayern will be confident of stretching their Bundesliga record of scoring in 74 straight matches and can nick a narrow win.

Bochum have failed to score in nine games this term, including the abandoned 2-0 defeat last time out before the international break against Gladbach.Hoffenheim have garnered a league-best 21 points from losing positions this season, showing their mettle repeatedly.These two sides lost last time out, but Hoffenheim can bounce back against beleaguered Bochum, who may yet get sucked into relegation trouble.

After a 1-1 draw with Koln, Borussia Dortmund lag six points behind Bayern with seven games remaining with their title hopes probably gone for another year.RB Leipzig have already suffered eight league defeats, one more than during the whole of last season, but are the best team in 2022 with 23 points in 10 games, with a goal difference of 27:8, Leipzig's only defeat coming against the champions Bayern.Dortmund have failed to score only once in their last 59 Bundesliga games and with the fit-again Erling Haaland goals can be expected at both ends in front of a sell-out crowd of 81,365 fans.

Another relegation six-pointer and the fear of defeat could mean goals are at a premium.Despite flirting with the drop on numerous occasions, Augsburg have always managed to escape the Bundesliga drop, but they are cutting it fine again this season.After a run of 11 games without a win in all competitions, Wolfsburg improved initially since the surprise arrival of the mercurial Max Kruse, but are not quite clear of relegation danger just yet.Augsburg can close to within two points of the Wolves and may nick this on home soil.
